original: Ṛgveda
analyzed: ṛgveda
translated: Ṛg Veda

original: somasya mā tavasaṃ vakṣy agne vahniṃ cakartha vidathe yajadhyai /
analyzed: somasya mā tavasam vakṣi agne vahnim cakartha vidathe yajadhyai
translated: O Agni, I will praise the strength of Soma, I have made the fire to be worshipped in the assembly.

original: devāṃ acchā dīdyad yuñje adriṃ śamāye agne tanvaṃ juṣasva //
analyzed: devām acchā dīdyat yuñje adrim śamāye agne tanvam juṣasva
translated: Shining, I yoke the stone to go to the gods. O Agni, be pleased with your own body.

original: prāñcaṃ yajñaṃ cakṛma vardhatāṃ gīḥ samidbhir agniṃ namasā duvasyan /
analyzed: prāñcam yajñam cakṛma vardhatām gīḥ samidbhiḥ agnim namasā duvasyan
translated: We have made the sacrifice go forward. Let the praise be increased. Serving with fuel and homage, honor Agni.

original: divaḥ śaśāsur vidathā kavīnāṃ gṛtsāya cit tavase gātum īṣuḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ śaśāsuḥ vidathā kavīnām gṛtsāya cit tavase gātum īṣuḥ
translated: The wise ones have ordered the rites of heaven. They have sent forth the path even for the powerful Gritsa.

original: mayo dadhe medhiraḥ pūtadakṣo divaḥ subandhur januṣā pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: mayaḥ dadhe medhiraḥ pūta dakṣaḥ divaḥ su bandhuḥ januṣā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The wise one, of pure power, has placed the light, the good friend of heaven by birth, of the earth.

original: avindann u darśatam apsv antar devāso agnim apasi svasṝṇām //
analyzed: avindan u darśatam apsu antar devāsaḥ agnim apasi svasṝṇām
translated: The gods have found the beautiful Agni in the waters, the brother of his own sisters.

original: avardhayan subhagaṃ sapta yahvīḥ śvetaṃ jajñānam aruṣam mahitvā /🔽śiśuṃ na jātam abhy ārur aśvā devāso agniṃ janiman vapuṣyan //
analyzed: avardhayan subhagam sapta yahvīḥ śvetam jajñānam aruṣam mahitvā  śiśum na jātam abhī āruḥ aśvāḥ devāsaḥ agnim janiman vapuṣyan
translated: The seven young ones have increased the fortunate one, the white one, the red one, by greatness.🔽The horses have mounted the child as soon as born, the gods, making Agni beautiful in birth.

original: śukrebhir aṅgai raja ātatanvān kratum punānaḥ kavibhiḥ pavitraiḥ /🔽śocir vasānaḥ pary āyur apāṃ śriyo mimīte bṛhatīr anūnāḥ //
analyzed: śukrebhiḥ aṅgaiḥ rajaḥ ātatanvān kratum punānaḥ kavibhiḥ pavitraiḥ  śociḥ vasānaḥ pari āyuḥ apām śriyaḥ mimīte bṛhatīḥ anūnāḥ
translated: With his bright limbs he has stretched out in the realm, purifying the sacrifice with the purifying wise ones.🔽Wearing the flame, he has surrounded the life of the waters. He measures out the great, unaging glories.

original: vavrājā sīm anadatīr adabdhā divo yahvīr avasānā anagnāḥ /
analyzed: vavrāja sīm a nadatīḥ adabdhāḥ divaḥ yahvīḥ avasānāḥ anagnāḥ
translated: The young ones of heaven have gone forth, the undaunted, the roaring, the unprotected, the unburned.

original: sanā atra yuvatayaḥ sayonīr ekaṃ garbhaṃ dadhire sapta vāṇīḥ //
analyzed: sanāḥ atra yuvatayaḥ sayonīḥ ekam garbham dadhire sapta vāṇīḥ
translated: The ancient maidens, of one womb, have here conceived one embryo, the seven tongues.

original: stīrṇā asya saṃhato viśvarūpā ghṛtasya yonau sravathe madhūnām /
analyzed: stīrṇāḥ asya saṃhataḥ viśva rūpāḥ ghṛtasya yonau sravathe madhūnām
translated: Strewn is his union, of all forms, in the womb of ghee, flow ye of meath.

original: asthur atra dhenavaḥ pinvamānā mahī dasmasya mātarā samīcī //
analyzed: asthuḥ atra dhenavaḥ pinvamānāḥ mahī dasmasya mātarā samīcī
translated: Here have the swelling cows stood, the two great mothers of the wondrous one, in unison.

original: babhrāṇaḥ sūno sahaso vy adyaud dadhānaḥ śukrā rabhasā vapūṃṣi /
analyzed: babhrāṇaḥ sūno sahasaḥ vi adyaut dadhānaḥ śukrā rabhasā vapūṃṣi
translated: The son of strength hath shone, spreading his bright and rapid forms, bearing them.

original: ścotanti dhārā madhuno ghṛtasya vṛṣā yatra vāvṛdhe kāvyena //
analyzed: ścotanti dhārāḥ madhunaḥ ghṛtasya vṛṣā yatra vāvṛdhe kāvyena
translated: The streams of meath and ghee trickle where the bull hath waxed in power by his wisdom.

original: pituś cid ūdhar januṣā viveda vy asya dhārā asṛjad vi dhenāḥ /
analyzed: pituḥ cit ūdhar januṣā viveda vi asya dhārāḥ asṛjat vi dhenāḥ
translated: He hath known the udder of his father by his birth; he hath sent forth his streams and his thoughts.

original: guhā carantaṃ sakhibhiḥ śivebhir divo yahvībhir na guhā babhūva //
analyzed: guhā carantam sakhibhiḥ śivebhiḥ divaḥ yahvībhiḥ na guhā babhūva
translated: He who moveth in the secret place with his auspicious friends hath not been hidden by the young maidens of the sky.

original: pituś ca garbhaṃ janituś ca babhre pūrvīr eko adhayat pīpyānāḥ /
analyzed: pituḥ ca garbham janituḥ ca babhre pūrvīḥ ekaḥ adhayat pīpyānāḥ
translated: He hath sought the embryo of the father and of the mother; alone he hath drunk the many swelling (streams).

original: vṛṣṇe sapatnī śucaye sabandhū ubhe asmai manuṣye ni pāhi //🔽urau mahāṃ anibādhe vavardhāpo agniṃ yaśasaḥ saṃ hi pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣṇe sapatnī śucaye sabandhū ubhe asmai manuṣye ni pāhi  urau mahān anibādhe vavardha apaḥ agnim yaśasaḥ sam hi pūrvīḥ
translated: To the strong one, the pure one, with kinsmen, with wives, protect thou both the human (streams) for him.🔽In the wide, uncovered (womb) he hath grown great; the many glorious waters have generated Agni.

original: ṛtasya yonāv aśayad damūnā jāmīnām agnir apasi svasṝṇām //
analyzed: ṛtasya yonau aśayat damūnāḥ jāmīnām agniḥ apasi svasṝṇām
translated: He hath lain in the womb of holy order, the guest of the people, Agni, the brother of his sisters.

original: akro na babhriḥ samithe mahīnāṃ didṛkṣeyaḥ sūnave bhāṛjīkaḥ /🔽ud usriyā janitā yo jajānāpāṃ garbho nṛtamo yahvo agniḥ //
analyzed: akraḥ na babhriḥ samithe mahīnām didṛkṣeyaḥ sūnave bhāṛjīkaḥ  ud usriyāḥ janitā yaḥ jajāna apām garbhaḥ nṛtamaḥ yahvaḥ agniḥ
translated: The bright one who in the assembly of the great hath been made the herald, who looketh on his son,🔽The youthful Agni, best of men, who hath generated the bright ones, the offspring of the waters.

original: apāṃ garbhaṃ darśatam oṣadhīnāṃ vanā jajāna subhagā virūpam /
analyzed: apām garbham darśatam oṣadhīnām vanā jajāna subhagā virūpam
translated: The waters' germ, the plants' most lovely form, the woods have generated, the wondrous one.

original: devāsaś cin manasā saṃ hi jagmuḥ paniṣṭhaṃ jātaṃ tavasaṃ duvasyan //
analyzed: devāsaḥ cit manasā sam hi jagmuḥ paniṣṭham jātam tavasam duvasyan
translated: Even the gods have gone with thought to him, to the most excellent one, to the mighty one, to serve the born.

original: bṛhanta id bhānavo bhāṛjīkam agniṃ sacanta vidyuto na śukrāḥ /
analyzed: bṛhantaḥ id bhānavaḥ bhāṛjīkam agnim sacanta vidyutaḥ na śukrāḥ
translated: The bright beams attend on Agni, the bright one, as the pure lightnings attend on the lofty one.

original: guheva vṛddhaṃ sadasi sve antar apāra ūrve amṛtaṃ duhānāḥ //
analyzed: guhā iva vṛddham sadasi sve antar apāre ūrve amṛtam duhānāḥ
translated: As in his own abode, the well-ordered one, the immortal one, the full one, the full-uddered one.

original: īḷe ca tvā yajamāno havirbhir īḷe sakhitvaṃ sumatiṃ nikāmaḥ /
analyzed: īḍe ca tvā yajamānaḥ havirbhiḥ īḍe sakhi tvam sumatim nikāmaḥ
translated: I praise thee, O Agni, the sacrificer with oblations, I praise thee, the friend, for the sake of good will and desire.

original: devair avo mimīhi saṃ jaritre rakṣā ca no damyebhir anīkaiḥ //
analyzed: devaiḥ avaḥ mimīhi sam jaritre rakṣa ca naḥ damyebhiḥ anīkaiḥ
translated: With the gods, measure thou favour for the singer, and protect us with thy domestic forms.

original: upakṣetāras tava supraṇīte 'gne viśvāni dhanyā dadhānāḥ /
analyzed: upakṣetāraḥ tava su praṇīte gne viśvāni dhanyā dadhānāḥ
translated: The leaders of thy train, O well-guided Agni, bearing all treasures,

original: suretasā śravasā tuñjamānā abhi ṣyāma pṛtanāyūṃr adevān //
analyzed: su retasā śravasā tuñjamānāḥ abhi syāma pṛtanāyūn adevān
translated: With good seed, striving with glory, may we conquer the godless in the battles.

original: ā devānām abhavaḥ ketur agne mandro viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān /
analyzed: ā devānām abhavaḥ ketuḥ agne mandraḥ viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān
translated: Thou hast become the ensign of the gods, O Agni, the gladdener, knowing all the mysteries.

original: prati martāṃ avāsayo damūnā anu devān rathiro yāsi sādhan //
analyzed: prati martām avāsayaḥ damūnāḥ anu devān rathiraḥ yāsi sādhan
translated: Thou, O mortal, hast entered into the house, O bountiful one, thou goest to the gods, O charioteer, accomplishing (thy task).

original: ni duroṇe amṛto martyānāṃ rājā sasāda vidathāni sādhan /
analyzed: ni duroṇe amṛtaḥ martyānām rājā sasāda vidathāni sādhan
translated: The immortal king in the house of mortals, accomplishing the rites, hath sat down.

original: ghṛtapratīka urviyā vy adyaud agnir viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān //🔽ā no gahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhir mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ saraṇyan /
analyzed: ghṛta pratīkaḥ urviyā vi adyaut agniḥ viśvāni kāvyāni vidvān  ā naḥ gahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhiḥ mahān mahībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ saraṇyan
translated: Agni, the all-knowing, the face of ghee, hath shone forth with his greatness.🔽Come to us with thy friendly and auspicious friendships, the great one, seeking to help with thy mighty aids.

original: asme rayim bahulaṃ saṃtarutraṃ suvācam bhāgaṃ yaśasaṃ kṛdhī naḥ //
analyzed: asme rayim bahulam saṃtarutram su vācam bhāgam yaśasam kṛdhī naḥ
translated: Grant us wealth in abundance, easy to obtain, well-spoken, a share, glorious.

original: etā te agne janimā sanāni pra pūrvyāya nūtanāni vocam /🔽mahānti vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā janmañjanman nihito jātavedāḥ //
analyzed: etā te agne janimā sanāni pra pūrvyāya nūtanāni vocam  mahānti vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtā imā janman janman nihitaḥ jātavedāḥ
translated: These, O Agni, are thy ancient generations; I proclaim the new ones to the ancient one.🔽Great are the oblations for the strong one, O all-knower, placed at each birth.

original: janmañjanman nihito jātavedā viśvāmitrebhir idhyate ajasraḥ /🔽tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma //🔽imaṃ yajñaṃ sahasāvan tvaṃ no devatrā dhehi sukrato rarāṇaḥ /
analyzed: janman janman nihitaḥ jātavedāḥ viśvāmitrebhiḥ idhyate ajasraḥ  tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma  imam yajñam sahasāvan tvam naḥ devatrā dhehi su krato rarāṇaḥ
translated: At each birth, the all-knower is placed, kindled by the Vishvamitra priests, the imperishable one.🔽May we be in the favor of that adorable one, in his good will and graciousness.🔽O thou who hast a thousand powers, O God, place this sacrifice for us in the company of the gods, O wise one, bestowing (favors).

original: pra yaṃsi hotar bṛhatīr iṣo no 'gne mahi draviṇam ā yajasva //
analyzed: pra yaṃsi hotar bṛhatīḥ iṣaḥ naḥ gne mahi draviṇam ā yajasva
translated: O Hotar, O Agni, grant us great gifts, bestow on us great riches.

original: iḷām agne purudaṃsaṃ saniṃ goḥ śaśvattamaṃ havamānāya sādha /🔽syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme //
analyzed: iḷām agne purudaṃsam sanim goḥ śaśvattamam havamānāya sādha  syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te sumatiḥ bhūtu asme
translated: O Agni, make ready for the worshipper the most desirable portion of food, the gain of cattle, the most lasting.🔽May we have a son, a child, born for increase. O Agni, may that be thy most gracious favour to us.

original: vaiśvānarāya dhiṣaṇām ṛtāvṛdhe ghṛtaṃ na pūtam agnaye janāmasi /
analyzed: vaiśvānarāya dhiṣaṇām ṛtāvṛdhe ghṛtam na pūtam agnaye janāmasi
translated: To Vaisvānara, the supporter, who increases the truth, we offer to Agni the purified ghee.

original: dvitā hotāram manuṣaś ca vāghato dhiyā rathaṃ na kuliśaḥ sam ṛṇvati //
analyzed: dvitā hotāram manuṣaḥ ca vāghataḥ dhiyā ratham na kuliśaḥ sam ṛṇvati
translated: The two-fold priest, the invoker of men, with his thought, like an axe, puts together the chariot.

original: sa rocayaj januṣā rodasī ubhe sa mātror abhavat putra īḍyaḥ /
analyzed: sa rocayat januṣā rodasī ubhe sa mātroḥ abhavat putraḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: He illumines with his birth both the worlds, he, the son, is worthy of praise from his mother.

original: havyavāḷ agnir ajaraś canohito dūḷabho viśām atithir vibhāvasuḥ //
analyzed: havyavāṭ agniḥ ajaraḥ canohitaḥ dūḍabhaḥ viśām atithiḥ vibhāvasuḥ
translated: Agni, the bearer of oblations, the undecaying, the well-disposed, the swift, the guest of the people, the illuminator.

original: kratvā dakṣasya taruṣo vidharmaṇi devāso agniṃ janayanta cittibhiḥ /
analyzed: kratvā dakṣasya taruṣaḥ vidharmaṇi devāsaḥ agnim janayanta cittibhiḥ
translated: By the wisdom of Daksha, the creator, the gods generated Agni with their thoughts,

original: rurucānam bhānunā jyotiṣā mahām atyaṃ na vājaṃ saniṣyann upa bruve //
analyzed: rurucānam bhānunā jyotiṣā mahām atyam na vājam saniṣyan upa bruve
translated: The shining one with light, the great one, I address him, desiring to win the prize like a horse.

original: ā mandrasya saniṣyanto vareṇyaṃ vṛṇīmahe ahrayaṃ vājam ṛgmiyam /
analyzed: ā mandrasya saniṣyantaḥ vareṇyam vṛṇīmahe ahrayam vājam ṛgmiyam
translated: Desiring the pleasant one, we choose the most excellent, the unaging prize worthy of praise.

original: rātim bhṛgūṇām uśijaṃ kavikratum agniṃ rājantaṃ divyena śociṣā //
analyzed: rātim bhṛgūṇām uśijam kavi kratum agnim rājantam divyena śociṣā
translated: The gift of the Bhṛgus, the eager one, of wise power, Agni, the shining one, with his heavenly radiance.

original: agniṃ sumnāya dadhire puro janā vājaśravasam iha vṛktabarhiṣaḥ /
analyzed: agnim sumnāya dadhire puras janāḥ vāja śravasam iha vṛkta barhiṣaḥ
translated: The people have set Agni in the front for bliss, for the sake of strength, here, those who strew the sacred grass.

original: yatasrucaḥ surucaṃ viśvadevyaṃ rudraṃ yajñānāṃ sādhadiṣṭim apasām //🔽pāvakaśoce tava hi kṣayam pari hotar yajñeṣu vṛktabarhiṣo naraḥ /
analyzed: yata srucaḥ su rucam viśvadevyam rudram yajñānām sādhat iṣṭim apasām  pāvaka śoce tava hi kṣayam pari hotar yajñeṣu vṛkta barhiṣaḥ naraḥ
translated: The priests, with uplifted ladles, the all-god, the radiant one, Rudra, the fulfiller of sacrifices, the best of those who go on their way.🔽O Agni, whose radiance is pure, the men, O priest, at sacrifices, with strewn grass, sit around thy dwelling.

original: agne duva icchamānāsa āpyam upāsate draviṇaṃ dhehi tebhyaḥ //
analyzed: agne duvaḥ icchamānāsaḥ āpyam upāsate draviṇam dhehi tebhyaḥ
translated: O Agni, seek to serve thee, desiring thy favour. Bestow wealth on them.

original: ā rodasī apṛṇad ā svar mahaj jātaṃ yad enam apaso adhārayan /
analyzed: ā rodasī apṛṇat ā svar mahat jātam yat enam apasaḥ adhārayan
translated: He hath filled the two world-halves, the great heaven, when the skilful ones have taken him up, when he is born.

original: so adhvarāya pari ṇīyate kavir atyo na vājasātaye canohitaḥ //
analyzed: saḥ adhvarāya pari ṇīyate kaviḥ atyaḥ na vājasātaye canohitaḥ
translated: He, the sage, is led around for the sacrifice, like a horse to the winning of strength, being accepted with joy.

original: namasyata havyadātiṃ svadhvaraṃ duvasyata damyaṃ jātavedasam /🔽rathīr ṛtasya bṛhato vicarṣaṇir agnir devānām abhavat purohitaḥ //
analyzed: namasyata havya dātim su adhvaram duvasyata damyam jātavedasam  rathīḥ ṛtasya bṛhataḥ vicarṣaṇiḥ agniḥ devānām abhavat purohitaḥ
translated: Worship the bearer of oblations, the well-purified one, serve the domestic one, the all-knower.🔽The charioteer of great sacrifice, the very active one, Agni hath become the priest of the gods.

original: tisro yahvasya samidhaḥ parijmano 'gner apunann uśijo amṛtyavaḥ /
analyzed: tisraḥ yahvasya samidhaḥ parijmanaḥ gneḥ apunan uśijaḥ amṛtyavaḥ
translated: The three kindling-sticks of the youthful one, of the far-reaching one, of Agni, the eager ones, the immortal ones, have renewed.

original: tāsām ekām adadhur martye bhujam u lokam u dve upa jāmim īyatuḥ //
analyzed: tāsām ekām adadhuḥ martye bhujam u lokam u dve upa jāmim īyatuḥ
translated: Of these they have placed one in the mortal world for the people, the two worlds have gone to the kinsman.

original: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatim mānuṣīr iṣaḥ saṃ sīm akṛṇvan svadhitiṃ na tejase /
analyzed: viśām kavim viśpatim mānuṣīḥ iṣaḥ sam sīm akṛṇvan svadhitim na tejase
translated: The men have made him their wise lord, the lord of the people, their axe for the wood, to make their food more powerful.

original: sa udvato nivato yāti veviṣat sa garbham eṣu bhuvaneṣu dīdharat //
analyzed: saḥ udvataḥ nivataḥ yāti veviṣat sa garbham eṣu bhuvaneṣu dīdharat
translated: He goes, the swift one, to the high and low, he has placed the germ in these worlds.

original: sa jinvate jaṭhareṣu prajajñivān vṛṣā citreṣu nānadan na siṃhaḥ /
analyzed: sa jinvate jaṭhareṣu prajajñivān vṛṣā citreṣu nānadan na siṃhaḥ
translated: He, the powerful one, the roaring lion, the one who has spread out in the bellies (of the cows), in the variegated (cows),

original: vaiśvānaraḥ pṛthupājā amartyo vasu ratnā dayamāno vi dāśuṣe //
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ pṛthu pājāḥ amartyaḥ vasu ratnā dayamānaḥ vi dāśuṣe
translated: Vaisvānara, the immortal one with wide paths, bestowing wealth and treasures on the worshipper.

original: vaiśvānaraḥ pratnathā nākam āruhad divas pṛṣṭham bhandamānaḥ sumanmabhiḥ /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ pratnathā nākam āruhat divaḥ pṛṣṭham bhandamānaḥ su manmabhiḥ
translated: Vaisvānara, in the ancient way, has ascended the vault, the back of the sky, roaring with the well-minded ones.

original: sa pūrvavaj janayañ jantave dhanaṃ samānam ajmam pary eti jāgṛviḥ //
analyzed: sa pūrvavat janayam jantave dhanam samānam ajmam pari eti jāgṛviḥ
translated: He, the one who generates wealth for the living being as before, goes around the common path, the watchful one.

original: ṛtāvānaṃ yajñiyaṃ vipram ukthyam ā yaṃ dadhe mātariśvā divi kṣayam /
analyzed: ṛtāvānam yajñiyam vipram ukthyam ā yam dadhe mātariśvā divi kṣayam
translated: The one who is righteous, worthy of sacrifice, the sage worthy of praise, whom Matariśvan has placed in the sky as a dwelling,

original: taṃ citrayāmaṃ harikeśam īmahe sudītim agniṃ suvitāya navyase //
analyzed: tam citra yāmam hari keśam īmahe su dītim agnim suvitāya navyase
translated: We implore that wonderfully variegated one with golden hair, Agni of good light, for new prosperity.

original: śuciṃ na yāmann iṣiraṃ svardṛśaṃ ketuṃ divo rocanasthām uṣarbudham /
analyzed: śucim na yāman iṣiram svar dṛśam ketum divaḥ rocana sthām uṣarbudham
translated: The pure one, the swift one, the seer of the light, the banner of the sky, standing in the luminous realm, the one who rises at dawn,

original: agnim mūrdhānaṃ divo apratiṣkutaṃ tam īmahe namasā vājinam bṛhat //
analyzed: agnim mūrdhānam divaḥ apratiṣkutam tam īmahe namasā vājinam bṛhat
translated: We implore with reverence that powerful Agni, the head of the sky, the unobstructed one, the great one.

original: mandraṃ hotāraṃ śucim advayāvinaṃ damūnasam ukthyaṃ viśvacarṣaṇim /
analyzed: mandram hotāram śucim advayāvinam damūnasam ukthyam viśvacarṣaṇim
translated: The cheerful Hotar, the pure one, the infallible, the bountiful, worthy of praise, the all-impelling one,

original: rathaṃ na citraṃ vapuṣāya darśatam manurhitaṃ sadam id rāya īmahe //
analyzed: ratham na citram vapuṣāya darśatam manuḥ hitam sadam id rāyaḥ īmahe
translated: We seek for wealth the wondrously beautiful form, like a chariot, ever beneficial to men.

original: vaiśvānarāya pṛthupājase vipo ratnā vidhanta dharuṇeṣu gātave /
analyzed: vaiśvānarāya pṛthu pājase vipaḥ ratnā vidhanta dharuṇeṣu gātave
translated: To Vaisvānara, of wide sway, the wise one, they fashion jewels to be borne on the earth.

original: agnir hi devāṃ amṛto duvasyaty athā dharmāṇi sanatā na dūduṣat //
analyzed: agniḥ hi devān amṛtaḥ duvasyati athā dharmāṇi sanatā na dūduṣat
translated: For Agni, the immortal one, serves the gods, and then he, the eternal one, does not violate the laws.

original: antar dūto rodasī dasma īyate hotā niṣatto manuṣaḥ purohitaḥ /🔽kṣayam bṛhantam pari bhūṣati dyubhir devebhir agnir iṣito dhiyāvasuḥ //
analyzed: antar dūtaḥ rodasī dasmaḥ īyate hotā niṣattaḥ manuṣaḥ purohitaḥ  kṣayam bṛhantam pari bhūṣati dyubhiḥ devebhiḥ agniḥ iṣitaḥ dhiyāvasuḥ
translated: The wondrous one moves as the inner messenger between the two worlds, the Hotar, seated, the priest of men.🔽He adorns the great abode with his lights, Agni, impelled by the gods, rich in thought.

original: ketuṃ yajñānāṃ vidathasya sādhanaṃ viprāso agnim mahayanta cittibhiḥ /
analyzed: ketum yajñānām vidathasya sādhanam viprāsaḥ agnim mahayanta cittibhiḥ
translated: The sages with their thoughts magnify Agni, the leader of sacrifices, the accomplisher of the assembly.

original: apāṃsi yasminn adhi saṃdadhur giras tasmin sumnāni yajamāna ā cake //
analyzed: apāṃsi yasmin adhi saṃdadhuḥ giraḥ tasmin sumnāni yajamānaḥ ā cake
translated: In him they have placed the hymns, in him the sacrificer places his hopes.

original: pitā yajñānām asuro vipaścitāṃ vimānam agnir vayunaṃ ca vāghatām /
analyzed: pitā yajñānām asuraḥ vipaścitām vimānam agniḥ vayunam ca vāghatām
translated: The father of sacrifices, the Asura of the wise, the measure of Agni, and the arrangement of the priests,

original: ā viveśa rodasī bhūrivarpasā purupriyo bhandate dhāmabhiḥ kaviḥ //
analyzed: ā viveśa rodasī bhūri varpasā puru priyaḥ bhandate dhāmabhiḥ kaviḥ
translated: The all-shaping one has entered the two worlds. The beloved of many, the sage shines with his own natures.

original: candram agniṃ candrarathaṃ harivrataṃ vaiśvānaram apsuṣadaṃ svarvidam /
analyzed: candram agnim candra ratham hari vratam vaiśvānaram apsuṣadam svar vidam
translated: The Moon, Agni, the Moon-chariot, the one with the horse's vow, Vaiśvānara, the one who dwells in the waters, the one who finds the heaven,

original: vigāhaṃ tūrṇiṃ taviṣībhir āvṛtam bhūrṇiṃ devāsa iha suśriyaṃ dadhuḥ //
analyzed: vigāham tūrṇim taviṣībhiḥ āvṛtam bhūrṇim devāsaḥ iha su śriyam dadhuḥ
translated: The one who penetrates, the swift one, surrounded by powers, the radiant one, the gods here have placed the one with great glory.

original: agnir devebhir manuṣaś ca jantubhis tanvāno yajñam purupeśasaṃ dhiyā /
analyzed: agniḥ devebhiḥ manuṣaḥ ca jantubhiḥ tanvānaḥ yajñam puru peśasam dhiyā
translated: Agni, with the gods and with the people of Manu, extending the sacrifice, the one with many lords, with thought,

original: rathīr antar īyate sādhadiṣṭibhir jīro damūnā abhiśasticātanaḥ //
analyzed: rathīḥ antar īyate sādhat iṣṭibhiḥ jīraḥ damūnāḥ abhiśasti cātanaḥ
translated: The charioteer moves within, with well-directed rites, the young one, the one who dwells in the house, the one who wards off curses.

original: agne jarasva svapatya āyuny ūrjā pinvasva sam iṣo didīhi naḥ /
analyzed: agne jarasva su apatye āyuni ūrjā pinvasva sam iṣaḥ didīhi naḥ
translated: O Agni, sing your own song, in your own abode, swell with strength, shine upon us with food.

original: vayāṃsi jinva bṛhataś ca jāgṛva uśig devānām asi sukratur vipām //
analyzed: vayāṃsi jinva bṛhataḥ ca jāgṛvaḥ uśij devānām asi su kratuḥ vipām
translated: Animate the birds, and the great and watchful ones. You are the swift and wise priest of the gods, the one who spreads out the oblations.

original: viśpatiṃ yahvam atithiṃ naraḥ sadā yantāraṃ dhīnām uśijaṃ ca vāghatām /
analyzed: viśpatim yahvam atithim naraḥ sadā yantāram dhīnām uśijam ca vāghatām
translated: The lord of the people, the young guest, whom men always honor, the leader of thoughts, the eager one of the priests,

original: adhvarāṇāṃ cetanaṃ jātavedasam pra śaṃsanti namasā jūtibhir vṛdhe //
analyzed: adhvarāṇām cetanam jātavedasam pra śaṃsanti namasā jūtibhiḥ vṛdhe
translated: The one who knows the sacrifices, the all-knowing one, they praise with reverence and with their powers for growth.

original: vibhāvā devaḥ suraṇaḥ pari kṣitīr agnir babhūva śavasā sumadrathaḥ /
analyzed: vibhāvā devaḥ su raṇaḥ pari kṣitīḥ agniḥ babhūva śavasā sumat rathaḥ
translated: The shining god, the purifier, has gone around the people. Agni has become, through his power, the one with the very rich chariot.

original: tasya vratāni bhūripoṣiṇo vayam upa bhūṣema dama ā suvṛktibhiḥ //
analyzed: tasya vratāni bhūri poṣiṇaḥ vayam upa bhūṣema dame ā suvṛktibhiḥ
translated: We should serve his ordinances, which nourish much, in the house, with good hymns of praise.

original: vaiśvānara tava dhāmāny ā cake yebhiḥ svarvid abhavo vicakṣaṇa /
analyzed: vaiśvānara tava dhāmāni ā cake yebhiḥ svar vid abhavaḥ vicakṣaṇa
translated: I have come to the abodes of thee, O Vaiśvānara, by which thou hast become all-seeing, O thou who seest the light.

original: jāta āpṛṇo bhuvanāni rodasī agne tā viśvā paribhūr asi tmanā //
analyzed: jātaḥ āpṛṇaḥ bhuvanāni rodasī agne tā viśvā paribhūḥ asi tmanā
translated: Thou, O Agni, hast filled the worlds, the two world-halves, O thou who art born. Thou art the overlord of all these by thyself.

original: vaiśvānarasya daṃsanābhyo bṛhad ariṇād ekaḥ svapasyayā kaviḥ /
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya daṃsanābhyaḥ bṛhat ariṇāt ekaḥ su apasyayā kaviḥ
translated: The one wise one, by the great openings of Vaiśvānara, has roared with his own swiftness.

original: ubhā pitarā mahayann ajāyatāgnir dyāvāpṛthivī bhūriretasā //
analyzed: ubhā pitarā mahayan ajāyata agniḥ dyāvāpṛthivī bhūri retasā
translated: Magnifying both parents, he was born, Agni, with the two world-halves, Dyaus and Pṛthivī, with great seed.

original: samitsamit sumanā bodhy asme śucāśucā sumatiṃ rāsi vasvaḥ /
analyzed: samidh samidh sumanāḥ bodhi asme śucā a śucā sumatim rāsi vasvaḥ
translated: Be well-disposed, well-disposed, be kindly disposed towards us. With every wish grant us wealth.

original: ā deva devān yajathāya vakṣi sakhā sakhīn sumanā yakṣy agne //
analyzed: ā deva devān yajathāya vakṣi sakhā sakhīn sumanāḥ yakṣi agne
translated: Thou, O god, shalt carry the gods to the sacrifice. As a friend, well-disposed, thou shalt worship, O Agni, the friends.

original: yaṃ devāsas trir ahann āyajante divedive varuṇo mitro agniḥ /
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ tris ahan āyajante dive dive varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ
translated: Whom the gods, Varuna, Mitra, Agni, have worshipped thrice a day, day by day.

original: semaṃ yajñam madhumantaṃ kṛdhī nas tanūnapād ghṛtayoniṃ vidhantam //
analyzed: sā imam yajñam madhumantam kṛdhī naḥ tanūnapād ghṛta yonim vidhantam
translated: Make this sacrifice of ours rich in honey, O Tanūnapāt, who hast made the womb of ghee.

original: pra dīdhitir viśvavārā jigāti hotāram iḷaḥ prathamaṃ yajadhyai /
analyzed: pra dīdhitiḥ viśva vārā jigāti hotāram iḷaḥ prathamam yajadhyai
translated: The light, which is desired by all, goes forth, to worship the first Hotar.

original: acchā namobhir vṛṣabhaṃ vandadhyai sa devān yakṣad iṣito yajīyān //
analyzed: acchā namobhiḥ vṛṣabham vandadhyai sa devān yakṣat iṣitaḥ yajīyān
translated: We must honour the bull with homage, he, being sent, shall worship the gods best.

original: ūrdhvo vāṃ gātur adhvare akāry ūrdhvā śocīṃṣi prasthitā rajāṃsi /
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ vām gātuḥ adhvare akāri ūrdhvā śocīṃṣi prasthitā rajāṃsi
translated: Your way has been made high in the sacrifice, the flames have gone up, the regions have been set in motion.

original: divo vā nābhā ny asādi hotā stṛṇīmahi devavyacā vi barhiḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ vā nābhā ni asādi hotā stṛṇīmahi deva vyacāḥ vi barhiḥ
translated: Or hath the priest sat down on the navel of the sky? Let us strew sacred grass for the Gods' abode.

original: sapta hotrāṇi manasā vṛṇānā invanto viśvam prati yann ṛtena /
analyzed: sapta hotrāṇi manasā vṛṇānāḥ invantaḥ viśvam prati yan ṛtena
translated: The seven Hotras, choosing with their minds, impelling all things according to the eternal law,

original: nṛpeśaso vidatheṣu pra jātā abhīmaṃ yajñaṃ vi caranta pūrvīḥ //
analyzed: nṛ peśasaḥ vidatheṣu pra jātāḥ abhi imam yajñam vi caranta pūrvīḥ
translated: The princes, born in the assemblies, shall move in this sacrifice in a body.

original: ā bhandamāne uṣasā upāke uta smayete tanvā virūpe /
analyzed: ā bhandamāne uṣasau upāke uta smayete tanvā virūpe
translated: The two, Bhandamāna and Upa, the dawns, and also the two, Smaya and Virūpa, the bodies,

original: yathā no mitro varuṇo jujoṣad indro marutvāṃ uta vā mahobhiḥ //
analyzed: yathā naḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ jujoṣat indraḥ marutvān uta vā mahobhiḥ
translated: So that Mitra, Varuṇa, and Indra with the Maruts may be pleased with us, or with great (gifts).

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā ny ṛñje sapta pṛkṣāsaḥ svadhayā madanti /
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā ni ṛñje sapta pṛkṣāsaḥ svadhayā madanti
translated: I honour the two divine Hotars first; the seven kinds of seed rejoice in their own nature.

original: ṛtaṃ śaṃsanta ṛtam it ta āhur anu vrataṃ vratapā dīdhyānāḥ //
analyzed: ṛtam śaṃsantaḥ ṛtam id te āhuḥ anu vratam vrata pāḥ dīdhyānāḥ
translated: They praise the truth, and they declare the truth; the guardians of the vow, intent, follow the vow.

original: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ sajoṣā iḷā devair manuṣyebhir agniḥ /
analyzed: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ sajoṣāḥ iḷā devaiḥ manuṣyebhiḥ agniḥ
translated: May Bhāratī, in unison with the Bhāratīs, Ilā with the gods, Agni with men,

original: sarasvatī sārasvatebhir arvāk tisro devīr barhir edaṃ sadantu //
analyzed: sarasvatī sārasvatebhiḥ arvāk tisraḥ devīḥ barhiḥ ā idam sadantu
translated: Sarasvatī with the Sārasvatas, may the three goddesses sit on this sacred grass.

original: tan nas turīpam adha poṣayitnu deva tvaṣṭar vi rarāṇaḥ syasva /
analyzed: tat naḥ turīpam adha poṣayitnu deva tvaṣṭar vi rarāṇaḥ syasva
translated: O Tvaṣṭar, God, grant us that food which is most nourishing, being liberal.

original: yato vīraḥ karmaṇyaḥ sudakṣo yuktagrāvā jāyate devakāmaḥ //
analyzed: yatas vīraḥ karmaṇyaḥ su dakṣaḥ yukta grāvā jāyate deva kāmaḥ
translated: From which a hero, active, of good skill, longing for the gods, is born, with the pressing-stone in place.

original: vanaspate 'va sṛjopa devān agnir haviḥ śamitā sūdayāti /
analyzed: vanaspate vaḥ sṛja upa devān agniḥ haviḥ śamitā sūdayāti
translated: O tree, let loose the gods; Agni, the preparer of the oblation, makes it ready.

original: sed u hotā satyataro yajāti yathā devānāṃ janimāni veda //
analyzed: sa id u hotā satyataraḥ yajāti yathā devānām janimāni veda
translated: The priest, more truthful, offers sacrifice, as he knows the generations of the gods.

original: ā yāhy agne samidhāno arvāṅ indreṇa devaiḥ sarathaṃ turebhiḥ /
analyzed: ā yāhi agne samidhānaḥ arvāṅ indreṇa devaiḥ sa ratham turebhiḥ
translated: Come hither, O Agni, kindled, with the chariot of the swift gods, with Indra.

original: barhir na āstām aditiḥ suputrā svāhā devā amṛtā mādayantām //
analyzed: barhiḥ naḥ āstām aditiḥ su putrā svāhā devāḥ amṛtāḥ mādayantām
translated: Sit on the strew, O Aditi, with good sons. Hail! Let the immortal gods rejoice.

original: praty agnir uṣasaś cekitāno 'bodhi vipraḥ padavīḥ kavīnām /
analyzed: prati agniḥ uṣasaḥ cekitānaḥ bodhi vipraḥ padavīḥ kavīnām
translated: Agni, the watchful, has awakened to the dawns, the sage, the paths of the wise.

original: pṛthupājā devayadbhiḥ samiddho 'pa dvārā tamaso vahnir āvaḥ //
analyzed: pṛthu pājāḥ devayadbhiḥ samiddhaḥ pa dvārā tamasaḥ vahniḥ āvaḥ
translated: Wide-stepping, kindled by those who worship, the bearer of the oblation has opened the doors of darkness.

original: pred v agnir vāvṛdhe stomebhir gīrbhi stotṝṇāṃ namasya ukthaiḥ /
analyzed: pra id u agniḥ vāvṛdhe stomebhiḥ gīrbhiḥ stotṝṇām namasyaḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: Agni has grown great through the praises, through the songs of the praisers, through the adorations, through the hymns.

original: pūrvīr ṛtasya saṃdṛśaś cakānaḥ saṃ dūto adyaud uṣaso viroke //🔽adhāyy agnir mānuṣīṣu vikṣv apāṃ garbho mitra ṛtena sādhan /🔽ā haryato yajataḥ sānv asthād abhūd u vipro havyo matīnām //
analyzed: pūrvīḥ ṛtasya saṃdṛśaḥ cakānaḥ sam dūtaḥ adyaut uṣasaḥ viroke  adhāyi agniḥ mānuṣīṣu vikṣu apām garbhaḥ mitraḥ ṛtena sādhan  ā haryataḥ yajataḥ sānū asthāt abhūt u vipraḥ havyaḥ matīnām
translated: Desiring the many appearances of truth, he has become the messenger, shining in the light of the dawns.🔽Agni has been set up in many human dwellings, the embryo of the waters, making right by law.🔽The tawny one, the worshipper, has sat down on the seat; he has become the sage, the oblation of the thoughts.

original: mitro agnir bhavati yat samiddho mitro hotā varuṇo jātavedāḥ /
analyzed: mitraḥ agniḥ bhavati yat samiddhaḥ mitraḥ hotā varuṇaḥ jātavedāḥ
translated: Agni becomes Mitra when kindled, Mitra the priest, Varuṇa the all-knower.

original: mitro adhvaryur iṣiro damūnā mitraḥ sindhūnām uta parvatānām //
analyzed: mitraḥ adhvaryuḥ iṣiraḥ damūnāḥ mitraḥ sindhūnām uta parvatānām
translated: Mitra is the priest, the active one who dwells in the house, Mitra of the rivers and the mountains.

original: pāti priyaṃ ripo agram padaṃ veḥ pāti yahvaś caraṇaṃ sūryasya /
analyzed: pāti priyam ripaḥ agram padam veḥ pāti yahvaḥ caraṇam sūryasya
translated: He guards the dear foremost step of the bird, he guards the young foot of the sun.

original: pāti nābhā saptaśīrṣāṇam agniḥ pāti devānām upamādam ṛṣvaḥ //
analyzed: pāti nābhā sapta śīrṣāṇam agniḥ pāti devānām upamādam ṛṣvaḥ
translated: Agni guards the navel with seven heads, the lofty one guards the abode of the gods.

original: ṛbhuś cakra īḍyaṃ cāru nāma viśvāni devo vayunāni vidvān /🔽sasasya carma ghṛtavat padaṃ ves tad id agnī rakṣaty aprayucchan //
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ cakre īḍyam cāru nāma viśvāni devaḥ vayunāni vidvān  sasasya carma ghṛtavat padam veḥ tat id agniḥ rakṣati aprayucchan
translated: The Rभु has made the adorable and beautiful name, the god who knows all the ways.🔽The skin of the animal with fat is his foot, that Agni guards, never sleeping.

original: ā yonim agnir ghṛtavantam asthāt pṛthupragāṇam uśantam uśānaḥ /
analyzed: ā yonim agniḥ ghṛtavantam asthāt pṛthu pragāṇam uśantam uśānaḥ
translated: Agni has sat down on the sacrificial strew rich in ghee, the wide-going one, the eager one, the eager one.

original: dīdyānaḥ śucir ṛṣvaḥ pāvakaḥ punaḥpunar mātarā navyasī kaḥ //🔽sadyo jāta oṣadhībhir vavakṣe yadī vardhanti prasvo ghṛtena /
analyzed: dīdyānaḥ śuciḥ ṛṣvaḥ pāvakaḥ punar punar mātarā navyasī kaḥ  sadyas jātaḥ oṣadhībhiḥ vavakṣe yadī vardhanti prasvaḥ ghṛtena
translated: Shining, pure, lofty, purifying, again and again, like new mothers, he.🔽As soon as born, he has grown with the plants, when they increase him with ghee in the morning.

original: āpa iva pravatā śumbhamānā uruṣyad agniḥ pitror upasthe //
analyzed: āpaḥ iva pravatā śumbhamānāḥ uruṣyat agniḥ pitroḥ upasthe
translated: Like waters in a channel, being purified, Agni has been protected in the lap of the parents.

original: ud u ṣṭutaḥ samidhā yahvo adyaud varṣman divo adhi nābhā pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: ud u stutaḥ samidhā yahvaḥ adyaut varṣman divaḥ adhi nābhā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The lofty one has risen, praised with the kindling-stick, today, on the back of the sky, on the navel of the earth.

original: mitro agnir īḍyo mātariśvā dūto vakṣad yajathāya devān //
analyzed: mitraḥ agniḥ īḍyaḥ mātariśvā dūtaḥ vakṣat yajathāya devān
translated: Agni, Mitra, to be worshipped, Mātariśvan, shall go as messenger to the gods to worship them.

original: ud astambhīt samidhā nākam ṛṣvo 'gnir bhavann uttamo rocanānām /
analyzed: ud astambhīt samidhā nākam ṛṣvaḥ gniḥ bhavan uttamaḥ rocanānām
translated: He hath upheld the lofty vault with fuel, becoming Agni, best of lights.

original: yadī bhṛgubhyaḥ pari mātariśvā guhā santaṃ havyavāhaṃ samīdhe //🔽iḷām agne purudaṃsaṃ saniṃ goḥ śaśvattamaṃ havamānāya sādha /
analyzed: yadī bhṛgubhyaḥ pari mātariśvā guhā santam havyavāham samīdhe  iḷām agne purudaṃsam sanim goḥ śaśvattamam havamānāya sādha
translated: When Matariśvan hath kindled thee, the bearer of oblations, who art in the womb, for the Bhṛgus.🔽Give us, O Agni, the much-desired, the gainful portion of the cow, most lasting, to the invocator.

original: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme //
analyzed: syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te sumatiḥ bhūtu asme
translated: May we have a son, a child, who shall continue our race. Be this to us, O Agni, thy most gracious favour.

original: pra kāravo mananā vacyamānā devadrīcīṃ nayata devayantaḥ /
analyzed: pra kāravaḥ mananā vacyamānāḥ devadrīcīm nayata devayantaḥ
translated: Forward the singers, the thoughts, when they are called, who are devoted to the gods, to the godward course.

original: dakṣiṇāvāḍ vājinī prācy eti havir bharanty agnaye ghṛtācī //
analyzed: dakṣiṇāvāṭ vājinī prācī eti haviḥ bharantī agnaye ghṛtācī
translated: The two Dakṣiṇās, the two Vājinīs, go forward. They bring oblation to Agni, the two Ghritācīs.

original: ā rodasī apṛṇā jāyamāna uta pra rikthā adha nu prayajyo /
analyzed: ā rodasī apṛṇāḥ jāyamānaḥ uta pra rikthāḥ adha nu prayajyo
translated: Thou hast filled the two world-halves as thou wast born. And now, O most adorable, thou hast obtained thy desire.

original: divaś cid agne mahinā pṛthivyā vacyantāṃ te vahnayaḥ saptajihvāḥ //
analyzed: divaḥ cit agne mahinā pṛthivyāḥ vacyantām te vahnayaḥ sapta jihvāḥ
translated: Even from the greatness of the heaven, O Agni, let thy flames, thy seven tongues, be exalted.

original: dyauś ca tvā pṛthivī yajñiyāso ni hotāraṃ sādayante damāya /
analyzed: dyauḥ ca tvā pṛthivī yajñiyāsaḥ ni hotāram sādayante damāya
translated: Heaven and Earth, worthy of sacrifice, settle thee, O Hotar, as their priest to be worshipped.

original: yadī viśo mānuṣīr devayantīḥ prayasvatīr īḷate śukram arciḥ //
analyzed: yadi viśaḥ mānuṣīḥ devayantīḥ prayasvatīḥ īḍate śukram arciḥ
translated: When the tribes of men, devoted to the gods, rich in oblations, call thee, O bright flame.

original: mahān sadhasthe dhruva ā niṣatto 'ntar dyāvā māhine haryamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: mahān sadhasthe dhruvaḥ ā niṣattaḥ ntar dyāvā māhine haryamāṇaḥ
translated: Firmly seated in the great abode, in the womb of heaven and earth, O Agni, shining.

original: āskre sapatnī ajare amṛkte sabardughe urugāyasya dhenū //
analyzed: āskre sapatnī ajare amṛkte sabardughe urugāyasya dhenū
translated: In the lap, the two unaging, uninjured, well-milking, wide-pasturing cows of the wide-ruling one.

original: vratā te agne mahato mahāni tava kratvā rodasī ā tatantha /
analyzed: vratā te agne mahataḥ mahāni tava kratvā rodasī ā tatantha
translated: Thy vows, O Agni, are great, the great ones; by thy wisdom thou hast stretched out the two worlds.

original: tvaṃ dūto abhavo jāyamānas tvaṃ netā vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām //
analyzed: tvam dūtaḥ abhavaḥ jāyamānaḥ tvam netā vṛṣabha carṣaṇīnām
translated: Thou hast become the messenger, O bull, O man, thou the leader of men, being born.

original: ṛtasya vā keśinā yogyābhir ghṛtasnuvā rohitā dhuri dhiṣva /
analyzed: ṛtasya vā keśinā yogyābhiḥ ghṛtasnuvā rohitā dhuri dhiṣva
translated: With the hair of truth, with the yokes, with the ghee-sprinkled red oxen, yoke (them).

original: athā vaha devān deva viśvān svadhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ //
analyzed: athā vaha devān deva viśvān su adhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ
translated: Then bring the gods, O god, all the gods; make the offerings, O all-knowing one.

original: divaś cid ā te rucayanta rokā uṣo vibhātīr anu bhāsi pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: divaḥ cit ā te rucayanta rokāḥ uṣaḥ vibhātīḥ anu bhāsi pūrvīḥ
translated: Even from the sky thy lights shine forth; along the shining dawns thou shinest forth in the east.

original: apo yad agna uśadhag vaneṣu hotur mandrasya panayanta devāḥ //
analyzed: apa u yat agne uśadhak vaneṣu hotuḥ mandrasya panayanta devāḥ
translated: When, O Agni, the eager one in the woods, the gods make ready the ghee-sprinkled red oxen for the cheerful Hotar.

original: urau vā ye antarikṣe madanti divo vā ye rocane santi devāḥ /🔽ūmā vā ye suhavāso yajatrā āyemire rathyo agne aśvāḥ //
analyzed: urau vā ye antarikṣe madanti divaḥ vā ye rocane santi devāḥ  ūmāḥ vā ye su havāsaḥ yajatrāḥ āyemire rathyaḥ agne aśvāḥ
translated: Those who rejoice in the broad expanse of the atmosphere, or who are in the light of the sky, the gods,🔽Or those who are easy to invoke, who are to be worshipped, who are worthy of a chariot, O Agni, the horses have come.

original: aibhir agne sarathaṃ yāhy arvāṅ nānārathaṃ vā vibhavo hy aśvāḥ /
analyzed: ā ebhiḥ agne sa ratham yāhi arvāṅ nānā ratham vā vibhavaḥ hi aśvāḥ
translated: With these, O Agni, come hither in thy chariot, or in a chariot of many forms, for the horses are powerful.

original: patnīvatas triṃśataṃ trīṃś ca devān anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva //
analyzed: patnīvataḥ triṃśatam trīn ca devān anuṣvadham ā vaha mādayasva
translated: With the wife, with the thirty, and with the three gods, bring them along the path of the oblation, and rejoice.

original: sa hotā yasya rodasī cid urvī yajñaṃyajñam abhi vṛdhe gṛṇītaḥ /
analyzed: sa hotā yasya rodasī cit urvī yajñam yajñam abhi vṛdhe gṛṇītaḥ
translated: He is the priest whom the two great worlds, even the two wide realms of sky, praise at every sacrifice for his increase.

original: prācī adhvareva tasthatuḥ sumeke ṛtāvarī ṛtajātasya satye //🔽iḷām agne purudaṃsaṃ saniṃ goḥ śaśvattamaṃ havamānāya sādha /
analyzed: prācī adhvarā iva tasthatuḥ sumeke ṛtāvarī ṛta jātasya satye  iḷām agne purudaṃsam sanim goḥ śaśvattamam havamānāya sādha
translated: They have stood forth in the sacrifice, the two well-formed, the two true ones, of the true-born one, in the truth.🔽Give, O Agni, the much-desired, the gained, the most lasting food to him who prays to thee.

original: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme //
analyzed: syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te sumatiḥ bhūtu asme
translated: May we have a son, a child, who shall continue our race. O Agni, may that be thy most gracious will to us.

original: pra ya āruḥ śitipṛṣṭhasya dhāser ā mātarā viviśuḥ sapta vāṇīḥ /
analyzed: pra ye āruḥ śiti pṛṣṭhasya dhāseḥ ā mātarā viviśuḥ sapta vāṇīḥ
translated: He who hath mounted the back of the tawny one, the seven voices have entered into the two mothers.

original: parikṣitā pitarā saṃ carete pra sarsrāte dīrgham āyuḥ prayakṣe //
analyzed: parikṣitā pitarā sam carete pra sarsrāte dīrgham āyuḥ prayakṣe
translated: The two parents, encompassed, move together. They stretch out the long life of him who is to be seen.

original: divakṣaso dhenavo vṛṣṇo aśvā devīr ā tasthau madhumad vahantīḥ /
analyzed: divakṣasaḥ dhenavaḥ vṛṣṇaḥ aśvāḥ devīḥ ā tasthau madhumat vahantīḥ
translated: The milch-kine of the sky, the horses of the tawny one, the divine ones, stand by, bearing the sweet.

original: ṛtasya tvā sadasi kṣemayantam pary ekā carati vartaniṃ gauḥ //🔽ā sīm arohat suyamā bhavantīḥ patiś cikitvān rayivid rayīṇām /
analyzed: ṛtasya tvā sadasi kṣemayantam pari ekā carati vartanim gauḥ  ā sīm arohat su yamāḥ bhavantīḥ patiḥ cikitvān rayi vid rayīṇām
translated: The one cow moves round the path of thee who art to be guarded in the seat of holy order.🔽He hath mounted the well-ordered ones, the two who are to be, the wise lord of wealth, the finder of riches.

original: pra nīlapṛṣṭho atasasya dhāses tā avāsayat purudhapratīkaḥ //
analyzed: pra nīla pṛṣṭhaḥ atasasya dhāseḥ tāḥ avāsayat purudhā pratīkaḥ
translated: The one of dark back hath settled them, the two of the tawny one, the one of many forms.

original: mahi tvāṣṭram ūrjayantīr ajuryaṃ stabhūyamānaṃ vahato vahanti /
analyzed: mahi tvāṣṭram ūrjayantīḥ ajuryam stabhūyamānam vahataḥ vahanti
translated: The two which bear the imperishable one, which rejoice in Tvastr's greatness, which are to be strengthened, bear him.

original: vy aṅgebhir didyutānaḥ sadhastha ekām iva rodasī ā viveśa //🔽jānanti vṛṣṇo aruṣasya śevam uta bradhnasya śāsane raṇanti /
analyzed: vi aṅgebhiḥ didyutānaḥ sadhasthe ekām iva rodasī ā viveśa  jānanti vṛṣṇaḥ aruṣasya śevam uta bradhnasya śāsane raṇanti
translated: With his limbs shining forth, he hath entered the one abode, as it were, of the two world-halves.🔽They know the grace of the red Steer, and they rejoice in the sway of the wide-ruling one.

original: divorucaḥ suruco rocamānā iḷā yeṣāṃ gaṇyā māhinā gīḥ //
analyzed: divorucaḥ su rucaḥ rocamānāḥ iḍā yeṣām gaṇyā māhinā gīḥ
translated: The bright, very bright lights of the sky, whose praise is the song of the mighty one, to be sung.

original: uto pitṛbhyām pravidānu ghoṣam maho mahadbhyām anayanta śūṣam /
analyzed: uta u pitṛbhyām pravidā anu ghoṣam mahaḥ mahadbhyām anayanta śūṣam
translated: And from the two great ones, the two fathers, they have brought forth the shout, the great strength.

original: ukṣā ha yatra pari dhānam aktor anu svaṃ dhāma jaritur vavakṣa //
analyzed: ukṣā ha yatra pari dhānam aktoḥ anu svam dhāma jarituḥ vavakṣa
translated: Where the bull hath been anointed for the covering, he hath waxed great according to his own nature, to the singer.

original: adhvaryubhiḥ pañcabhiḥ sapta viprāḥ priyaṃ rakṣante nihitam padaṃ veḥ /
analyzed: adhvaryubhiḥ pañcabhiḥ sapta viprāḥ priyam rakṣante nihitam padam veḥ
translated: The seven sages, with the five Adhvaryus, guard the dear place laid down of the bird.

original: prāñco madanty ukṣaṇo ajuryā devā devānām anu hi vratā guḥ //
analyzed: prāñcaḥ madanti ukṣaṇaḥ ajuryāḥ devāḥ devānām anu hi vratā guḥ
translated: The bulls rejoice in the eastern direction, the immortal ones, for they have entered the ways of the gods.

original: daivyā hotārā prathamā ny ṛñje sapta pṛkṣāsaḥ svadhayā madanti /
analyzed: daivyā hotārā prathamā ni ṛñje sapta pṛkṣāsaḥ svadhayā madanti
translated: I first honour the two divine Hotars; the seven male ones rejoice in their own nature.

original: ṛtaṃ śaṃsanta ṛtam it ta āhur anu vrataṃ vratapā dīdhyānāḥ //🔽vṛṣāyante mahe atyāya pūrvīr vṛṣṇe citrāya raśmayaḥ suyāmāḥ /
analyzed: ṛtam śaṃsantaḥ ṛtam id te āhuḥ anu vratam vrata pāḥ dīdhyānāḥ  vṛṣāyante mahe atyāya pūrvīḥ vṛṣṇe citrāya raśmayaḥ su yāmāḥ
translated: They praise truth, and they say truth; the guardians of the vow, intent, follow the vow.🔽The rays, well-ordered, shine forth to the great, to the bull, to the wonderful one.

original: deva hotar mandrataraś cikitvān maho devān rodasī eha vakṣi //
analyzed: deva hotar mandrataraḥ cikitvān mahaḥ devān rodasī ā iha vakṣi
translated: O divine Hotar, most delightful, most wise, bring hither the great gods to the two world-halves.

original: pṛkṣaprayajo draviṇaḥ suvācaḥ suketava uṣaso revad ūṣuḥ /
analyzed: pṛkṣa prayajaḥ draviṇaḥ su vācaḥ su ketavaḥ uṣasaḥ revat ūṣuḥ
translated: The sacrifices of Pṛkṣa, the wealthy, the well-spoken, the well-bannered, have prospered well.

original: uto cid agne mahinā pṛthivyāḥ kṛtaṃ cid enaḥ sam mahe daśasya //
analyzed: uta u cit agne mahinā pṛthivyāḥ kṛtam cit enaḥ sam mahe daśasya
translated: Even if you have committed a great sin against the earth, O Agni, be gracious to us.

original: iḷām agne purudaṃsaṃ saniṃ goḥ śaśvattamaṃ havamānāya sādha /
analyzed: iḷām agne purudaṃsam sanim goḥ śaśvattamam havamānāya sādha
translated: O Agni, make easy to be gained for the worshipper the food-giving, much-desired, ever-present prize of cattle.

original: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme //
analyzed: syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te sumatiḥ bhūtu asme
translated: May we have a son, a child, born for increase. O Agni, may that be your gracious will towards us.

original: añjanti tvām adhvare devayanto vanaspate madhunā daivyena /
analyzed: añjanti tvām adhvare devayantaḥ vanaspate madhunā daivyena
translated: The pious, O Vanaspati, anoint you at the sacrifice with divine honey.

original: yad ūrdhvas tiṣṭhā draviṇeha dhattād yad vā kṣayo mātur asyā upasthe //
analyzed: yat ūrdhvaḥ tiṣṭhāḥ draviṇā iha dhattāt yat vā kṣayaḥ mātuḥ asyāḥ upasthe
translated: If you stand erect, bestow wealth here; if you lie in the lap of this mother, in the womb.

original: samiddhasya śrayamāṇaḥ purastād brahma vanvāno ajaraṃ suvīram /
analyzed: samiddhasya śrayamāṇaḥ purastāt brahma vanvānaḥ ajaram su vīram
translated: Settling in front of the kindled one, seeking the undecaying Brahman, good for heroes,

original: āre asmad amatim bādhamāna uc chrayasva mahate saubhagāya //
analyzed: āre asmat amatim bādhamānaḥ ud śrayasva mahate saubhagāya
translated: Repelling misfortune from us, rise up, for great good fortune.

original: uc chrayasva vanaspate varṣman pṛthivyā adhi /
analyzed: ud śrayasva vanaspate varṣman pṛthivyāḥ adhi
translated: Rise up, O Vanaspati, to the highest place on earth.

original: sumitī mīyamāno varco dhā yajñavāhase //
analyzed: su mitī mīyamānaḥ varcaḥ dhāḥ yajña vāhase
translated: Being measured with good measure, bestow splendour on the carrier of the sacrifice.

original: yuvā suvāsāḥ parivīta āgāt sa u śreyān bhavati jāyamānaḥ /
analyzed: yuvā su vāsāḥ parivītaḥ āgāt saḥ u śreyān bhavati jāyamānaḥ
translated: The young man, well-dressed, surrounded, has come; he becomes better as he is born.

original: taṃ dhīrāsaḥ kavaya un nayanti svādhyo manasā devayantaḥ //
analyzed: tam dhīrāsaḥ kavayaḥ ud nayanti su ādhyaḥ manasā devayantaḥ
translated: The wise, the poets, lead him up, revering the gods, with their own thoughts, with their own minds.

original: jāto jāyate sudinatve ahnāṃ samarya ā vidathe vardhamānaḥ /
analyzed: jātaḥ jāyate su su dina dina tve ahnām samarye ā vidathe vardhamānaḥ
translated: Born, he is born at the good time of days, in the assembly, increasing in the sacrificial session.

original: punanti dhīrā apaso manīṣā devayā vipra ud iyarti vācam //🔽yān vo naro devayanto nimimyur vanaspate svadhitir vā tatakṣa /
analyzed: punanti dhīrāḥ apasaḥ manīṣā deva yāḥ vipraḥ ud iyarti vācam  yān vaḥ naraḥ devayantaḥ nimimyuḥ vanaspate svadhitiḥ vā tatakṣa
translated: The wise purify the thoughts, the sage raises his voice to the divine.🔽Those whom the men who delight in the gods have set up, O lord of the forest, the axe has fashioned.

original: te devāsaḥ svaravas tasthivāṃsaḥ prajāvad asme didhiṣantu ratnam //
analyzed: te devāsaḥ svaravaḥ tasthivāṃsaḥ prajāvat asme didhiṣantu ratnam
translated: Those gods, the Svaras, having stood, may they bestow offspring and treasure upon us.

original: ye vṛkṇāso adhi kṣami nimitāso yatasrucaḥ /
analyzed: ye vṛkṇāsaḥ adhi kṣami nimitāsaḥ yata srucaḥ
translated: Those who are cut up on the ground, set up, with uplifted ladles,

original: te no vyantu vāryaṃ devatrā kṣetrasādhasaḥ //
analyzed: te naḥ vyantu vāryam devatrā kṣetrasādhasaḥ
translated: may they grant us choice treasures, they who make the fields successful in the service of the gods.

original: ādityā rudrā vasavaḥ sunīthā dyāvākṣāmā pṛthivī antarikṣam /
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ su nīthāḥ dyāvākṣāmā pṛthivī antarikṣam
translated: The Adityas, the Rudras, the Vasus, the well-wishers, the sky and earth, the atmosphere,

original: sajoṣaso yajñam avantu devā ūrdhvaṃ kṛṇvantv adhvarasya ketum //
analyzed: sajoṣasaḥ yajñam avantu devāḥ ūrdhvam kṛṇvantu adhvarasya ketum
translated: may the gods of one mind favour the sacrifice, may they raise aloft the sign of the sacrifice.

original: haṃsā iva śreṇiśo yatānāḥ śukrā vasānāḥ svaravo na āguḥ /
analyzed: haṃsāḥ iva śreṇiśas yatānāḥ śukrā vasānāḥ svaravaḥ naḥ āguḥ
translated: Like swans in rows, arranged, the bright ones, clothed in fat, have come to us as Svaras.

original: unnīyamānāḥ kavibhiḥ purastād devā devānām api yanti pāthaḥ //
analyzed: unnīyamānāḥ kavibhiḥ purastāt devāḥ devānām api yanti pāthaḥ
translated: Being poured forth by the sages in front, the gods go along the path of the gods.

original: śṛṅgāṇīvec chṛṅgiṇāṃ saṃ dadṛśre caṣālavantaḥ svaravaḥ pṛthivyām /
analyzed: śṛṅgāṇi iva id śṛṅgiṇām sam dadṛśre caṣālavantaḥ svaravaḥ pṛthivyām
translated: Like the peaks of the peaked ones, the Svaras with their cauldrons have been seen on the earth.

original: vāghadbhir vā vihave śroṣamāṇā asmāṃ avantu pṛtanājyeṣu //
analyzed: vāghadbhiḥ vā vihave śroṣamāṇāḥ asmān avantu pṛtanājyeṣu
translated: May they, listening with their priests in the assembly, protect us in the battles for the sacrificial butter.

original: vanaspate śatavalśo vi roha sahasravalśā vi vayaṃ ruhema /
analyzed: vanaspate śata valśaḥ vi roha sahasra valśāḥ vi vayam
translated: O tree, grow with a hundred branches; may we grow with a thousand branches.

original: yaṃ tvām ayaṃ svadhitis tejamānaḥ praṇināya mahate saubhagāya //
analyzed: yam tvām ayam svadhitiḥ tejamānaḥ praṇināya mahate saubhagāya
translated: To what great good fortune this sharp axe has led you forward.

original: sakhāyas tvā vavṛmahe devam martāsa ūtaye /
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ tvā vavṛmahe devam martāsaḥ ūtaye
translated: We, mortal friends, have chosen you, O God, for help.

original: apāṃ napātaṃ subhagaṃ sudīditiṃ supratūrtim anehasam //
analyzed: apām napātam subhagam su dīditim su pratūrtim anehasam
translated: The son of the waters, the fortunate one, the well-shining one, the one with good protection, the one without hatred.

original: kāyamāno vanā tvaṃ yan mātṝr ajagann apaḥ /🔽na tat te agne pramṛṣe nivartanaṃ yad dūre sann ihābhavaḥ //
analyzed: kāyamānaḥ vanā tvam yat mātṝḥ ajagan apaḥ  na tat te agne pramṛṣe nivartanam yat dūre san iha abhavaḥ
translated: When you, growing in the woods, went to the waters, your mothers,🔽That return of yours, O Agni, we will not forget, that you, being far away, have become here.

original: ati tṛṣṭaṃ vavakṣithāthaiva sumanā asi /
analyzed: ati tṛṣṭam vavakṣitha atha eva su manāḥ asi
translated: You have grown beyond the barren one; then you are well-disposed.

original: praprānye yanti pary anya āsate yeṣāṃ sakhye asi śritaḥ //🔽īyivāṃsam ati sridhaḥ śaśvatīr ati saścataḥ /
analyzed: pra pra anye yanti pari anye āsate yeṣām sakhye asi śritaḥ  īyivāṃsam ati sridhaḥ śaśvatīḥ ati saścataḥ
translated: Others go away; others sit around; in whose friendship you are settled.🔽Going beyond the barren ones, beyond the swift ones,

original: anv īm avindan nicirāso adruho 'psu siṃham iva śritam //
analyzed: anu īm avindan nicirāsaḥ adruhaḥ psu siṃham iva śritam
translated: The diligent ones have found you, the unerring one, hidden like a lion in the waters.

original: sasṛvāṃsam iva tmanāgnim itthā tirohitam /
analyzed: sasṛvāṃsam iva tmanā agnim itthā tirohitam
translated: The Agni who is hidden here, as if moving by himself,

original: ainaṃ nayan mātariśvā parāvato devebhyo mathitam pari //
analyzed: ā enam nayat mātariśvā parāvataḥ devebhyaḥ mathitam pari
translated: Mātariśvan has brought him from afar, churned out for the gods.

original: taṃ tvā martā agṛbhṇata devebhyo havyavāhana /
analyzed: tam tvā martāḥ agṛbhṇata devebhyaḥ havya vāhana
translated: Mortals have seized you, O bearer of oblations to the gods,

original: viśvān yad yajñāṃ abhipāsi mānuṣa tava kratvā yaviṣṭhya //
analyzed: viśvān yat yajñān abhipāsi mānuṣa tava kratvā yaviṣṭhya
translated: When you look upon all human sacrifices, O most youthful one, by your wisdom.

original: tad bhadraṃ tava daṃsanā pākāya cic chadayati /
analyzed: tat bhadram tava daṃsanā pākāya cit chadayati
translated: That is good, your glance even covers for cooking,

original: tvāṃ yad agne paśavaḥ samāsate samiddham apiśarvare //
analyzed: tvām yat agne paśavaḥ samāsate samiddham apiśarvare
translated: When, O Agni, the cattle sit around you, kindled, even in the cold season.

original: ā juhotā svadhvaraṃ śīram pāvakaśociṣam /
analyzed: ā juhota su adhvaram śīram pāvaka śociṣam
translated: To the well-ordered one, the beautiful one with purifying radiant heat,

original: āśuṃ dūtam ajiram pratnam īḍyaṃ śruṣṭī devaṃ saparyata //
analyzed: āśum dūtam ajiram pratnam īḍyam śruṣṭī devam saparyata
translated: To the swift messenger, the agile one, the ancient one worthy of praise, listen to the god, serve him.

original: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇy agniṃ triṃśac ca devā nava cāsaparyan /
analyzed: trīṇi śatā trī sahasrāṇi agnim triṃśat ca devāḥ nava ca asaparyan
translated: Three hundred, three thousand, and thirty-nine gods have served Agni.

original: aukṣan ghṛtair astṛṇan barhir asmā ād id dhotāraṃ ny asādayanta //
analyzed: aukṣan ghṛtaiḥ astṛṇan barhiḥ asmai āt id hotāram ni asādayanta
translated: They have anointed him with ghee, they have strewn the sacred grass for him, they have indeed placed him as the Hotar priest.

original: tvām agne manīṣiṇaḥ samrājaṃ carṣaṇīnām /
analyzed: tvām agne manīṣiṇaḥ samrājam carṣaṇīnām
translated: You, O Agni, the wise ones, the sovereign of the people,

original: devam martāsa indhate sam adhvare //🔽tvāṃ yajñeṣv ṛtvijam agne hotāram īḷate /
analyzed: devam martāsaḥ indhate sam adhvare  tvām yajñeṣu ṛtvijam agne hotāram īḍate
translated: The mortals kindle you, the god, at the sacrifice.

original: gopā ṛtasya dīdihi sve dame //
analyzed: gopāḥ ṛtasya dīdihi sve dame
translated: You, O Agni, they invoke as the officiating priest at the sacrifices, as the Hotar priest.🔽As the guardian of truth, shine in your own abode.

original: sa ghā yas te dadāśati samidhā jātavedase /
analyzed: sa ghā yaḥ te dadāśati samidhā jātavedase
translated: He who offers you, O all-knower, with fuel,

original: so agne dhatte suvīryaṃ sa puṣyati //
analyzed: saḥ agne dhatte su vīryam sa puṣyati
translated: O Agni, he obtains good heroism, he prospers.

original: sa ketur adhvarāṇām agnir devebhir ā gamat /
analyzed: sa ketuḥ adhvarāṇām agniḥ devebhiḥ ā gamat
translated: That Agni, the banner of sacrifices, come to us with the gods,

original: añjānaḥ sapta hotṛbhir haviṣmate //
analyzed: añjānaḥ sapta hotṛbhiḥ haviṣmate
translated: Anointed by the seven priests, for him who receives oblations.

original: pra hotre pūrvyaṃ vaco 'gnaye bharatā bṛhat /🔽vipāṃ jyotīṃṣi bibhrate na vedhase //
analyzed: pra hotre pūrvyam vacaḥ gnaye bharata bṛhat  vipām jyotīṃṣi bibhrate na vedhase
translated: Bring the ancient hymn to the Hotar, the great one, to Agni, O Bharatas,🔽Who bears the lights of the people, like a creator.

original: agniṃ vardhantu no giro yato jāyata ukthyaḥ /
analyzed: agnim vardhantu naḥ giraḥ yatas jāyate ukthyaḥ
translated: Let our songs praise Agni, from whom the one worthy of praise is born,

original: mahe vājāya draviṇāya darśataḥ //
analyzed: mahe vājāya draviṇāya darśataḥ
translated: For great strength, for wealth, for the wonderful one.

original: agne yajiṣṭho adhvare devān devayate yaja /
analyzed: agne yajiṣṭhaḥ adhvare devān devayate yaja
translated: O Agni, best sacrificer, offer the gods at the sacrifice to the worshipper of the gods,

original: hotā mandro vi rājasy ati sridhaḥ //🔽sa naḥ pāvaka dīdihi dyumad asme suvīryam /
analyzed: hotā mandraḥ vi rājasi ati sridhaḥ  sa naḥ pāvaka dīdihi dyumat asme su vīryam
translated: The delightful Hotar, rule over the enemies.🔽O purifying one, shine for us with splendor, with great strength and good heroes,

original: bhavā stotṛbhyo antamaḥ svastaye //
analyzed: bhava stotṛbhyaḥ antamaḥ svastaye
translated: Be the nearest to the praisers for well-being.

original: taṃ tvā viprā vipanyavo jāgṛvāṃsaḥ sam indhate /🔽havyavāham amartyaṃ sahovṛdham //
analyzed: tam tvā viprāḥ vipanyavaḥ jāgṛvāṃsaḥ sam indhate  havyavāham amartyam sahaḥ vṛdham
translated: The wise ones, the thoughtful ones, the watchful ones kindle you,🔽The bearer of oblations, the immortal one, who increases strength.

original: agnir hotā purohito 'dhvarasya vicarṣaṇiḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ hotā purohitaḥ dhvarasya vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: Agni is the priest, the priest of the sacrifice, the swift one,

original: sa veda yajñam ānuṣak //
analyzed: sa veda yajñam ānuṣak
translated: He knows the sacrifice well.

original: sa havyavāḷ amartya uśig dūtaś canohitaḥ /
analyzed: sa havyavāṭ amartyaḥ uśij dūtaḥ canohitaḥ
translated: He, the bearer of oblations, the immortal one, the swift messenger, favorably inclined,

original: agnir dhiyā sam ṛṇvati //
analyzed: agniḥ dhiyā sam ṛṇvati
translated: Agni, with the thought, unites.

original: agnir dhiyā sa cetati ketur yajñasya pūrvyaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ dhiyā sa cetati ketuḥ yajñasya pūrvyaḥ
translated: Agni, with the thought, perceives, the ancient banner of the sacrifice,

original: arthaṃ hy asya taraṇi //
analyzed: artham hi asya taraṇi
translated: For his purpose, the swift one.

original: agniṃ sūnuṃ sanaśrutaṃ sahaso jātavedasam /
analyzed: agnim sūnum sana śrutam sahasaḥ jātavedasam
translated: Agni, the son, of great fame, born of strength, all-knower,

original: vahniṃ devā akṛṇvata //
analyzed: vahnim devāḥ akṛṇvata
translated: The gods have made him the bearer of oblations.

original: adābhyaḥ puraetā viśām agnir mānuṣīṇām /
analyzed: adābhyaḥ puraetā viśām agniḥ mānuṣīṇām
translated: Agni, the unassailable leader of the people, of the human beings,

original: tūrṇī rathaḥ sadā navaḥ //
analyzed: tūrṇiḥ rathaḥ sadā navaḥ
translated: The swift chariot, always new.

original: sāhvān viśvā abhiyujaḥ kratur devānām amṛktaḥ /
analyzed: sāhvān viśvāḥ abhiyujaḥ kratuḥ devānām amṛktaḥ
translated: The inviter, overcoming all adversaries, the unhindered power of the gods,

original: agnis tuviśravastamaḥ //🔽abhi prayāṃsi vāhasā dāśvāṃ aśnoti martyaḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ tuvi śravastamaḥ  abhi prayāṃsi vāhasā dāśvān aśnoti martyaḥ
translated: Agni, most famous in strength.🔽The mortal who offers with his wealth approaches the deeds of the one with purifying radiance,

original: kṣayam pāvakaśociṣaḥ //
analyzed: kṣayam pāvaka śociṣaḥ
translated: The abode.

original: pari viśvāni sudhitāgner aśyāma manmabhiḥ /
analyzed: pari viśvāni sudhitā agneḥ aśyāma manmabhiḥ
translated: May we with our thoughts approach all the well-ordered things of Agni.

original: viprāso jātavedasaḥ //
analyzed: viprāsaḥ jātavedasaḥ
translated: The sages of the all-knower.

original: agne viśvāni vāryā vājeṣu saniṣāmahe /
analyzed: agne viśvāni vāryā vājeṣu saniṣāmahe
translated: O Agni, in the contests we seek all the boons.

original: tve devāsa erire //
analyzed: tve devāsaḥ erire
translated: In you the gods have placed.

original: indrāgnī ā gataṃ sutaṃ gīrbhir nabho vareṇyam /
analyzed: indra agnī ā gatam sutam gīrbhiḥ nabhaḥ vareṇyam
translated: O Indra and Agni, come to the pressed (juice), to the desirable cloud, with the songs.

original: asya pātaṃ dhiyeṣitā //
analyzed: asya pātam dhiyā iṣitā
translated: Drink of this, impelled by the thought.

original: indrāgnī jarituḥ sacā yajño jigāti cetanaḥ /
analyzed: indra agnī jarituḥ sacā yajñaḥ jigāti cetanaḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, the sacrifice of the praiser goes forth, discerning, together with the singer.

original: ayā pātam imaṃ sutam //
analyzed: ayā pātam imam sutam
translated: Drink this pressed (juice).

original: indram agniṃ kavicchadā yajñasya jūtyā vṛṇe /
analyzed: indram agnim kavicchadā yajñasya jūtyā vṛṇe
translated: I choose Indra and Agni, the wise ones, for the impulse of the sacrifice.

original: tā somasyeha tṛmpatām //🔽tośā vṛtrahaṇā huve sajitvānāparājitā /
analyzed: tā somasya iha tṛmpatām  tośa vṛtra haṇā huve sa jitvānā aparājitā
translated: May they be satisfied here with the Soma.🔽I invoke the two, Indra and Agni, the conquerors, the unvanquished, the bountiful,

original: indrāgnī vājasātamā //
analyzed: indra agnī vāja sātamā
translated: Indra and Agni, best at winning strength.

original: pra vām arcanty ukthino nīthāvido jaritāraḥ /
analyzed: pra vām arcanti ukthinaḥ nīthāvidaḥ jaritāraḥ
translated: The singers, the knowers of hymns, the praisers praise you, O Indra and Agni,

original: indrāgnī iṣa ā vṛṇe //
analyzed: indra agnī iṣaḥ ā vṛṇe
translated: I choose the food, O Indra and Agni.

original: indrāgnī navatim puro dāsapatnīr adhūnutam /
analyzed: indra agnī navatim puraḥ dāsa patnīḥ adhūnutam
translated: O Indra and Agni, you have shattered ninety forts of the Dāsa-lord,

original: sākam ekena karmaṇā //
analyzed: sākam ekena karmaṇā
translated: Together with one deed.

original: indrāgnī apasas pary upa pra yanti dhītayaḥ /
analyzed: indra agnī apasas pari upa pra yanti dhītayaḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, the purifying thoughts approach you,

original: ṛtasya pathyā anu //
analyzed: ṛtasya pathyāḥ anu
translated: Along the path of truth.

original: indrāgnī taviṣāṇi vāṃ sadhasthāni prayāṃsi ca /
analyzed: indra agnī taviṣāṇi vām sadhasthāni prayāṃsi ca
translated: O Indra and Agni, your powers, your abodes, and your approaches,

original: yuvor aptūryaṃ hitam //
analyzed: yuvoḥ aptūryam hitam
translated: Your swiftness is set forth.

original: indrāgnī rocanā divaḥ pari vājeṣu bhūṣathaḥ /
analyzed: indra agnī rocanā divaḥ pari vājeṣu bhūṣathaḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, you adorn the luminous realm of the sky in contests of strength,

original: tad vāṃ ceti pra vīryam //🔽pra vo devāyāgnaye barhiṣṭham arcāsmai /
analyzed: tat vām ceti pra vīryam  pra vaḥ devāya agnaye barhiṣṭham arca asmai
translated: That is your heroic deed.🔽We will offer to your God Agni the most excellent praise, to him.

original: gamad devebhir ā sa no yajiṣṭho barhir ā sadat //
analyzed: gamat devebhiḥ ā sa naḥ yajiṣṭhaḥ barhiḥ ā sadat
translated: May he come with the gods and sit on the sacred grass as the best offerer.

original: ṛtāvā yasya rodasī dakṣaṃ sacanta ūtayaḥ /
analyzed: ṛtāvā yasya rodasī dakṣam sacante ūtayaḥ
translated: He whose truth-filled heaven and earth and powers follow the call,

original: haviṣmantas tam īḷate taṃ saniṣyanto 'vase //
analyzed: haviṣmantaḥ tam īḍate tam saniṣyantaḥ vase
translated: The offerers seek him, desiring to win him for help.

original: sa yantā vipra eṣāṃ sa yajñānām athā hi ṣaḥ /🔽agniṃ taṃ vo duvasyata dātā yo vanitā magham //
analyzed: sa yantā vipraḥ eṣām sa yajñānām athā hi saḥ  agnim tam vaḥ duvasyata dātā yaḥ vanitā magham
translated: He is the leader of these priests, he is the leader of these sacrifices, for he is so.🔽Serve that Agni, who gives the gift of wealth.

original: sa naḥ śarmāṇi vītaye 'gnir yacchatu śantamā /
analyzed: sa naḥ śarmāṇi vītaye gniḥ yacchatu śantamā
translated: May Agni grant us the most auspicious protections for our dwelling.

original: yato naḥ pruṣṇavad vasu divi kṣitibhyo apsv ā //
analyzed: yatas naḥ pruṣṇavat vasu divi kṣitibhyaḥ apsu ā
translated: From whom may he pour forth wealth for us in the sky, on the earth, and in the waters.

original: dīdivāṃsam apūrvyaṃ vasvībhir asya dhītibhiḥ /
analyzed: dīdivāṃsam apūrvyam vasvībhiḥ asya dhītibhiḥ
translated: The shining, incomparable one, with his wealth-granting thoughts,

original: ṛkvāṇo agnim indhate hotāraṃ viśpatiṃ viśām //
analyzed: ṛkvāṇaḥ agnim indhate hotāram viśpatim viśām
translated: The singers enkindle Agni, the priest, the lord of the people, with the people.

original: uta no brahmann aviṣa uktheṣu devahūtamaḥ /
analyzed: uta naḥ brahman aviṣaḥ uktheṣu deva hūtamaḥ
translated: And be thou also our Brahman, most invoked by the gods in our praises.

original: śaṃ naḥ śocā marudvṛdho 'gne sahasrasātamaḥ //
analyzed: śam naḥ śoca marut vṛdhaḥ gne sahasra sātamaḥ
translated: Be thou auspicious to us, O Agni, the best at bestowing a thousand, the one who delights in the Maruts.

original: nū no rāsva sahasravat tokavat puṣṭimad vasu /
analyzed: nu naḥ rāsva sahasravat tokavat puṣṭimat vasu
translated: Now grant us wealth in thousands, in offspring, in nourishment,

original: dyumad agne suvīryaṃ varṣiṣṭham anupakṣitam //
analyzed: dyumat agne su vīryam varṣiṣṭham an upakṣitam
translated: Shining, O Agni, with good heroism, the highest, not to be surpassed.

original: ā hotā mandro vidathāny asthāt satyo yajvā kavitamaḥ sa vedhāḥ /
analyzed: ā hotā mandraḥ vidathāni asthāt satyaḥ yajvā kavitamaḥ sa vedhāḥ
translated: The delightful Hotar has taken his seat in the assemblies, the true offerer, the wisest, the creator.

original: vidyudrathaḥ sahasas putro agniḥ śociṣkeśaḥ pṛthivyām pājo aśret //🔽ayāmi te namauktiṃ juṣasva ṛtāvas tubhyaṃ cetate sahasvaḥ /
analyzed: vidyut rathaḥ sahasas putraḥ agniḥ śociṣkeśaḥ pṛthivyām pājaḥ aśret  ayāmi te namauktim juṣasva ṛtāvaḥ tubhyam cetate sahasvas
translated: Agni, the son of strength, with lightning as his chariot, his hair flames, has shone forth on the earth.🔽I come to thee with an offering of homage; accept it. The truthful one, O mighty one, thinks of thee.

original: vidvāṃ ā vakṣi viduṣo ni ṣatsi madhya ā barhir ūtaye yajatra //
analyzed: vidvān ā vakṣi viduṣaḥ ni satsi madhye ā barhiḥ ūtaye yajatra
translated: Knowing, thou comest; thou sittest down among the wise, in the middle of the sacrificial grass, O worthy of sacrifice, for help.

original: dravatāṃ ta uṣasā vājayantī agne vātasya pathyābhir accha /
analyzed: dravatām te uṣasā vājayantī agne vātasya pathyābhiḥ accha
translated: Thy two (heaven and earth) hasten to him, invigorating, O Agni, with the paths of the wind, with the dawns.

original: yat sīm añjanti pūrvyaṃ havirbhir ā vandhureva tasthatur duroṇe //
analyzed: yat sīm añjanti pūrvyam havirbhiḥ ā vandhurā iva tasthatuḥ duroṇe
translated: That which they anoint, the ancient one, with oblations, may they stand in the house like a chariot.

original: mitraś ca tubhyaṃ varuṇaḥ sahasvo 'gne viśve marutaḥ sumnam arcan /
analyzed: mitraḥ ca tubhyam varuṇaḥ sahasvas gne viśve marutaḥ sumnam arcan
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, and Sahasva, O Agni, and all the Maruts, praise your favor,

original: yac chociṣā sahasas putra tiṣṭhā abhi kṣitīḥ prathayan sūryo nṝn //🔽vayaṃ te adya rarimā hi kāmam uttānahastā namasopasadya /
analyzed: yat śociṣā sahasas putra tiṣṭhāḥ abhi kṣitīḥ prathayan sūryaḥ nṝn  vayam te adya rarimā hi kāmam uttāna hastāḥ namasā upasadya
translated: When you stand with your flame, O son of strength, extending the regions and the people like the sun.🔽We will fulfill your desire today, O Agni, sitting down with uplifted hands and homage.

original: yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devān asredhatā manmanā vipro agne //
analyzed: yajiṣṭhena manasā yakṣi devān a sredhatā manmanā vipraḥ agne
translated: With your most worshipful mind, worship the gods, O Agni, the sage with your unwearied thought.

original: tvad dhi putra sahaso vi pūrvīr devasya yanty ūtayo vi vājāḥ /
analyzed: tvat hi putra sahasaḥ vi pūrvīḥ devasya yanti ūtayaḥ vi vājāḥ
translated: For from you, O son, O son of strength, many aids and powers of the god go forth.

original: tvaṃ dehi sahasriṇaṃ rayiṃ no 'drogheṇa vacasā satyam agne //
analyzed: tvam dehi sahasriṇam rayim naḥ drogheṇa vacasā satyam agne
translated: You, O Agni, give us wealth consisting of a thousand, with your guileless word, with your true word.

original: tubhyaṃ dakṣa kavikrato yānīmā deva martāso adhvare akarma /
analyzed: tubhyam dakṣa kavi krato yāni imā deva martāsaḥ adhvare akarma
translated: To you, O Dakṣa, O you of wise counsels, to you, O god, these mortal men have brought their work in the sacrifice.

original: tvaṃ viśvasya surathasya bodhi sarvaṃ tad agne amṛta svadeha //
analyzed: tvam viśvasya su rathasya bodhi sarvam tat agne amṛta svada iha
translated: You are the impeller of all the good chariot of the god. All that, O Agni, is immortal, is to be glorified by you.

original: vi pājasā pṛthunā śośucāno bādhasva dviṣo rakṣaso amīvāḥ /
analyzed: vi pājasā pṛthunā śośucānaḥ bādhasva dviṣaḥ rakṣasaḥ amīvāḥ
translated: Shining with your wide radiance, drive away the enemies, the Rakṣas demons, the sicknesses.

original: suśarmaṇo bṛhataḥ śarmaṇi syām agner ahaṃ suhavasya praṇītau //
analyzed: su śarmaṇaḥ bṛhataḥ śarmaṇi syām agneḥ aham su havasya praṇītau
translated: In the protection of the great Agni, of good protection, may I be in the guidance of him who is easily invoked.

original: tvaṃ no asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau tvaṃ sūra udite bodhi gopāḥ /
analyzed: tvam naḥ asyāḥ uṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau tvam sūre udite bodhi gopāḥ
translated: Be thou our guardian at this dawn's arising, be thou our guard when Sûrya hath ascended.

original: janmeva nityaṃ tanayaṃ juṣasva stomam me agne tanvā sujāta //
analyzed: janma iva nityam tanayam juṣasva stomam me agne tanvā su jāta
translated: Accept, as ever, with thy body, O well-born Agni, the child and this my laud.

original: tvaṃ nṛcakṣā vṛṣabhānu pūrvīḥ kṛṣṇāsv agne aruṣo vi bhāhi /
analyzed: tvam nṛ cakṣāḥ vṛṣabha anu pūrvīḥ kṛṣṇāsu agne aruṣaḥ vi bhāhi
translated: Thou, O Agni, who beholdest men, shine forth, O Bull, with many a ruddy light on the dark nights.

original: vaso neṣi ca parṣi cāty aṃhaḥ kṛdhī no rāya uśijo yaviṣṭha //
analyzed: vaso neṣi ca parṣi ca ati aṃhaḥ kṛdhī naḥ rāyaḥ uśijaḥ yaviṣṭha
translated: O Vasu, lead us and carry us beyond our troubles: give thou us wealth, O most youthful God.

original: aṣāḷho agne vṛṣabho didīhi puro viśvāḥ saubhagā saṃjigīvān /
analyzed: aṣāḷhaḥ agne vṛṣabhaḥ didīhi puraḥ viśvāḥ saubhaga ā saṃjigīvān
translated: O Agni, shine forth, O Bull, invincible, conquering in front all blessings.

original: yajñasya netā prathamasya pāyor jātavedo bṛhataḥ supraṇīte //🔽acchidrā śarma jaritaḥ purūṇi devāṃ acchā dīdyānaḥ sumedhāḥ /🔽ratho na sasnir abhi vakṣi vājam agne tvaṃ rodasī naḥ sumeke //
analyzed: yajñasya netā prathamasya pāyoḥ jātavedaḥ bṛhataḥ su praṇīte  acchidrā śarma jaritar purūṇi devām acchā dīdyānaḥ sumedhāḥ  rathaḥ na sasniḥ abhi vakṣi vājam agne tvam rodasī naḥ sumeke
translated: Leader of the first great sacrifice, O all-knower, O thou of fair guidance.

original: pra pīpaya vṛṣabha jinva vājān agne tvaṃ rodasī naḥ sudoghe /🔽devebhir deva surucā rucāno mā no martasya durmatiḥ pari ṣṭhāt //🔽iḷām agne purudaṃsaṃ saniṃ goḥ śaśvattamaṃ havamānāya sādha /
analyzed: pra pīpaya vṛṣabha jinva vājān agne tvam rodasī naḥ su doghe 🔽devebhiḥ deva su rucā rucānaḥ mā naḥ martasya durmatiḥ pari sthāt 🔽iḷām agne purudaṃsam sanim goḥ śaśvattamam havamānāya sādha
translated: O thou who shinest, O thou who art wise, O thou who art radiant, O thou who art good, O thou who art great, O thou who art all, O thou who art all-knower, O thou who art all-seeing, O thou who art all-powerful, O thou who art all-good, O thou who art all-wise, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art all-great, O thou who art

original: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme //
analyzed: syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te sumatiḥ bhūtu asme
translated: May we have a son, a child, offspring. O Agni, may that be thy gracious will towards us.

original: ayam agniḥ suvīryasyeśe mahaḥ saubhagasya /
analyzed: ayam agniḥ su vīryasya īśe mahaḥ saubhagasya
translated: This Agni is the lord of good heroism, of great prosperity,

original: rāya īśe svapatyasya gomata īśe vṛtrahathānām //
analyzed: rāyaḥ īśe su apatyasya gomataḥ īśe vṛtra hathānām
translated: of wealth, of self-rule, of cattle, of the battles with Vrtra.

original: imaṃ naro marutaḥ saścatā vṛdhaṃ yasmin rāyaḥ śevṛdhāsaḥ /
analyzed: imam naraḥ marutaḥ saścata vṛdham yasmin rāyaḥ śevṛdhāsaḥ
translated: This Agni, whom the Maruts, the men, follow for increase, in whom are riches and prosperity,

original: abhi ye santi pṛtanāsu dūḍhyo viśvāhā śatrum ādabhuḥ //
analyzed: abhi ye santi pṛtanāsu dūḍhyaḥ viśvāhā śatrum ādabhuḥ
translated: who are victorious in battles, who overcome the enemy every day.

original: sa tvaṃ no rāyaḥ śiśīhi mīḍhvo agne suvīryasya /
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ rāyaḥ śiśīhi mīḍhvaḥ agne su vīryasya
translated: You, O Agni, the bountiful, grant us wealth, good heroism,

original: tuvidyumna varṣiṣṭhasya prajāvato 'namīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ //🔽cakrir yo viśvā bhuvanābhi sāsahiś cakrir deveṣv ā duvaḥ /
analyzed: tuvi dyumna varṣiṣṭhasya prajāvataḥ namīvasya śuṣmiṇaḥ  cakriḥ yaḥ viśvā bhuvanā abhi sāsahiḥ cakriḥ deveṣu ā duvaḥ
translated: great, most excellent, full of offspring, free from disease, and strong.🔽He who has conquered all beings, who has conquered in service to the gods,

original: ā deveṣu yatata ā suvīrya ā śaṃsa uta nṛṇām //
analyzed: ā deveṣu yatate ā su vīrye ā śaṃse uta nṛṇām
translated: who has exerted among the gods, who has exerted in good heroism, who has exerted in the praise of men.

original: mā no agne 'mataye māvīratāyai rīradhaḥ /
analyzed: mā naḥ agne mataye mā a vīra tāyai rīradhaḥ
translated: Do not lead us, O Agni, to want, to want of heroes,

original: māgotāyai sahasas putra mā nide 'pa dveṣāṃsy ā kṛdhi //
analyzed: mā a go tāyai sahasas putra mā nide pa dveṣāṃsi ā kṛdhi
translated: O son of strength, to want of cattle, to hatred. Drive away enmities.

original: śagdhi vājasya subhaga prajāvato 'gne bṛhato adhvare /
analyzed: śagdhi vājasya subhaga prajāvataḥ gne bṛhataḥ adhvare
translated: Be able, O fortunate one, for the gain of strength, of offspring, O Agni, in the great sacrifice,

original: saṃ rāyā bhūyasā sṛja mayobhunā tuvidyumna yaśasvatā //
analyzed: sam rāyā bhūyasā sṛja mayobhunā tuvi dyumna yaśasvatā
translated: unite us with abundant wealth, with prosperity, O you of great splendour, with glory.

original: samidhyamānaḥ prathamānu dharmā sam aktubhir ajyate viśvavāraḥ /
analyzed: samidhyamānaḥ prathamā anu dharmā sam aktubhiḥ ajyate viśva vāraḥ
translated: Being kindled, he first follows the laws, he is anointed with the unguents, the bestower of all boons.

original: śociṣkeśo ghṛtanirṇik pāvakaḥ suyajño agnir yajathāya devān //
analyzed: śociṣkeśaḥ ghṛta nirṇij pāvakaḥ su yajñaḥ agniḥ yajathāya devān
translated: The purifier with hair of flame, anointed with ghee, well-sacrificed Agni, to be worshipped by the gods.

original: yathāyajo hotram agne pṛthivyā yathā divo jātavedaś cikitvān /
analyzed: yathā ayajaḥ hotram agne pṛthivyāḥ yathā divaḥ jātavedaḥ cikitvān
translated: As you have worshipped the priesthood on earth, O Agni, as you, O all-knowing one, on heaven,

original: evānena haviṣā yakṣi devān manuṣvad yajñam pra tiremam adya //
analyzed: eva anena haviṣā yakṣi devān manuṣvat yajñam pra tira imam adya
translated: So with this oblation worship the gods, and today extend this sacrifice as Manu did.

original: trīṇy āyūṃṣi tava jātavedas tisra ājānīr uṣasas te agne /
analyzed: trīṇi āyūṃṣi tava jātavedaḥ tisraḥ ājānīḥ uṣasaḥ te agne
translated: Three are your life-spans, O all-knowing one, three your births, three your dawns, O Agni.

original: tābhir devānām avo yakṣi vidvān athā bhava yajamānāya śaṃ yoḥ //
analyzed: tābhiḥ devānām avaḥ yakṣi vidvān athā bhava yajamānāya śam yoḥ
translated: By them, O wise one, worship the gods' favor, and then be auspicious to the sacrificer.

original: agniṃ sudītiṃ sudṛśaṃ gṛṇanto namasyāmas tveḍyaṃ jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: agnim su dītim su dṛśam gṛṇantaḥ namasyāmaḥ tvā īḍyam jātavedaḥ
translated: Praising Agni, the well-shining, well-seeing one, we pay homage to you, O worthy of worship, O all-knowing one.

original: tvāṃ dūtam aratiṃ havyavāhaṃ devā akṛṇvann amṛtasya nābhim //
analyzed: tvām dūtam aratim havyavāham devāḥ akṛṇvan amṛtasya nābhim
translated: You the gods have made a messenger, an envoy, a carrier of oblations, the navel of immortality.

original: yas tvad dhotā pūrvo agne yajīyān dvitā ca sattā svadhayā ca śambhuḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ tvat hotā pūrvaḥ agne yajīyān dvitā ca sattā svadhayā ca śambhuḥ
