translated: The one who was your priest before you, O Agni, more worthy of sacrifice, and who exists by his own nature and is auspicious,

original: tasyānu dharma pra yajā cikitvo 'tha no dhā adhvaraṃ devavītau //
analyzed: tasya anu dharma pra yaja ā cikitvaḥ tha naḥ dhāḥ adhvaram deva vītau
translated: Following his law, worship him, O wise one, and then support our sacrifice in the company of the gods.

original: bhavā no agne sumanā upetau sakheva sakhye pitareva sādhuḥ /
analyzed: bhava naḥ agne sumanāḥ upetau sakhā iva sakhye pitarā iva sādhuḥ
translated: Be favorable to us, O Agni, when we approach you, like a good friend to a friend, like a good father to a son.

original: purudruho hi kṣitayo janānām prati pratīcīr dahatād arātīḥ //
analyzed: puru druhaḥ hi kṣitayaḥ janānām prati pratīcīḥ dahatāt arātīḥ
translated: For the people's many enemies, O Agni, let him burn away the evil-doers, the western ones.

original: tapo ṣv agne antarāṃ amitrān tapā śaṃsam araruṣaḥ parasya /
analyzed: tapa u su agne antarān amitrān tapa śaṃsam a raruṣaḥ parasya
translated: Scorch, O Agni, the enemies in the middle, scorch the evil-speaking one of the foe.

original: tapo vaso cikitāno acittān vi te tiṣṭhantām ajarā ayāsaḥ //
analyzed: tapaḥ vaso cikitānaḥ acittān vi te tiṣṭhantām ajarāḥ ayāsaḥ
translated: Scorch, O Vasu, the thoughtless ones, O all-knowing one. Let thy undecaying and tireless ones stand apart.

original: idhmenāgna icchamāno ghṛtena juhomi havyaṃ tarase balāya /
analyzed: idhmena agne icchamānaḥ ghṛtena juhomi havyam tarase balāya
translated: With fuel, O Agni, desiring, I offer oblation with ghee for strength and power.

original: yāvad īśe brahmaṇā vandamāna imāṃ dhiyaṃ śataseyāya devīm //🔽uc chociṣā sahasas putra stuto bṛhad vayaḥ śaśamāneṣu dhehi /
analyzed: yāvat īśe brahmaṇā vandamānaḥ imām dhiyam śata seyāya devīm  ud śociṣā sahasas putra stutaḥ bṛhat vayaḥ śaśamāneṣu dhehi
translated: As far as I am able, O Lord, with prayer, this divine thought for a hundred victories.🔽O Son of Strength, praised with this glowing (praise), bestow great life on those who long for it.

original: revad agne viśvāmitreṣu śaṃ yor marmṛjmā te tanvam bhūri kṛtvaḥ //
analyzed: revat agne viśvāmitreṣu śam yos marmṛjma te tanvam bhūri kṛtvas
translated: O Agni, be auspicious to the Vishva-mitras, be the bestower of wealth. We, making thy body great, have polished thee.

original: kṛdhi ratnaṃ susanitar dhanānāṃ sa ghed agne bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ /
analyzed: kṛdhi ratnam su sanitar dhanānām sa gha id agne bhavasi yat samiddhaḥ
translated: Make wealth, O good bestower, of treasures. Then, O Agni, thou art what thou art when kindled.

original: stotur duroṇe subhagasya revat sṛprā karasnā dadhiṣe vapūṃṣi //
analyzed: stotuḥ duroṇe subhagasya revat sṛprā karasnā dadhiṣe vapūṃṣi
translated: In the house of the worshipper, O prosperous one, thou dost bestow many forms.

original: agniṃ hotāram pra vṛṇe miyedhe gṛtsaṃ kaviṃ viśvavidam amūram /
analyzed: agnim hotāram pra vṛṇe miyedhe gṛtsam kavim viśva vidam amūram
translated: I choose Agni as Hotar, at the sacrifice, the wise one, the all-knowing one, the unerring one.

original: sa no yakṣad devatātā yajīyān rāye vājāya vanate maghāni //
analyzed: sa naḥ yakṣat devatātā yajīyān rāye vājāya vanate maghāni
translated: May he, the best of sacrificers, serve the gods for us. He wins riches for wealth and strength.

original: pra te agne haviṣmatīm iyarmy acchā sudyumnāṃ rātinīṃ ghṛtācīm /
analyzed: pra te agne haviṣmatīm iyarmi acchā su dyumnām rātinīm ghṛtācīm
translated: I urge thy oblation-bearing (altar), O Agni, which brings good fame, which gives gifts, which is full of ghee.

original: pradakṣiṇid devatātim urāṇaḥ saṃ rātibhir vasubhir yajñam aśret //
analyzed: pradakṣiṇit devatātim urāṇaḥ sam rātibhiḥ vasubhiḥ yajñam aśret
translated: Passing by the right, ascending the feast of the gods, he has approached the sacrifice with gifts and treasures.

original: sa tejīyasā manasā tvota uta śikṣa svapatyasya śikṣoḥ /🔽agne rāyo nṛtamasya prabhūtau bhūyāma te suṣṭutayaś ca vasvaḥ //
analyzed: sa tejīyasā manasā tvotaḥ uta śikṣa su apatyasya śikṣoḥ  agne rāyaḥ nṛtamasya prabhūtau bhūyāma te suṣṭutayaḥ ca vasvaḥ
translated: With most powerful mind, O thou who art to be invoked, do thou also instruct, O thou who art to be instructed by the lord of the house.🔽O Agni, in the bestowal of wealth, most desirable to men, may we be among those who praise thee well.

original: bhūrīṇi hi tve dadhire anīkāgne devasya yajyavo janāsaḥ /🔽sa ā vaha devatātiṃ yaviṣṭha śardho yad adya divyaṃ yajāsi //
analyzed: bhūrīṇi hi tve dadhire anīkā agne devasya yajyavaḥ janāsaḥ  saḥ ā vaha devatātim yaviṣṭha śardhaḥ yat adya divyam yajāsi
translated: For many forms have the people set in thee, O Agni, who are to be worshipped by the gods.🔽Do thou, O most youthful one, bring the feast of the gods, when thou art to-day to worship the heavenly host.

original: yat tvā hotāram anajan miyedhe niṣādayanto yajathāya devāḥ /
analyzed: yat tvā hotāram anajat miyedhe niṣādayantaḥ yajathāya devāḥ
translated: Since they have chosen thee as Hotar at the sacrifice, O gods, appointing thee to offer sacrifice.

original: sa tvaṃ no agne 'viteha bodhy adhi śravāṃsi dhehi nas tanūṣu //
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ agne vitā iha bodhi adhi śravāṃsi dhehi naḥ tanūṣu
translated: Be thou, O Agni, our protector here; bestow upon our bodies high fame.

original: agnim uṣasam aśvinā dadhikrāṃ vyuṣṭiṣu havate vahnir ukthaiḥ /
analyzed: agnim uṣasam aśvinā dadhikrām vyuṣṭiṣu havate vahniḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: The priest invokes Agni, Uṣas, and the two Aśvins, Dadhikrāvan, at the break of day, with hymns.

original: sujyotiṣo naḥ śṛṇvantu devāḥ sajoṣaso adhvaraṃ vāvaśānāḥ //
analyzed: su jyotiṣaḥ naḥ śṛṇvantu devāḥ sajoṣasaḥ adhvaram vāvaśānāḥ
translated: May the gods, whose light is good, listen to us, of one mind, rejoicing in the sacrifice.

original: agne trī te vājinā trī ṣadhasthā tisras te jihvā ṛtajāta pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: agne trī te vājinā trī sadhasthā tisraḥ te jihvāḥ ṛta jāta pūrvīḥ
translated: O Agni, three are thy powers, three stations, three thy tongues, O thou who art born of the Ṛtas, many.

original: tisra u te tanvo devavātās tābhir naḥ pāhi giro aprayucchan //
analyzed: tisraḥ u te tanvaḥ deva vātāḥ tābhiḥ naḥ pāhi giraḥ aprayucchan
translated: Three are thy bodies, O thou who art worshipped by the gods; with them, O thou who art not to be deceived, protect our songs.

original: agne bhūrīṇi tava jātavedo deva svadhāvo 'mṛtasya nāma /
analyzed: agne bhūrīṇi tava jātavedaḥ deva svadhāvas mṛtasya nāma
translated: O Agni, many are thy names, O thou of universal knowledge, O god of natural power, of immortality.

original: yāś ca māyā māyināṃ viśvaminva tve pūrvīḥ saṃdadhuḥ pṛṣṭabandho //
analyzed: yāḥ ca māyāḥ māyinām viśvaminva tve pūrvīḥ saṃdadhuḥ pṛṣṭa bandho
translated: And the many illusions of the magicians, O thou who art all-pervading, have been laid in thee, O thou who art bound to the back.

original: agnir netā bhaga iva kṣitīnāṃ daivīnāṃ deva ṛtupā ṛtāvā /
analyzed: agniḥ netā bhagaḥ iva kṣitīnām daivīnām devaḥ ṛtu pāḥ ṛtāvā
translated: Agni is the leader, like Bhaga of the people, O god, the guardian of the divine seasons, true to the truth.

original: sa vṛtrahā sanayo viśvavedāḥ parṣad viśvāti duritā gṛṇantam //
analyzed: sa vṛtra hā sanayaḥ viśva vedāḥ parṣat viśvā ati duritā gṛṇantam
translated: He, the Vr̥itra-slayer, the impeller, all-knowing, shall lead us beyond all troubles, O thou who art praised.

original: dadhikrām agnim uṣasaṃ ca devīm bṛhaspatiṃ savitāraṃ ca devam /
analyzed: dadhikrām agnim uṣasam ca devīm bṛhaspatim savitāram ca devam
translated: I invoke Dadhikrâs, Agni, and the goddess Dawn, and the god Br̥ihaspati, and Savitar the god,

original: aśvinā mitrāvaruṇā bhagaṃ ca vasūn rudrāṃ ādityāṃ iha huve //
analyzed: aśvinā mitrāvaruṇā bhagam ca vasūn rudrān ādityān iha huve
translated: The two Aṣvins, Mitra, Varuṇa, and Bhaga, the Vasus, Rudras, and Âdityas here.

original: imaṃ no yajñam amṛteṣu dhehīmā havyā jātavedo juṣasva /🔽stokānām agne medaso ghṛtasya hotaḥ prāśāna prathamo niṣadya //
analyzed: imam naḥ yajñam amṛteṣu dhehi imā havyā jātavedaḥ juṣasva  stokānām agne medasaḥ ghṛtasya hotar prāśāna prathamaḥ niṣadya
translated: Place this our sacrifice among the immortal ones; accept these offerings, O thou of universal knowledge.🔽O Hotar, first sitting down, eat the drops, the fat, the ghee, of the oblation.

original: ghṛtavantaḥ pāvaka te stokā ścotanti medasaḥ /
analyzed: ghṛtavantaḥ pāvaka te stokā ścotanti medasaḥ
translated: O purifying one, thy drops, full of ghee, trickle down, of fat.

original: svadharman devavītaye śreṣṭhaṃ no dhehi vāryam //
analyzed: svadharman deva vītaye śreṣṭham naḥ dhehi vāryam
translated: O thou who art of natural law, give us the best boon for the worship of the gods.

original: tubhyaṃ stokā ghṛtaścuto 'gne viprāya santya /
analyzed: tubhyam stokāḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ gne viprāya santya
translated: To thee, O Agni, the drops full of ghee belong, to the sage.

original: ṛṣiḥ śreṣṭhaḥ sam idhyase yajñasya prāvitā bhava //
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ śreṣṭhaḥ sam idhyase yajñasya prāvitā bhava
translated: You are kindled as the best of seers, become the forerunner of the sacrifice.

original: tubhyaṃ ścotanty adhrigo śacīva stokāso agne medaso ghṛtasya /
analyzed: tubhyam ścotanti adhrigo śacīvas stokāsaḥ agne medasaḥ ghṛtasya
translated: For you, O you who go straight, the drops of fat and ghee trickle, O Agni.

original: kaviśasto bṛhatā bhānunāgā havyā juṣasva medhira //
analyzed: kavi śastaḥ bṛhatā bhānunā āgāḥ havyā juṣasva medhira
translated: Accept the oblations, O wise one, with your great light, praised by the sages.

original: ojiṣṭhaṃ te madhyato meda udbhṛtam pra te vayaṃ dadāmahe /
analyzed: ojiṣṭham te madhyataḥ medaḥ udbhṛtam pra te vayam dadāmahe
translated: We offer to you the most powerful fat that is extracted from your middle.

original: ścotanti te vaso stokā adhi tvaci prati tān devaśo vihi //
analyzed: ścotanti te vaso stokāḥ adhi tvaci prati tān devaśas vihi
translated: The drops of ghee trickle on your skin, O Vasu, distribute them among the gods.

original: ayaṃ so agnir yasmin somam indraḥ sutaṃ dadhe jaṭhare vāvaśānaḥ /
analyzed: ayam saḥ agniḥ yasmin somam indraḥ sutam dadhe jaṭhare vāvaśānaḥ
translated: This is that Agni in whom Indra placed the pressed Soma, hungering in his belly.

original: sahasriṇaṃ vājam atyaṃ na saptiṃ sasavān san stūyase jātavedaḥ //
analyzed: sahasriṇam vājam atyam na saptim sasavān san stūyase jātavedaḥ
translated: Endowed with oblations, O all-knowing one, you are praised as the thousandfold prize, like a horse.

original: agne yat te divi varcaḥ pṛthivyāṃ yad oṣadhīṣv apsv ā yajatra /
analyzed: agne yat te divi varcaḥ pṛthivyām yat oṣadhīṣu apsu ā yajatra
translated: O Agni, the splendor that is in the sky, on earth, in the plants, in the waters, O you who are to be worshipped,

original: yenāntarikṣam urv ātatantha tveṣaḥ sa bhānur arṇavo nṛcakṣāḥ //
analyzed: yena antarikṣam uru ātatantha tveṣaḥ sa bhānuḥ arṇavaḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ
translated: By which you have spread out the wide atmosphere, that is your shining light, like an ocean, looking at men.

original: agne divo arṇam acchā jigāsy acchā devāṃ ūciṣe dhiṣṇyā ye /
analyzed: agne divaḥ arṇam acchā jigāsi acchā devān ūciṣe dhiṣṇyāḥ ye
translated: O Agni, you wish to reach the ocean of the sky, you speak to the gods who are to be worshipped,

original: yā rocane parastāt sūryasya yāś cāvastād upatiṣṭhanta āpaḥ //
analyzed: yāḥ rocane parastāt sūryasya yāḥ ca avastāt upatiṣṭhante āpaḥ
translated: Those that are above in the light of the sun, and those that stand below, the waters.

original: purīṣyāso agnayaḥ prāvaṇebhiḥ sajoṣasaḥ /
analyzed: purīṣyāsaḥ agnayaḥ prāvaṇebhiḥ sajoṣasaḥ
translated: The Agni who is in the cities, in unison with those who are in the mountains,

original: juṣantāṃ yajñam adruho 'namīvā iṣo mahīḥ //🔽iḷām agne purudaṃsaṃ saniṃ goḥ śaśvattamaṃ havamānāya sādha /
analyzed: juṣantām yajñam adruhaḥ namīvāḥ iṣaḥ mahīḥ  iḷām agne purudaṃsam sanim goḥ śaśvattamam havamānāya sādha
translated: Accept the sacrifice, free from hatred, with great food free from disease.🔽O Agni, grant the generous, the most enduring, the gain of cattle, to him who invokes you.

original: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme //
analyzed: syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te sumatiḥ bhūtu asme
translated: May we have a son, a child, born for increase. O Agni, may that be your favorable disposition towards us.

original: nirmathitaḥ sudhita ā sadhasthe yuvā kavir adhvarasya praṇetā /
analyzed: nirmathitaḥ sudhite ā sadhasthe yuvā kaviḥ adhvarasya praṇetā
translated: Anointed, well-placed in his abode, the young sage, the leader of the sacrifice,

original: jūryatsv agnir ajaro vaneṣv atrā dadhe amṛtaṃ jātavedāḥ //
analyzed: jūryatsu agniḥ ajaraḥ vaneṣu atrā dadhe amṛtam jātavedāḥ
translated: Agni, the immortal one, is placed here in the woods, in the moving ones, in the born ones.

original: amanthiṣṭām bhāratā revad agniṃ devaśravā devavātaḥ sudakṣam /
analyzed: amanthiṣṭām bhāratā revat agnim deva śravāḥ deva vātaḥ su dakṣam
translated: The Bharatas have churned out the glorious Agni, the god-invoking, well-blowing, very skillful one.

original: agne vi paśya bṛhatābhi rāyeṣāṃ no netā bhavatād anu dyūn //
analyzed: agne vi paśya bṛhatā abhi rāyā iṣām naḥ netā bhavatāt anu dyūn
translated: O Agni, look with the great one upon their riches. Be our leader for days.

original: daśa kṣipaḥ pūrvyaṃ sīm ajījanan sujātam mātṛṣu priyam /
analyzed: daśa kṣipaḥ pūrvyam sīm ajījanan su jātam mātṛṣu priyam
translated: The ten fingers have generated the ancient, well-born, dear one among the mothers.

original: agniṃ stuhi daivavātaṃ devaśravo yo janānām asad vaśī //
analyzed: agnim stuhi daiva vātam deva śravaḥ yaḥ janānām asat vaśī
translated: Praise Agni, the god-invoking, the lord of people, who is well-known among the gods.

original: ni tvā dadhe vara ā pṛthivyā iḷāyās pade sudinatve ahnām /🔽dṛṣadvatyām mānuṣa āpayāyāṃ sarasvatyāṃ revad agne didīhi //
analyzed: ni tvā dadhe vare ā pṛthivyāḥ iḷāyāḥ pade su dina tve ahnām  dṛṣadvatyām mānuṣe āpayāyām sarasvatyām revat agne didīhi
translated: I have placed you as a guest on the earth, in the abode of Iḷā, in the good days.🔽Shine forth, O Agni, gloriously on the Dṛṣadvatī, the human river, the Sarasvatī.

original: iḷām agne purudaṃsaṃ saniṃ goḥ śaśvattamaṃ havamānāya sādha /
analyzed: iḷām agne purudaṃsam sanim goḥ śaśvattamam havamānāya sādha
translated: O Agni, grant the generous, the most enduring, the gain of cattle, to him who invokes you.

original: syān naḥ sūnus tanayo vijāvāgne sā te sumatir bhūtv asme //
analyzed: syāt naḥ sūnuḥ tanayaḥ vijāvā agne sā te sumatiḥ bhūtu asme
translated: May we have a son, a child, offspring, O Agni. May that be thy gracious will to us.

original: agne sahasva pṛtanā abhimātīr apāsya /
analyzed: agne sahasva pṛtanāḥ abhimātīḥ apāsya
translated: O Agni, conquer the battles and repel the hostilities.

original: duṣṭaras tarann arātīr varco dhā yajñavāhase //
analyzed: duṣṭaraḥ taran arātīḥ varcaḥ dhāḥ yajña vāhase
translated: Be thou the repeller of hostilities, and bestow splendour on the carrier of the sacrifice.

original: agna iḷā sam idhyase vītihotro amartyaḥ /
analyzed: agne iḷā sam idhyase vītihotraḥ amartyaḥ
translated: O Agni, I kindle thee, the immortal, the bearer of oblations.

original: juṣasva sū no adhvaram //
analyzed: juṣasva su u naḥ adhvaram
translated: Accept our sacrifice.

original: agne dyumnena jāgṛve sahasaḥ sūnav āhuta /
analyzed: agne dyumnena jāgṛve sahasaḥ sūno āhuta
translated: O Agni, son of strength, to be watched with glory, invoked,

original: edam barhiḥ sado mama //
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ sadaḥ mama
translated: Sit on this strew, my seat.

original: agne viśvebhir agnibhir devebhir mahayā giraḥ /
analyzed: agne viśvebhiḥ agnibhiḥ devebhiḥ mahaya giraḥ
translated: O Agni, with all the fires, with the gods, exalt the praises,

original: yajñeṣu ya u cāyavaḥ //
analyzed: yajñeṣu ye u cāyavaḥ
translated: He who is in the sacrifices and who is to come.

original: agne dā dāśuṣe rayiṃ vīravantam parīṇasam /
analyzed: agne dāḥ dāśuṣe rayim vīravantam parīṇasam
translated: O Agni, grant wealth to the worshipper, with heroes, with abundance.

original: śiśīhi naḥ sūnumataḥ //
analyzed: śiśīhi naḥ sūnumataḥ
translated: Sharpen us for the sake of sons.

original: agne divaḥ sūnur asi pracetās tanā pṛthivyā uta viśvavedāḥ /
analyzed: agne divaḥ sūnuḥ asi pracetāḥ tanā pṛthivyāḥ uta viśva vedāḥ
translated: O Agni, thou art the son of heaven, the wise one, and of the earth, the all-knowing one.

original: ṛdhag devāṃ iha yajā cikitvaḥ //
analyzed: ṛdhak devān iha yaja ā cikitvaḥ
translated: Worship the gods here, O thou who knowest.

original: agniḥ sanoti vīryāṇi vidvān sanoti vājam amṛtāya bhūṣan /
analyzed: agniḥ sanoti vīryāṇi vidvān sanoti vājam amṛtāya bhūṣan
translated: Agni, the wise one, bestows manly powers, bestows strength, adorning himself for the immortal.

original: sa no devāṃ eha vahā purukṣo //
analyzed: sa naḥ devān ā iha vaha purukṣo
translated: O thou of much strength, bring the gods to us.

original: agnir dyāvāpṛthivī viśvajanye ā bhāti devī amṛte amūraḥ /
analyzed: agniḥ dyāvāpṛthivī viśvajanye ā bhāti devī amṛte amūraḥ
translated: Agni, the wise one, the son of heaven, shines over the all-supporting heaven and earth, the immortal goddess.

original: kṣayan vājaiḥ puruścandro namobhiḥ //
analyzed: kṣayan vājaiḥ puru ścandraḥ namobhiḥ
translated: Waxing with strength, with praises, the much-desired one.

original: agna indraś ca dāśuṣo duroṇe sutāvato yajñam ihopa yātam /
analyzed: agne indraḥ ca dāśuṣaḥ duroṇe sutāvataḥ yajñam iha upa yātam
translated: Agni and Indra, come to the sacrifice of the worshipper in his house, to the one who has pressed the Soma.

original: amardhantā somapeyāya devā //
analyzed: amardhantā soma peyāya devā
translated: Immortal, O gods, for the drinking of the Soma.

original: agne apāṃ sam idhyase duroṇe nityaḥ sūno sahaso jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: agne apām sam idhyase duroṇe nityaḥ sūno sahasaḥ jātavedaḥ
translated: O Agni, in the house of the waters you are kindled, eternal, O son of strength, O all-knower.

original: sadhasthāni mahayamāna ūtī //
analyzed: sadhasthāni mahayamānaḥ ūtī
translated: Magnifying the abodes with your help.

original: vaiśvānaram manasāgniṃ nicāyyā haviṣmanto anuṣatyaṃ svarvidam /
analyzed: vaiśvānaram manasā agnim nicāyyāḥ haviṣmantaḥ anuṣatyam svar vidam
translated: Having kindled in our hearts the fire Vaiśvānara, the one who follows the oblations, the finder of heaven,

original: sudānuṃ devaṃ rathiraṃ vasūyavo gīrbhī raṇvaṃ kuśikāso havāmahe //
analyzed: sudānum devam rathiram vasūyavaḥ gīrbhiḥ raṇvam kuśikāsaḥ havāmahe
translated: The bountiful god, the charioteer, we, the Kuśikas, desirous of wealth, invoke with our hymns the one who is to be delighted.

original: taṃ śubhram agnim avase havāmahe vaiśvānaram mātariśvānam ukthyam /
analyzed: tam śubhram agnim avase havāmahe vaiśvānaram mātariśvānam ukthyam
translated: We invoke that bright Agni for help, Vaiśvānara, Mātariśvan, worthy of praise,

original: bṛhaspatim manuṣo devatātaye vipraṃ śrotāram atithiṃ raghuṣyadam //
analyzed: bṛhaspatim manuṣaḥ devatātaye vipram śrotāram atithim raghuṣyadam
translated: Brihaspati, the god of human beings, the sage, the listener, the guest, the swift one.

original: aśvo na krandañ janibhiḥ sam idhyate vaiśvānaraḥ kuśikebhir yugeyuge /🔽sa no agniḥ suvīryaṃ svaśvyaṃ dadhātu ratnam amṛteṣu jāgṛviḥ //
analyzed: aśvaḥ na krandam janibhiḥ sam idhyate vaiśvānaraḥ kuśikebhiḥ yuge yuge  sa naḥ agniḥ su vīryam su aśvyam dadhātu ratnam amṛteṣu jāgṛviḥ
translated: Like a horse neighing, he is kindled with the clans, Vaiśvānara, by the Kuśikas in every age.🔽May that Agni bestow upon us good heroism, good horsemanship, treasure, the watchful one among the immortals.

original: pra yantu vājās taviṣībhir agnayaḥ śubhe sammiślāḥ pṛṣatīr ayukṣata /
analyzed: pra yantu vājāḥ taviṣībhiḥ agnayaḥ śubhe sammiślāḥ pṛṣatīḥ ayukṣata
translated: Let the mighty ones go forth with their powers, the fires, in the auspicious one, the spotted ones have been yoked together.

original: bṛhadukṣo maruto viśvavedasaḥ pra vepayanti parvatāṃ adābhyāḥ //
analyzed: bṛhat ukṣaḥ marutaḥ viśva vedasaḥ pra vepayanti parvatān adābhyāḥ
translated: The Maruts, the great milkers, all-possessing, shake the mountains, the invincible ones.

original: agniśriyo maruto viśvakṛṣṭaya ā tveṣam ugram ava īmahe vayam /
analyzed: agni śriyaḥ marutaḥ viśvakṛṣṭayaḥ ā tveṣam ugram avaḥ īmahe vayam
translated: The Maruts, the splendours of Agni, the all-powerful, we implore for impetuous strength.

original: te svānino rudriyā varṣanirṇijaḥ siṃhā na heṣakratavaḥ sudānavaḥ //
analyzed: te svāninaḥ rudriyāḥ varṣa nirṇijaḥ siṃhāḥ na heṣa kratavaḥ sudānavaḥ
translated: They, the self-moving, the Rudras, the rain-enveloped, the lions with the strength of neighing, the bountiful,

original: vrātaṃvrātaṃ gaṇaṃgaṇaṃ suśastibhir agner bhāmam marutām oja īmahe /
analyzed: vrātam vrātam gaṇaṃgaṇam su śastibhiḥ agneḥ bhāmam marutām ojaḥ īmahe
translated: We implore with good praises the troop of troops, the band of bands, the splendour of Agni, the strength of the Maruts.

original: pṛṣadaśvāso anavabhrarādhaso gantāro yajñaṃ vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ //
analyzed: pṛṣat aśvāsaḥ anavabhra rādhasaḥ gantāraḥ yajñam vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
translated: The Maruts with spotted horses, whose aid is unfailing, the wise ones who come to the sacrifice in the assemblies,

original: agnir asmi janmanā jātavedā ghṛtam me cakṣur amṛtam ma āsan /
analyzed: agniḥ asmi janmanā jātavedāḥ ghṛtam me cakṣuḥ amṛtam me āsan
translated: I am Agni, the all-knower by birth, my eye is ghee, my seat is immortality.

original: arkas tridhātū rajaso vimāno 'jasro gharmo havir asmi nāma //
analyzed: arkaḥ tri dhātuḥ rajasaḥ vimānaḥ jasraḥ gharmaḥ haviḥ asmi nāma
translated: The sun is my threefold form, the measurer of space, the ceaseless heat, the oblation, I am the name.

original: tribhiḥ pavitrair apupod dhy arkaṃ hṛdā matiṃ jyotir anu prajānan /
analyzed: tribhiḥ pavitraiḥ apupot hi arkam hṛdā matim jyotiḥ anu prajānan
translated: With three purifiers he has purified the sun, the wise one, knowing the light, the thought in the heart.

original: varṣiṣṭhaṃ ratnam akṛta svadhābhir ād id dyāvāpṛthivī pary apaśyat //
analyzed: varṣiṣṭham ratnam akṛta svadhābhiḥ āt id dyāvāpṛthivī pari apaśyat
translated: With his own powers he has made the best treasure, and has looked around on heaven and earth.

original: śatadhāram utsam akṣīyamāṇaṃ vipaścitam pitaraṃ vaktvānām /
analyzed: śata dhāram utsam a kṣīyamāṇam vipaścitam pitaram vaktvānām
translated: The spring with a hundred streams, inexhaustible, the wise father, the speaker,

original: meḷim madantam pitror upasthe taṃ rodasī pipṛtaṃ satyavācam //
analyzed: meḷim madantam pitroḥ upasthe tam rodasī pipṛtam satya vācam
translated: The one who rejoices in the lap of his parents, may the two worlds nourish him, the one with true speech.

original: pra vo vājā abhidyavo haviṣmanto ghṛtācyā /
analyzed: pra vaḥ vājāḥ abhidyavaḥ haviṣmantaḥ ghṛtācyā
translated: Your mighty forces, rich in oblations, with ghee,

original: devāñ jigāti sumnayuḥ //
analyzed: devām jigāti sumnayuḥ
translated: Go to the gods, eager for bliss.

original: īḷe agniṃ vipaścitaṃ girā yajñasya sādhanam /
analyzed: īḍe agnim vipaścitam girā yajñasya sādhanam
translated: I praise Agni, the wise one, with a song, the performer of the sacrifice,

original: śruṣṭīvānaṃ dhitāvānam //
analyzed: śruṣṭīvānam dhitāvānam
translated: The one who listens, the one who is prepared.

original: agne śakema te vayaṃ yamaṃ devasya vājinaḥ /
analyzed: agne śakema te vayam yamam devasya vājinaḥ
translated: O Agni, may we be able to serve you, the swift messenger of the god,

original: ati dveṣāṃsi tarema //
analyzed: ati dveṣāṃsi tarema
translated: May we overcome our enemies.

original: samidhyamāno adhvare 'gniḥ pāvaka īḍyaḥ /
analyzed: samidhyamānaḥ adhvare gniḥ pāvakaḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: Agni, the purifying one, to be praised in the sacrifice,

original: śociṣkeśas tam īmahe //
analyzed: śociṣkeśaḥ tam īmahe
translated: Whose hair is flame, we invoke him.

original: pṛthupājā amartyo ghṛtanirṇik svāhutaḥ /🔽agnir yajñasya havyavāṭ //🔽taṃ sabādho yatasruca itthā dhiyā yajñavantaḥ /
analyzed: pṛthu pājāḥ amartyaḥ ghṛta nirṇij su āhutaḥ  agniḥ yajñasya havyavāṭ  tam sabādhaḥ yata srucaḥ itthā dhiyā yajñavantaḥ
translated: The one with wide paths, the immortal one, anointed with ghee, well-offered,🔽Agni, the carrier of oblations for the sacrifice.🔽The sacrificers, with their ladles ready, have brought Agni here

original: ā cakrur agnim ūtaye //
analyzed: ā cakruḥ agnim ūtaye
translated: With their thoughts, for help.

original: hotā devo amartyaḥ purastād eti māyayā /
analyzed: hotā devaḥ amartyaḥ purastāt eti māyayā
translated: The immortal god, the Hotar, goes forth in front with his magic,

original: vidathāni pracodayan //
analyzed: vidathāni pracodayan
translated: Urging the assemblies forward.

original: vājī vājeṣu dhīyate 'dhvareṣu pra ṇīyate /
analyzed: vājī vājeṣu dhīyate dhvareṣu pra nīyate
translated: The strong one is placed in the contests, led forward in the sacrifices,

original: vipro yajñasya sādhanaḥ //
analyzed: vipraḥ yajñasya sādhanaḥ
translated: The sage, the performer of the sacrifice.

original: dhiyā cakre vareṇyo bhūtānāṃ garbham ā dadhe /
analyzed: dhiyā cakre vareṇyaḥ bhūtānām garbham ā dadhe
translated: By thought he was made the most excellent, he placed the embryo of beings

original: dakṣasya pitaraṃ tanā //
analyzed: dakṣasya pitaram tanā
translated: In the womb of Daksha's father.

original: ni tvā dadhe vareṇyaṃ dakṣasyeḷā sahaskṛta /
analyzed: ni tvā dadhe vareṇyam dakṣasya iḷā sahaskṛta
translated: I have placed thee, most excellent, the companion of Daksha, the performer of a hundred (sacrifices),

original: agne sudītim uśijam //🔽agniṃ yanturam apturam ṛtasya yoge vanuṣaḥ /
analyzed: agne su dītim uśijam  agnim yanturam ap turam ṛtasya yoge
translated: I have placed thee, the most excellent, the companion of Daksha's joy, O Agni, the well-shining, the eager one.

original: viprā vājaiḥ sam indhate //🔽ūrjo napātam adhvare dīdivāṃsam upa dyavi /
analyzed: viprāḥ vājaiḥ sam indhate  ūrjaḥ napātam adhvare dīdivāṃsam upa dyavi
translated: Agni, the charioteer, the swift one, the sages, the worshippers, at the union of truth, kindle thee with their strength.

original: agnim īḷe kavikratum //
analyzed: agnim īḍe kavi kratum
translated: The son of strength, the shining one, in the sacrifice, in the sky, I worship Agni, of wise resolve.

original: īḷenyo namasyas tiras tamāṃsi darśataḥ /🔽sam agnir idhyate vṛṣā //
analyzed: īḍenyaḥ namasyaḥ tiras tamāṃsi darśataḥ  sam agniḥ idhyate vṛṣā
translated: Worthy of worship, to be revered, passing over the darkness, the manifest one,🔽Agni is kindled, the strong one.

original: vṛṣo agniḥ sam idhyate 'śvo na devavāhanaḥ /
analyzed: vṛṣaḥ agniḥ sam idhyate śvas na deva vāhanaḥ
translated: The strong Agni is kindled, like a horse, the bearer of the gods.

original: taṃ haviṣmanta īḷate //
analyzed: tam haviṣmantaḥ īḍate
translated: The worshippers invoke him.

original: vṛṣaṇaṃ tvā vayaṃ vṛṣan vṛṣaṇaḥ sam idhīmahi /
analyzed: vṛṣaṇam tvā vayam vṛṣan vṛṣaṇaḥ sam idhīmahi
translated: O strong one, we, the strong ones, kindle thee, the strong one, O strong one.

original: agne dīdyatam bṛhat //
analyzed: agne dīdyatam bṛhat
translated: Shine forth, O Agni, with great splendor.

original: agne juṣasva no haviḥ puroḷāśaṃ jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: agne juṣasva naḥ haviḥ puroḷāśam jātavedaḥ
translated: O Agni, enjoy our oblation, the cake, O all-knower,

original: prātaḥsāve dhiyāvaso //
analyzed: prātaḥsāve dhiyāvaso
translated: at the morning pressing, O you who possess wisdom.

original: puroḷā agne pacatas tubhyaṃ vā ghā pariṣkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: puroḷās agne pacataḥ tubhyam vā gha pariṣkṛtaḥ
translated: The cakes, O Agni, are prepared for you, or even purified.

original: taṃ juṣasva yaviṣṭhya //
analyzed: tam juṣasva yaviṣṭhya
translated: Enjoy them, O youngest one.

original: agne vīhi puroḷāśam āhutaṃ tiroahnyam /
analyzed: agne vīhi puroḍāśam āhutam tiroahnyam
translated: O Agni, come to the cake, offered across the day,

original: sahasaḥ sūnur asy adhvare hitaḥ //
analyzed: sahasaḥ sūnuḥ asi adhvare hitaḥ
translated: you are the son of strength, placed in the sacrifice.

original: mādhyandine savane jātavedaḥ puroḷāśam iha kave juṣasva /
analyzed: mādhyandine savane jātavedaḥ puroḷāśam iha kave juṣasva
translated: O all-knower, at the midday pressing, enjoy here the cake, O wise one,

original: agne yahvasya tava bhāgadheyaṃ na pra minanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ //
analyzed: agne yahvasya tava bhāgadheyam na pra minanti vidatheṣu dhīrāḥ
translated: O Agni, the wise ones do not diminish your share in the sacrifices, O mighty one.

original: agne tṛtīye savane hi kāniṣaḥ puroḷāśaṃ sahasaḥ sūnav āhutam /
analyzed: agne tṛtīye savane hi kāniṣaḥ puroḷāśam sahasaḥ sūno āhutam
translated: O Agni, at the third libation, O son of strength, you enjoy the cake offered in the fire.

original: athā deveṣv adhvaraṃ vipanyayā dhā ratnavantam amṛteṣu jāgṛvim //
analyzed: athā deveṣu adhvaram vipanyayā dhāḥ ratnavantam amṛteṣu jāgṛvim
translated: Then, with your all-embracing power, establish the sacrifice among the gods, watchful among the immortals, rich in treasures.

original: agne vṛdhāna āhutim puroḷāśaṃ jātavedaḥ /
analyzed: agne vṛdhānaḥ āhutim puroḍāśam jātavedaḥ
translated: O Agni, the all-knowing one, enjoy the increasing oblation, the cake.

original: juṣasva tiroahnyam //
analyzed: juṣasva tiroahnyam
translated: Accept it for the night.

original: astīdam adhimanthanam asti prajananaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: asti idam adhimanthanam asti prajananam kṛtam
translated: Here is the churning wood, here is the act of generation performed.

original: etāṃ viśpatnīm ā bharāgnim manthāma pūrvathā //
analyzed: etām viś patnīm ā bhara agnim manthāma pūrvathā
translated: Bring this wife of the clan, we will churn Agni as before.

original: araṇyor nihito jātavedā garbha iva sudhito garbhiṇīṣu /
analyzed: araṇyoḥ nihitaḥ jātavedāḥ garbhaḥ iva sudhitaḥ garbhiṇīṣu
translated: Jatavedas, placed in the kindling woods, like a well-disposed embryo in the pregnant ones,

original: divediva īḍyo jāgṛvadbhir haviṣmadbhir manuṣyebhir agniḥ //
analyzed: dive dive īḍyaḥ jāgṛvadbhiḥ haviṣmadbhiḥ manuṣyebhiḥ agniḥ
translated: Agni, to be worshipped day by day by the watchful ones, by men who offer oblations.

original: uttānāyām ava bharā cikitvān sadyaḥ pravītā vṛṣaṇaṃ jajāna /
analyzed: uttānāyām ava bhara cikitvān sadyas pravītā vṛṣaṇam jajāna
translated: Laying it down on the outstretched (earth), the wise one gave birth to the powerful one immediately.

original: aruṣastūpo ruśad asya pāja iḷāyās putro vayune 'janiṣṭa //
analyzed: aruṣa stūpaḥ ruśat asya pājaḥ iḷāyāḥ putraḥ vayune janiṣṭa
translated: His topknot is red, his radiance is bright. The son of Iḷā was born at the proper time.

original: iḷāyās tvā pade vayaṃ nābhā pṛthivyā adhi /
analyzed: iḷāyāḥ tvā pade vayam nābhā pṛthivyāḥ adhi
translated: We place you in the abode of Iḷā, on the navel of the earth.

original: jātavedo ni dhīmahy agne havyāya voḷhave //
analyzed: jātavedaḥ ni dhīmahi agne havyāya voḷhave
translated: O all-knowing Agni, we establish you for the offering, for the carrying of oblations.

original: manthatā naraḥ kavim advayantam pracetasam amṛtaṃ supratīkam /
analyzed: manthata naraḥ kavim advayantam pracetasam amṛtam su pratīkam
translated: Men churn the matchless sage, the wise one, the immortal, the well-formed one.

original: yajñasya ketum prathamam purastād agniṃ naro janayatā suśevam //
analyzed: yajñasya ketum prathamam purastāt agnim naraḥ janayata su śevam
translated: The banner of the sacrifice, the first in front, men generate Agni, the very gracious one.

original: yadī manthanti bāhubhir vi rocate 'śvo na vājy aruṣo vaneṣv ā /
analyzed: yadī manthanti bāhubhiḥ vi rocate śvas na vājī aruṣaḥ vaneṣu ā
translated: When they churn him with their arms, he shines forth, like a red horse, a steed, in the woods.

original: citro na yāmann aśvinor anivṛtaḥ pari vṛṇakty aśmanas tṛṇā dahan //
analyzed: citraḥ na yāman aśvinoḥ anivṛtaḥ pari vṛṇakti aśmanaḥ tṛṇā dahan
translated: Unrestrained, like a horse in the path of the Ashvins, he encircles the grass with the stone, burning it.

original: jāto agnī rocate cekitāno vājī vipraḥ kaviśastaḥ sudānuḥ /
analyzed: jātaḥ agniḥ rocate cekitānaḥ vājī vipraḥ kavi śastaḥ sudānuḥ
translated: Born, Agni shines, the all-knower, the strong one, the sage, praised by the wise, the bountiful one.

original: yaṃ devāsa īḍyaṃ viśvavidaṃ havyavāham adadhur adhvareṣu //
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ īḍyam viśva vidam havyavāham adadhuḥ adhvareṣu
translated: Whom the gods have placed in the oblations, the all-knowing one, the bearer of oblations, in the sacrifices.

original: sīda hotaḥ sva u loke cikitvān sādayā yajñaṃ sukṛtasya yonau /
analyzed: sīda hotar sve u loke cikitvān sādaya yajñam sukṛtasya yonau
translated: Sit as Hotar in your own world, O wise one, seat the sacrifice in the womb of good deeds.

original: devāvīr devān haviṣā yajāsy agne bṛhad yajamāne vayo dhāḥ //
analyzed: devāvīḥ devān haviṣā yajāsi agne bṛhat yajamāne vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: You who will worship the gods with oblations, O Agni, bestow great strength on the sacrificer.

original: kṛṇota dhūmaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ sakhāyo 'sredhanta itana vājam accha /
analyzed: kṛṇota dhūmam vṛṣaṇam sakhāyo sredhantaḥ itana vājam accha
translated: Make the smoke strong, O friends, striving for food, go forth for the sake of strength.

original: ayam agniḥ pṛtanāṣāṭ suvīro yena devāso asahanta dasyūn //
analyzed: ayam agniḥ pṛtanāṣāh su vīraḥ yena devāsaḥ asahanta dasyūn
translated: This Agni is the conqueror in battles, with the good hero, by whom the gods conquered the Dasas.

original: ayaṃ te yonir ṛtviyo yato jāto arocathāḥ /
analyzed: ayam te yoniḥ ṛtviyaḥ yatas jātaḥ arocathāḥ
translated: This is your natural birth-place, from which you have shone forth.

original: taṃ jānann agna ā sīdāthā no vardhayā giraḥ //
analyzed: tam jānan agne ā sīda atha ā naḥ vardhaya giraḥ
translated: Knowing him, O Agni, come, and then exalt our songs.

original: tanūnapād ucyate garbha āsuro narāśaṃso bhavati yad vijāyate /
analyzed: tanūnapāt ucyate garbhaḥ āsuraḥ narāśaṃsaḥ bhavati yat vijāyate
translated: Tanūnapāt is called the embryo, the Asura, Narāśaṁsa, when he is born.

original: mātariśvā yad amimīta mātari vātasya sargo abhavat sarīmaṇi //
analyzed: mātariśvā yat amimīta mātari vātasya sargaḥ abhavat sarīmaṇi
translated: When he measures in the mother, the creation of the wind becomes in the swift one.

original: sunirmathā nirmathitaḥ sunidhā nihitaḥ kaviḥ /
analyzed: sunirmathā nirmathitaḥ sunidhā nihitaḥ kaviḥ
translated: Well-broken, he is broken; well-placed, he is placed, the wise one.

original: agne svadhvarā kṛṇu devān devayate yaja //
analyzed: agne su adhvarā kṛṇu devān devayate yaja
translated: O Agni, make our sacrifices successful; worship the gods for the worshipper.

original: ajījanann amṛtam martyāso 'sremāṇaṃ taraṇiṃ vīḷujambham /
analyzed: ajījanan amṛtam martyāsaḥ sremāṇam taraṇim vīḍu jambham
translated: The mortals have generated the immortal, the irresistible, the swift one, the thunder-armed.

original: daśa svasāro agruvaḥ samīcīḥ pumāṃsaṃ jātam abhi saṃ rabhante //
analyzed: daśa svasāraḥ agruvaḥ samīcīḥ pumāṃsam jātam abhi sam rabhante
translated: The ten sisters, the unwedded, the simultaneous, embrace the male who is born.

original: pra saptahotā sanakād arocata mātur upasthe yad aśocad ūdhani /
analyzed: pra saptahotā sanakāt arocata mātuḥ upasthe yat aśocat ūdhani
translated: The seven-priest shone forth from the beginning, when he glowed in the mother's lap, in the udder.

original: na ni miṣati suraṇo divedive yad asurasya jaṭharād ajāyata //
analyzed: na ni miṣati suraṇaḥ dive dive yat asurasya jaṭharāt ajāyata
translated: The swift one does not wink, day by day, when he was born from the belly of the Asura.

original: amitrāyudho marutām iva prayāḥ prathamajā brahmaṇo viśvam id viduḥ /
analyzed: amitrāyudhaḥ marutām iva prayāḥ prathama jāḥ brahmaṇaḥ viśvam id viduḥ
translated: Like the Maruts, the weapons of the foe, the first-born know all the Brahman of the Kuśikas, who have brilliant Brahman.

original: dyumnavad brahma kuśikāsa erira ekaeko dame agniṃ sam īdhire //
analyzed: dyumnavat brahma kuśikāsaḥ erire ekaikaḥ dame agnim sam īdhire
translated: Each one alone in his house has kindled Agni.

original: yad adya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotaś cikitvo 'vṛṇīmahīha /
analyzed: yat adya tvā prayati yajñe asmin hotar cikitvaḥ vṛṇīmahi iha
translated: Since today, O you who are to be worshipped, we have chosen you here, O Hotar, O you who are to be worshipped, in this sacrifice.

original: dhruvam ayā dhruvam utāśamiṣṭhāḥ prajānan vidvāṃ upa yāhi somam //
analyzed: dhruvam ayāḥ dhruvam uta aśamiṣṭhāḥ prajānan vidvān upa yāhi somam
translated: Thou art firmly fixed, and firmly standest for the sacrifice: knowing, wise, come to the Soma.

original: icchanti tvā somyāsaḥ sakhāyaḥ sunvanti somaṃ dadhati prayāṃsi /
analyzed: icchanti tvā somyāsaḥ sakhāyaḥ sunvanti somam dadhati prayāṃsi
translated: Thy friends who love the Soma long for thee: they press the Soma, and prepare the viands.

original: titikṣante abhiśastiṃ janānām indra tvad ā kaś cana hi praketaḥ //
analyzed: titikṣante abhiśastim janānām indra tvat ā kaḥ cana hi praketaḥ
translated: They bear the people's curse patiently: none, Indra, is a match for thee in battle.

original: na te dūre paramā cid rajāṃsy ā tu pra yāhi harivo haribhyām /
analyzed: na te dūre paramā cit rajāṃsi ā tu pra yāhi harivas haribhyām
translated: Not far away are all thy pathways: come hither, O thou whose wealth is horses, with thy Bay Steeds.

original: sthirāya vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtemā yuktā grāvāṇaḥ samidhāne agnau //
analyzed: sthirāya vṛṣṇe savanā kṛtā imā yuktāḥ grāvāṇaḥ samidhāne agnau
translated: For the strong God have these libations been prepared: the pressing-stones are set in order, and the fire is kindled.

original: indraḥ suśipro maghavā tarutro mahāvrātas tuvikūrmir ṛghāvān /
analyzed: indraḥ su śipraḥ maghavā tarutraḥ mahā vrātaḥ tuvikūrmiḥ ṛghāvān
translated: Indra, the fair-browed, the wealthy, the deliverer, the mighty troop-leader, the far-spreading, the impetuous,

original: yad ugro dhā bādhito martyeṣu kva tyā te vṛṣabha vīryāṇi //
analyzed: yat ugraḥ dhāḥ bādhitaḥ martyeṣu kva tyā te vṛṣabha vīryāṇi
translated: When, O thou Strong One, thou hast been invoked by mortal men, where are thy hero deeds, O Bull?

original: tvaṃ hi ṣmā cyāvayann acyutāny eko vṛtrā carasi jighnamānaḥ /
analyzed: tvam hi sma ā cyāvayan acyutāni ekaḥ vṛtrā carasi jighnamānaḥ
translated: For thou alone, O Indra, shaking off the unmoving ones, goest about destroying Vr̥itras.

original: tava dyāvāpṛthivī parvatāso 'nu vratāya nimiteva tasthuḥ //
analyzed: tava dyāvāpṛthivī parvatāsaḥ nu vratāya nimitā iva tasthuḥ
translated: Even Dyaus and Prithivī, and all the mountains stand in awe of thee, as of a mighty king.

original: utābhaye puruhūta śravobhir eko dṛḷham avado vṛtrahā san /
analyzed: uta abhaye puruhūta śravobhiḥ ekaḥ dṛḍham avadaḥ vṛtrahā san
translated: And, O much-invoked! thou, being alone, art the strong Vr̥itra-slayer in the world of men, through thy great glory.

original: ime cid indra rodasī apāre yat saṃgṛbhṇā maghavan kāśir it te //
analyzed: ime cit indra rodasī apāre yat saṃgṛbhṇāḥ maghavan kāśiḥ id te
translated: Even these two worlds, O Indra, these two boundless worlds, are held in check, O Maghavan, as if by a covenant.

original: pra sū ta indra pravatā haribhyām pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇann etu śatrūn /
analyzed: pra su u te indra pravatā haribhyām pra te vajraḥ pramṛṇan etu śatrūn
translated: Drive forth thy bolt, O Indra, with thy two Bay Horses: let thy bolt go forth, O Indra, smiting the foemen.

original: jahi pratīco anūcaḥ parāco viśvaṃ satyaṃ kṛṇuhi viṣṭam astu //
analyzed: jahi pratīcaḥ anūcaḥ parācaḥ viśvam satyam kṛṇuhi viṣṭam astu
translated: Destroy the western and the northern sorceresses: make all thy promise true: let all be settled.

original: yasmai dhāyur adadhā martyāyābhaktaṃ cid bhajate gehyaṃ saḥ /🔽bhadrā ta indra sumatir ghṛtācī sahasradānā puruhūta rātiḥ //
analyzed: yasmai dhāyuḥ adadhāḥ martyāya a bhaktam cit bhajate gehyam saḥ  bhadrā te indra sumatiḥ ghṛtācī sahasra dānā puruhūta rātiḥ
translated: To him whom thou hast made thy mortal servant, even him, O Indra, who is not to be deceived, give the house.🔽O Indra, most invoked, thy gracious favour, thy gift of fatness, and thy bounty, O thou who givest a thousand gifts, are good.

original: sahadānum puruhūta kṣiyantam ahastam indra sam piṇak kuṇārum /
analyzed: saha dānum puruhūta kṣiyantam ahastam indra sam piṇak kuṇārum
translated: Thou, O thou most invoked, hast crushed with thy strength, O Indra, the exulting, handless Kuṇâru, who dwelt with Dânu.

original: abhi vṛtraṃ vardhamānam piyārum apādam indra tavasā jaghantha //
analyzed: abhi vṛtram vardhamānam piyārum a pādam indra tavasā jaghantha
translated: Thou, O Indra, with thy strength hast smitten down the footless Vr̥itra, who waxed in bulk and grew.

original: ni sāmanām iṣirām indra bhūmim mahīm apārāṃ sadane sasattha /🔽astabhnād dyāṃ vṛṣabho antarikṣam arṣantv āpas tvayeha prasūtāḥ //
analyzed: ni sāmanām iṣirām indra bhūmim mahīm apārām sadane sasattha  astabhnāt dyām vṛṣabhaḥ antarikṣam arṣantu āpaḥ tvayā iha prasūtāḥ
translated: In the abode thou hast established the mighty, the broad, the boundless earth, O Indra, with thy power.🔽Let the waters, urged by thee, flow hitherward: the Bull hath propped the sky and the air's mid-region.

original: alātṛṇo vala indra vrajo goḥ purā hantor bhayamāno vy āra /
analyzed: alātṛṇaḥ valaḥ indra vrajaḥ goḥ purā hantoḥ bhayamānaḥ vi āra
translated: The stall of kine, O Indra, is the Vr̥itra-slayer's: the cow-pen, O thou to be feared, was emptied before the slaughter.

original: sugān patho akṛṇon niraje gāḥ prāvan vāṇīḥ puruhūtaṃ dhamantīḥ //
analyzed: su gān pathaḥ akṛṇot niraje gāḥ prāvan vāṇīḥ puruhūtam dhamantīḥ
translated: He hath made the paths easy to travel: the cows have flowed to the unploughed land, the voices, singing, have flowed to the Most Invoked.

original: eko dve vasumatī samīcī indra ā paprau pṛthivīm uta dyām /
analyzed: ekaḥ dve vasumatī samīcī indraḥ ā paprau pṛthivīm uta dyām
translated: Alone, O Indra, thou hast filled the two worlds, the earth and the sky, that are in harmony together.

original: utāntarikṣād abhi naḥ samīka iṣo rathīḥ sayujaḥ śūra vājān //
analyzed: uta antarikṣāt abhi naḥ samīke iṣaḥ rathīḥ sayujaḥ śūra vājān
translated: And from the atmosphere, O hero, send us food, chariots, and teams of horses, O thou who art yoked with the Maruts.

original: diśaḥ sūryo na mināti pradiṣṭā divedive haryaśvaprasūtāḥ /
analyzed: diśaḥ sūryaḥ na mināti pradiṣṭāḥ dive dive haryaśva prasūtāḥ
translated: The quarters, well-defined by the sun, are not transgressed, day by day, impelled by the bay steeds.

original: saṃ yad ānaḷ adhvana ād id aśvair vimocanaṃ kṛṇute tat tv asya //
analyzed: sam yat ānaṭ adhvanaḥ āt id aśvaiḥ vimocanam kṛṇute tat tu asya
translated: When he has brought them together on the path, then he sets them free with the horses, that is his work.

original: didṛkṣanta uṣaso yāmann aktor vivasvatyā mahi citram anīkam /
analyzed: didṛkṣantaḥ uṣasaḥ yāman aktoḥ vivasvatyāḥ mahi citram anīkam
translated: The dawns, in the path of the rising sun, desire to see the great and wonderful appearance of the sun.

original: viśve jānanti mahinā yad āgād indrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi //
analyzed: viśve jānanti mahinā yat āgāt indrasya karma su kṛtā purūṇi
translated: All know by their greatness when he has come, the many well-performed deeds of Indra.

original: mahi jyotir nihitaṃ vakṣaṇāsv āmā pakvaṃ carati bibhratī gauḥ /🔽viśvaṃ svādma sambhṛtam usriyāyāṃ yat sīm indro adadhād bhojanāya //
analyzed: mahi jyotiḥ nihitam vakṣaṇāsu āmā pakvam carati bibhratī gauḥ  viśvam svādma sambhṛtam usriyāyām yat sīm indraḥ adadhāt bhojanāya
translated: Great is the light placed in the womb, the cow moves bearing raw and cooked food.🔽All sweetness is collected in the cow, which Indra has placed for his nourishment.

original: indra dṛhya yāmakośā abhūvan yajñāya śikṣa gṛṇate sakhibhyaḥ /
analyzed: indra dṛhya yāma kośāḥ abhūvan yajñāya śikṣa gṛṇate sakhibhyaḥ
translated: O Indra, be reconciled, the treasures have been laid up. Be ready for the sacrifice, for the singer, for the friends.

original: durmāyavo durevā martyāso niṣaṅgiṇo ripavo hantvāsaḥ //
analyzed: durmāyavaḥ durevāḥ martyāsaḥ niṣaṅgiṇaḥ ripavaḥ hantvāsaḥ
translated: The mortals who are of evil thought, of evil deeds, the bowmen, the enemies, the slayers, may they perish.

original: saṃ ghoṣaḥ śṛṇve 'vamair amitrair jahī ny eṣv aśaniṃ tapiṣṭhām /
analyzed: sam ghoṣaḥ śṛṇve vamaiḥ amitraiḥ jahi ni eṣu aśanim tapiṣṭhām
translated: I hear the shout of the low ones, of the enemies. Strike them down with thy most burning thunderbolt.

original: vṛścem adhastād vi rujā sahasva jahi rakṣo maghavan randhayasva //
analyzed: vṛśca īm adhastāt vi ruja sahasva jahi rakṣaḥ maghavan randhayasva
translated: Crush them beneath, rend them asunder, be victorious. Slay the Raksases, O mighty one, destroy them.

original: ud vṛha rakṣaḥ sahamūlam indra vṛścā madhyam praty agraṃ śṛṇīhi /
analyzed: ud vṛha rakṣaḥ saha mūlam indra vṛśca madhyam prati agram śṛṇīhi
translated: Uproot Rakshas with its roots, O Indra, and crush its middle and its top to pieces.

original: ā kīvataḥ salalūkaṃ cakartha brahmadviṣe tapuṣiṃ hetim asya //
analyzed: ā kīvataḥ salalūkam cakartha brahma dviṣe tapuṣim hetim asya
translated: Thou hast made the dart of Tvashtar keen against the man who hates devotion.

original: svastaye vājibhiś ca praṇetaḥ saṃ yan mahīr iṣa āsatsi pūrvīḥ /🔽rāyo vantāro bṛhataḥ syāmāsme astu bhaga indra prajāvān //
analyzed: svastaye vājibhiḥ ca praṇetar sam yat mahīḥ iṣaḥ āsatsi pūrvīḥ  rāyaḥ vantāraḥ bṛhataḥ syāma asme astu bhagaḥ indra prajāvān
translated: For welfare, O thou who leadest with strong steeds, sittest thou down to enjoy the many great viands.🔽May we be the supporters of great wealth. Be thou, O Indra, the bestower of prosperity and offspring.

original: ā no bhara bhagam indra dyumantaṃ ni te deṣṇasya dhīmahi prareke /
analyzed: ā naḥ bhara bhagam indra dyumantam ni te deṣṇasya dhīmahi prareke
translated: Bring us, O Indra, glorious fortune. We will think of the bounty of thee who art bountiful in the van.

original: ūrva iva paprathe kāmo asme tam ā pṛṇa vasupate vasūnām //
analyzed: ūrvaḥ iva paprathe kāmaḥ asme tam ā pṛṇa vasu pate vasūnām
translated: Desire hath spread itself like a wide plain among us. Fulfil that desire, O thou who art the lord of treasures, of treasures.

original: imaṃ kāmam mandayā gobhir aśvaiś candravatā rādhasā paprathaś ca /🔽svaryavo matibhis tubhyaṃ viprā indrāya vāhaḥ kuśikāso akran //
analyzed: imam kāmam mandayā gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ candravatā rādhasā paprathaḥ ca  svaryavaḥ matibhiḥ tubhyam viprāḥ indrāya vāhaḥ kuśikāsaḥ akran
translated: Satisfy this desire of mine with kine and horses, and with wealth that is rich in horses.🔽The singers, rich in wealth, have brought a present to Indra, the bountiful, with their hymns.

original: ā no gotrā dardṛhi gopate gāḥ sam asmabhyaṃ sanayo yantu vājāḥ /
analyzed: ā naḥ gotrā dardṛhi gopate gāḥ sam asmabhyam sanayaḥ yantu vājāḥ
translated: O lord of kine, open to us the stalls of kine. To us let the treasures come, the treasures of strength.

original: divakṣā asi vṛṣabha satyaśuṣmo 'smabhyaṃ su maghavan bodhi godāḥ //
analyzed: divakṣāḥ asi vṛṣabha satya śuṣma u smabhyam su maghavan bodhi go dāḥ
translated: Thou art the wish of heaven, O bull, whose strength is true. Be thou, O bountiful one, a giver of cattle to us.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We will invoke the bountiful Maghavan Indra, the best of heroes, in this fight for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: Hearing him, the terrible one, for help in battles, slaying the Vr̥itras, the conqueror of treasures.

original: śāsad vahnir duhitur naptyaṃ gād vidvāṃ ṛtasya dīdhitiṃ saparyan /
analyzed: śāsat vahniḥ duhituḥ naptyam gāt vidvān ṛtasya dīdhitim saparyan
translated: The priest, ruling over the grandson of his daughter, knowing the light of holy order, worshipping.

original: pitā yatra duhituḥ sekam ṛñjan saṃ śagmyena manasā dadhanve //
analyzed: pitā yatra duhituḥ sekam ṛñjan sam śagmyena manasā dadhanve
translated: Where the father, longing for the daughter's impregnation, flows with a kindly mind.

original: na jāmaye tānvo riktham āraik cakāra garbhaṃ sanitur nidhānam /
analyzed: na jāmaye tānvaḥ riktham āraik cakāra garbham sanituḥ nidhānam
translated: Not giving the inheritance to the daughter's son, he made the embryo the treasure of the winner.

original: yadī mātaro janayanta vahnim anyaḥ kartā sukṛtor anya ṛndhan //
analyzed: yadī mātaraḥ janayanta vahnim anyaḥ kartā su kṛtoḥ anyaḥ ṛndhan
translated: When the mothers bring forth the fire, one makes the well-made, another produces.

original: agnir jajñe juhvā rejamāno mahas putrāṃ aruṣasya prayakṣe /🔽mahān garbho mahy ā jātam eṣām mahī pravṛd dharyaśvasya yajñaiḥ //
analyzed: agniḥ jajñe juhvā rejamānaḥ mahaḥ putrān aruṣasya prayakṣe  mahān garbhaḥ mahi ā jātam eṣām mahī pravṛdh haryaśvasya yajñaiḥ
translated: Agni was born, shining with the ladle, in the great son of the red one's direct vision.🔽The great embryo of these was born great, the great advance of the one with tawny horses by sacrifices.

original: abhi jaitrīr asacanta spṛdhānam mahi jyotis tamaso nir ajānan /
analyzed: abhi jaitrīḥ asacanta spṛdhānam mahi jyotiḥ tamasaḥ niḥ ajānan
translated: The victorious ones followed the one to be conquered, they knew the great light from the darkness.

original: taṃ jānatīḥ praty ud āyann uṣāsaḥ patir gavām abhavad eka indraḥ //
analyzed: tam jānatīḥ prati ud āyan uṣāsaḥ patiḥ gavām abhavat ekaḥ indraḥ
translated: The dawns rose up to him who was known, Indra became the lord of cattle, the one.

original: vīḷau satīr abhi dhīrā atṛndan prācāhinvan manasā sapta viprāḥ /
analyzed: vīḍau satīḥ abhi dhīrāḥ atṛndan prācā ahinvan manasā sapta viprāḥ
translated: The wise ones pressed down the trembling ones, the seven sages urged them forward with their minds.

original: viśvām avindan pathyām ṛtasya prajānann it tā namasā viveśa //
analyzed: viśvām avindan pathyām ṛtasya prajānan id tāḥ namasā viveśa
translated: They have found all the paths of holy order, and knowing them, have entered them with reverence.

original: vidad yadī saramā rugṇam adrer mahi pāthaḥ pūrvyaṃ sadhryak kaḥ /
analyzed: vidat yadī saramā rugṇam adreḥ mahi pāthaḥ pūrvyam sadhryak kaḥ
translated: If Saramā has found the cleft of the mountain, the great ancient path, which is to be shared by all,

original: agraṃ nayat supady akṣarāṇām acchā ravam prathamā jānatī gāt //🔽agacchad u vipratamaḥ sakhīyann asūdayat sukṛte garbham adriḥ /
analyzed: agram nayat su padī akṣarāṇām acchā ravam prathamā jānatī gāt  agacchat u vipratamaḥ sakhīyan asūdayat su kṛte garbham adriḥ
translated: She has led the foremost of the moving things, and first has gone to the light, knowing the way.🔽He has come, the most inspired of sages, as a friend, the mountain has brought forth the embryo for the good man.

original: sasāna maryo yuvabhir makhasyann athābhavad aṅgirāḥ sadyo arcan //
analyzed: sasāna maryaḥ yuvabhiḥ makhasyan athā abhavat aṅgirāḥ sadyas arcan
translated: The young man has grown, rejoicing in the sacrifice, and then he has become a sage, immediately shining with praise.

original: sataḥsataḥ pratimānam purobhūr viśvā veda janimā hanti śuṣṇam /
analyzed: sataḥ sataḥ pratimānam purobhūḥ viśvā veda janimā hanti śuṣṇam
translated: The forerunner of every good thing, he knows all generations, and destroys the wicked.

original: pra ṇo divaḥ padavīr gavyur arcan sakhā sakhīṃr amuñcan nir avadyāt //
analyzed: pra naḥ divaḥ padavīḥ gavyuḥ arcan sakhā sakhīṃr amuñcat niḥ avadyāt
translated: May he, the friend, the one to be praised, going along the paths of heaven, free us friends from blame.

original: ni gavyatā manasā sedur arkaiḥ kṛṇvānāso amṛtatvāya gātum /
analyzed: ni gavyatā manasā seduḥ arkaiḥ kṛṇvānāsaḥ amṛta tvāya gātum
translated: They have sat down with a mind full of cattle, making for themselves a way to immortality with their songs.

original: idaṃ cin nu sadanam bhūry eṣāṃ yena māsāṃ asiṣāsann ṛtena //
analyzed: idam cit nu sadanam bhūri eṣām yena mā asām asiṣāsan ṛtena
translated: This is indeed the wide seat of these (gods), by which they have gained the months with holy power.

original: sampaśyamānā amadann abhi svam payaḥ pratnasya retaso dughānāḥ /
analyzed: sampaśyamānāḥ amadan abhi svam payaḥ pratnasya retasaḥ dughānāḥ
translated: Looking at each other, they have rejoiced in their own milk, milking the ancient seed.

original: vi rodasī atapad ghoṣa eṣāṃ jāte niṣṭhām adadhur goṣu vīrān //
analyzed: vi rodasī atapat ghoṣaḥ eṣām jāte niṣṭhām adadhuḥ goṣu vīrān
translated: The light of these (gods) has shone between the two worlds; they have placed the heroes in the cows, when they were born.

original: sa jātebhir vṛtrahā sed u havyair ud usriyā asṛjad indro arkaiḥ /
analyzed: sa jātebhiḥ vṛtrahā sa id u havyaiḥ ud usriyāḥ asṛjat indraḥ arkaiḥ
translated: With the born ones, the Vrtra-slayer was worshipped with oblations, and Indra with the songs of the cows.

original: urūcy asmai ghṛtavad bharantī madhu svādma duduhe jenyā gauḥ //🔽pitre cic cakruḥ sadanaṃ sam asmai mahi tviṣīmat sukṛto vi hi khyan /
analyzed: urūcī asmai ghṛtavat bharantī madhu svādma duduhe jenyā gauḥ  pitre cit cakruḥ sadanam sam asmai mahi tviṣīmat su kṛtaḥ vi hi khyan
translated: The vast earth bears for him the ghee-filled, the sweet-tasting, the noble cow yields milk.🔽They have made a seat for the father, for him, the well-made ones shine forth with great splendor.

original: viṣkabhnanta skambhanenā janitrī āsīnā ūrdhvaṃ rabhasaṃ vi minvan //
analyzed: viṣkabhnanta skambhanena ā janitrī āsīnāḥ ūrdhvam rabhasam vi minvan
translated: The two mothers, the supporter and the supporter, sitting, spread out the leaping one upwards.

original: mahī yadi dhiṣaṇā śiśnathe dhāt sadyovṛdhaṃ vibhvaṃ rodasyoḥ /
analyzed: mahī yadi dhiṣaṇā śiśnathe dhāt sadyovṛdham vibhvam rodasyoḥ
translated: If the great earth and heaven have established the all-pervading one, the suddenly growing one, of the two worlds.

original: giro yasminn anavadyāḥ samīcīr viśvā indrāya taviṣīr anuttāḥ //🔽mahy ā te sakhyaṃ vaśmi śaktīr ā vṛtraghne niyuto yanti pūrvīḥ /🔽mahi stotram ava āganma sūrer asmākaṃ su maghavan bodhi gopāḥ //
analyzed: giraḥ yasmin anavadyāḥ samīcīḥ viśvāḥ indrāya taviṣīḥ anuttāḥ  mahi ā te sakhyam vaśmi śaktīḥ ā vṛtra ghne niyutaḥ yanti pūrvīḥ  mahi stotram avaḥ āganma sūreḥ asmākam su maghavan bodhi gopāḥ
translated: In whom the faultless, harmonious, all-powerful songs of praise are unsurpassed for Indra.🔽I seek your friendship, your powers, for me; many teams go forth to the Vrtra-killer.🔽We have come to the great praise of the sun; be our protector, O bountiful one.

original: mahi kṣetram puru ścandraṃ vividvān ād it sakhibhyaś carathaṃ sam airat /
analyzed: mahi kṣetram puru ścandram vividvān āt id sakhibhyaḥ caratham sam airat
translated: The one who knows the great, variegated field, has brought the chariot together for his friends.

original: indro nṛbhir ajanad dīdyānaḥ sākaṃ sūryam uṣasaṃ gātum agnim //
analyzed: indraḥ nṛbhiḥ ajanat dīdyānaḥ sākam sūryam uṣasam gātum agnim
translated: Indra, the shining one, has generated Agni, the sun, the dawn, with the men.

original: apaś cid eṣa vibhvo damūnāḥ pra sadhrīcīr asṛjad viśvaścandrāḥ /🔽madhvaḥ punānāḥ kavibhiḥ pavitrair dyubhir hinvanty aktubhir dhanutrīḥ //
analyzed: apaḥ cit eṣa vibhvaḥ damūnāḥ pra sadhrīcīḥ asṛjat viśva ścandrāḥ  madhvaḥ punānāḥ kavibhiḥ pavitraiḥ dyubhiḥ hinvanti aktubhiḥ dhanutrīḥ
translated: This all-pervading one, the friend of men, has created the various delightful things.🔽The purifying ones, with the wise purifying agents, the radiant ones, the swift ones, urge him with the rays.

original: anu kṛṣṇe vasudhitī jihāte ubhe sūryasya maṃhanā yajatre /
analyzed: anu kṛṣṇe vasu dhitī jihāte ubhe sūryasya maṃhanā yajatre
translated: The two dark ones, the givers of wealth, are extended, O you who deserve sacrifice, by the greatness of the sun.

original: pari yat te mahimānaṃ vṛjadhyai sakhāya indra kāmyā ṛjipyāḥ //
analyzed: pari yat te mahimānam vṛjadhyai sakhāyaḥ indra kāmyāḥ ṛjipyāḥ
translated: When your greatness is to be praised, your friends, O Indra, with desirable and straight (words),

original: patir bhava vṛtrahan sūnṛtānāṃ girāṃ viśvāyur vṛṣabho vayodhāḥ /
analyzed: patiḥ bhava vṛtrahan sūnṛtānām girām viśvāyuḥ vṛṣabhaḥ vayodhāḥ
translated: Be the lord of the truthful, O Vritra-slayer, the life-giving bull, the supporter of all life with words.

original: ā no gahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhir mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ saraṇyan //
analyzed: ā naḥ gahi sakhyebhiḥ śivebhiḥ mahān mahībhiḥ ūtibhiḥ saraṇyan
translated: Come to us with your auspicious friendships, the great one, seeking to help with your mighty aids.

original: tam aṅgirasvan namasā saparyan navyaṃ kṛṇomi sanyase purājām /
analyzed: tam aṅgirasvat namasā saparyan navyam kṛṇomi sanyase purājām
translated: I honor you, O Angiras-like one, with reverence, I make you new, the ancient one, for the sacrifice.

original: druho vi yāhi bahulā adevīḥ svaś ca no maghavan sātaye dhāḥ //
analyzed: druhaḥ vi yāhi bahulāḥ adevīḥ svar ca naḥ maghavan sātaye dhāḥ
translated: Pass over the many, the godless enemies. Grant us, O bountiful one, (your) favor.

original: mihaḥ pāvakāḥ pratatā abhūvan svasti naḥ pipṛhi pāram āsām /
analyzed: mihaḥ pāvakāḥ pratatāḥ abhūvan svasti naḥ pipṛhi pāram āsām
translated: The purifying ones have been spread out in the mist. Grant us well-being, lead us across them.

original: indra tvaṃ rathiraḥ pāhi no riṣo makṣūmakṣū kṛṇuhi gojito naḥ //
analyzed: indra tvam rathiraḥ pāhi naḥ riṣaḥ makṣūmakṣū kṛṇuhi go jitaḥ naḥ
translated: O Indra, be our protector from harm. Make us free from harm, victorious in winning cattle.

original: adediṣṭa vṛtrahā gopatir gā antaḥ kṛṣṇāṃ aruṣair dhāmabhir gāt /
analyzed: adediṣṭa vṛtrahā go patiḥ gāḥ antar kṛṣṇām aruṣaiḥ dhāmabhiḥ gāt
translated: The Vrtra-slayer, the lord of cattle, has given the cows. He has gone to the dark one with the ruddy abodes.

original: pra sūnṛtā diśamāna ṛtena duraś ca viśvā avṛṇod apa svāḥ //
analyzed: pra sūnṛtāḥ diśamānaḥ ṛtena duraḥ ca viśvāḥ avṛṇot apa svāḥ
translated: He, the most delightful, with holy order, hath with his rays encompassed all the regions.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We will invoke the bountiful Indra, best of men in this contest for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The terrible one who listens for help in battles, who slays Vr̥itras, who wins treasures.

original: indra somaṃ somapate pibemam mādhyandinaṃ savanaṃ cāru yat te /
analyzed: indra somam soma pate piba imam mādhyandinam savanam cāru yat te
translated: O Indra, drink this Soma, O lord of Soma, the beautiful midday libation that is thine.

original: prapruthyā śipre maghavann ṛjīṣin vimucyā harī iha mādayasva //
analyzed: prapruthyā śipre maghavan ṛjīṣin vimucyā harī iha mādayasva
translated: Having stretched out thy two beautiful flanks, O bountiful one, O impetuous one, having loosed thy two bays, rejoice here.

original: gavāśiram manthinam indra śukram pibā somaṃ rarimā te madāya /
analyzed: gavāśiram manthinam indra śukram piba somam rarimā te madāya
translated: O Indra, drink the Soma mixed with milk, the bright one; we have pressed the Soma for thy rapture.

original: brahmakṛtā mārutenā gaṇena sajoṣā rudrais tṛpad ā vṛṣasva //
analyzed: brahma kṛtā mārutenā gaṇena sajoṣāḥ rudraiḥ tṛpat ā vṛṣasva
translated: In unison with the Marut host that performs holy rites, be satisfied with the Rudras and swell.

original: ye te śuṣmaṃ ye taviṣīm avardhann arcanta indra marutas ta ojaḥ /
analyzed: ye te śuṣmam ye taviṣīm avardhan arcantaḥ indra marutaḥ te ojaḥ
translated: Those who have increased thy strength and thy power, O Indra, the Maruts who have praised thy vigour,

original: mādhyandine savane vajrahasta pibā rudrebhiḥ sagaṇaḥ suśipra //
analyzed: mādhyandine savane vajrahasta pibā rudrebhiḥ sa gaṇaḥ su śipra
translated: With the Rudras, O thou of fair eyebrows, O thou who hast the thunderbolt in thy hand, be satisfied at the midday libation.

original: ta in nv asya madhumad vivipra indrasya śardho maruto ya āsan /
analyzed: te id nu asya madhumat vivipre indrasya śardhaḥ marutaḥ ye āsan
translated: These indeed are his inspired ones, rich in sweetness, the Maruts who are Indra's troop,

original: yebhir vṛtrasyeṣito vivedāmarmaṇo manyamānasya marma //
analyzed: yebhiḥ vṛtrasya iṣitaḥ viveda amarmaṇaḥ manyamānasya marma
translated: By whom, urged on, he discovered the vital spot of Vr̥itra, of him who thought himself secure.

original: manuṣvad indra savanaṃ juṣāṇaḥ pibā somaṃ śaśvate vīryāya /
analyzed: manuṣvat indra savanam juṣāṇaḥ piba somam śaśvate vīryāya
translated: As Manu did, O Indra, delighting in the draught, drink the Soma for eternal strength.

original: sa ā vavṛtsva haryaśva yajñaiḥ saraṇyubhir apo arṇā sisarṣi //🔽tvam apo yad dha vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ atyāṃ iva prāsṛjaḥ sartavājau /
analyzed: saḥ ā vavṛtsva hari aśva yajñaiḥ saraṇyubhiḥ apaḥ arṇā sisarṣi  tvam apaḥ yat ha vṛtram jaghanvān atyān iva prāsṛjaḥ sartavājau
translated: Turn thou unto us, O thou of Bay steeds, with sacrifices, with swift aids, thou movest the waters and the floods.🔽When thou, O Indra, hadst slain Vritra, thou let loose the two swift-coursing streams, as 'twere, the waters.

original: śayānam indra caratā vadhena vavrivāṃsam pari devīr adevam //
analyzed: śayānam indra caratā vadhena vavrivāṃsam pari devīḥ adevam
translated: The godless one, O Indra, who with guile compassed the god, thou hast slain with thy weapon, as he lay.

original: yajāma in namasā vṛddham indram bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaraṃ yuvānam /
analyzed: yajāmaḥ id namasā vṛddham indram bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaram yuvānam
translated: We worship with homage the grown Indra, the lofty, the tall, the undecaying, the young.

original: yasya priye mamatur yajñiyasya na rodasī mahimānam mamāte //
analyzed: yasya priye mamatuḥ yajñiyasya na rodasī mahimānam mamāte
translated: Whose dear, to be desired, sacrificial (boon) the two great worlds, the heaven and the earth, do not contain.

original: indrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi vratāni devā na minanti viśve /
analyzed: indrasya karma su kṛtā purūṇi vratāni devāḥ na minanti viśve
translated: The gods do not violate the many well-performed deeds and vows of Indra.

original: dādhāra yaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyām utemāṃ jajāna sūryam uṣasaṃ sudaṃsāḥ //
analyzed: dādhāra yaḥ pṛthivīm dyām uta imām jajāna sūryam uṣasam su daṃsāḥ
translated: He who hath upheld the earth and this heaven, and hath generated the sun and the dawn, the wise one.

original: adrogha satyaṃ tava tan mahitvaṃ sadyo yaj jāto apibo ha somam /
analyzed: adrogha satyam tava tat mahitvam sadyas yat jātaḥ apibaḥ ha somam
translated: Thy greatness, O Indra, is true and not false, that thou, as soon as born, didst drink the Soma.

original: na dyāva indra tavasas ta ojo nāhā na māsāḥ śarado varanta //
analyzed: na dyāvaḥ indra tavasaḥ te ojaḥ na ahā na māsāḥ śaradaḥ varanta
translated: Neither the heavens nor thy own strength, O Indra, nor the months nor the autumns are able (to contain it).

original: tvaṃ sadyo apibo jāta indra madāya somam parame vyoman /
analyzed: tvam sadyas apibaḥ jātaḥ indra madāya somam parame vyoman
translated: Thou, O Indra, as soon as born, didst drink the Soma for thy joy, in the highest heaven.

original: yad dha dyāvāpṛthivī āviveśīr athābhavaḥ pūrvyaḥ kārudhāyāḥ //
analyzed: yat ha dyāvāpṛthivī āviveśīḥ atha abhavaḥ pūrvyaḥ kāru dhāyāḥ
translated: When thou didst enter heaven and earth, then thou wast the first to be worshipped by the singer.

original: ahann ahim pariśayānam arṇa ojāyamānaṃ tuvijāta tavyān /
analyzed: ahan ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ ojāyamānam tuvi jāta tavyān
translated: Thou slewest Ahi, the surrounding serpent, O thou of mighty birth, more mighty than he.

original: na te mahitvam anu bhūd adha dyaur yad anyayā sphigyā kṣām avasthāḥ //
analyzed: na te mahitvam anu bhūt adha dyauḥ yat anyayā sphigyā kṣām avasthāḥ
translated: The heaven hath not attained to thy greatness, when thou hast laid the earth down with thy other hip.

original: yajño hi ta indra vardhano bhūd uta priyaḥ sutasomo miyedhaḥ /
analyzed: yajñaḥ hi te indra vardhanaḥ bhūt uta priyaḥ suta somaḥ miyedhaḥ
translated: For thee, O Indra, the sacrifice hath become a strengthener, dear, with well-pressed Soma, a great oblation.

original: yajñena yajñam ava yajñiyaḥ san yajñas te vajram ahihatya āvat //
analyzed: yajñena yajñam ava yajñiyaḥ san yajñaḥ te vajram ahi hatye āvat
translated: With the sacrifice, being worthy of sacrifice, thou, with the sacrifice, hast won the sacrifice, and the bolt that slayeth the dragon.

original: yajñenendram avasā cakre arvāg ainaṃ sumnāya navyase vavṛtyām /
analyzed: yajñena indram avasā cakre arvāk ā enam sumnāya navyase vavṛtyām
translated: With the sacrifice and with the favour he hath made Indra to come hitherward: I will turn him to the new bliss.

original: ya stomebhir vāvṛdhe pūrvyebhir yo madhyamebhir uta nūtanebhiḥ //
analyzed: ya stomebhiḥ vāvṛdhe pūrvyebhiḥ yaḥ madhyamebhiḥ uta nūtanebhiḥ
translated: He who hath waxed great with the ancient lauds, and also with the middlemost, and with the newest.

original: viveṣa yan mā dhiṣaṇā jajāna stavai purā pāryād indram ahnaḥ /
analyzed: viveṣa yat mā dhiṣaṇā jajāna stavai purā pāryāt indram ahnaḥ
translated: I will praise Indra before the day's end, that he may enter in whom the thought hath brought forth.

original: aṃhaso yatra pīparad yathā no nāveva yāntam ubhaye havante //
analyzed: aṃhasaḥ yatra pīparat yathā naḥ nāvā iva yāntam ubhaye havante
translated: When he shall pass over our distress, as in a boat, all men shall call upon him as he goeth.

original: āpūrṇo asya kalaśaḥ svāhā sekteva kośaṃ sisice pibadhyai /
analyzed: āpūrṇaḥ asya kalaśaḥ svāhā sektā iva kośam sisice pibadhyai
translated: His jar is full: Hail! He shall sprinkle the bag as it were with a sprinkler, to make him drink.

original: sam u priyā āvavṛtran madāya pradakṣiṇid abhi somāsa indram //
analyzed: sam u priyāḥ āvavṛtran madāya pradakṣiṇit abhi somāsaḥ indram
translated: The dear ones have turned to him for his delight: the Somas have encompassed Indra on the right.

original: na tvā gabhīraḥ puruhūta sindhur nādrayaḥ pari ṣanto varanta /🔽itthā sakhibhya iṣito yad indrā dṛḷhaṃ cid arujo gavyam ūrvam //
analyzed: na tvā gabhīraḥ puruhūta sindhuḥ na adrayaḥ pari santaḥ varanta  itthā sakhibhyaḥ iṣitaḥ yat indra ā dṛḍham cit arujaḥ gavyam ūrvam
translated: The deep river, O much-invoked one, nor the surrounding mountains, can hold thee back.🔽When thou art urged on for the sake of friends, O Indra, thou breakest through even a firm cow-pen full of cattle.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We will invoke the bountiful Indra, best of men in this contest for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The terrible one who listens for help in battles, who slays Vr̥itras, who wins treasures.

original: pra parvatānām uśatī upasthād aśve iva viṣite hāsamāne /
analyzed: pra parvatānām uśatī upasthāt aśve iva viṣite hāsamāne
translated: The eager one has approached the summits of the mountains, like two horses stretched out, laughing.

original: gāveva śubhre mātarā rihāṇe vipāṭ chutudrī payasā javete //
analyzed: gāvā iva śubhre mātarā rihāṇe vipāś śutudrī payasā javete
translated: The two splendid mothers, like two cows, embrace him. Vipāś and Śutudrī flow with milk.

original: indreṣite prasavam bhikṣamāṇe acchā samudraṃ rathyeva yāthaḥ /
analyzed: indra iṣite prasavam bhikṣamāṇe acchā samudram rathyā iva yāthaḥ
translated: Urged on by Indra, seeking propagation, you go to the ocean, as if on a chariot.

original: samārāṇe ūrmibhiḥ pinvamāne anyā vām anyām apy eti śubhre //
analyzed: samārāṇe ūrmibhiḥ pinvamāne anyā vām anyām api eti śubhre
translated: When you meet, swelling with waves, one of you goes to the other, O splendid ones.

original: acchā sindhum mātṛtamām ayāsaṃ vipāśam urvīṃ subhagām aganma /
analyzed: acchā sindhum mātṛtamām ayāsam vipāśam urvīm subhagām aganma
translated: We have come to the river, the most motherly, the unfettered, the vast, the fortunate one.

original: vatsam iva mātarā saṃrihāṇe samānaṃ yonim anu saṃcarantī //
analyzed: vatsam iva mātarā saṃrihāṇe samānam yonim anu saṃcarantī
translated: We embrace the calf, as if it were a mother, following the common birthplace, moving together.

original: enā vayam payasā pinvamānā anu yoniṃ devakṛtaṃ carantīḥ /
analyzed: enāḥ vayam payasā pinvamānāḥ anu yonim deva kṛtam carantīḥ
translated: We, who are swelling with milk, follow the birthplace created by the gods.

original: na vartave prasavaḥ sargataktaḥ kiṃyur vipro nadyo johavīti //
analyzed: na vartave prasavaḥ sarga taktaḥ kiṃyuḥ vipraḥ nadyaḥ johavīti
translated: The birth-impelling flow will not be stayed. What is the use of the priest calling the rivers?

original: ramadhvam me vacase somyāya ṛtāvarīr upa muhūrtam evaiḥ /
analyzed: ramadhvam me vacase somyāya ṛtāvarīḥ upa muhūrtam evaiḥ
translated: Delight yourselves in my speech, ye who are good at vows, ye who are swift in action, for a moment.

original: pra sindhum acchā bṛhatī manīṣāvasyur ahve kuśikasya sūnuḥ //
analyzed: pra sindhum acchā bṛhatī manīṣā vasyuḥ ahve kuśikasya sūnuḥ
translated: The great thought has called to the river, the son of Kuśika, who is eager for help.

original: indro asmāṃ aradad vajrabāhur apāhan vṛtram paridhiṃ nadīnām /
analyzed: indraḥ asmām aradat vajra bāhuḥ apāhan vṛtram paridhim nadīnām
translated: Indra, whose arm is strong, has cleft for us the dam of the rivers, and has slain Vrtra.

original: devo 'nayat savitā supāṇis tasya vayam prasave yāma urvīḥ //
analyzed: devaḥ nayat savitā su pāṇiḥ tasya vayam prasave yāmaḥ urvīḥ
translated: The god Savitar, with fair hands, has led us. In his impulse we have gone to the wide (regions).

original: pravācyaṃ śaśvadhā vīryaṃ tad indrasya karma yad ahiṃ vivṛścat /
analyzed: pravācyam śaśvadhā vīryam tat indrasya karma yat ahim vivṛścat
translated: The deed which Indra did, his ever-waxing deed, when he cleft Ahi asunder, is to be celebrated.

original: vi vajreṇa pariṣado jaghānāyann āpo 'yanam icchamānāḥ //
analyzed: vi vajreṇa pariṣadaḥ jaghāna āyan āpaḥ yanam icchamānāḥ
translated: With his thunderbolt he smote down the enclosures, the waters went their way, seeking their course.

original: etad vaco jaritar māpi mṛṣṭhā ā yat te ghoṣān uttarā yugāni /
analyzed: etat vacaḥ jaritar mā api mṛṣṭhāḥ ā yat te ghoṣān uttarā yugāni
translated: Do not, O singer, despise this speech of mine, since in the later ages are your shouts of joy.

original: uktheṣu kāro prati no juṣasva mā no ni kaḥ puruṣatrā namas te //
analyzed: uktheṣu kāro prati naḥ juṣasva mā naḥ ni kaḥ puruṣatrā namaḥ te
translated: Be pleased with our lauds, O thou who art to be praised. Do not destroy us, O thou who art to be worshipped.

original: o ṣu svasāraḥ kārave śṛṇota yayau vo dūrād anasā rathena /
analyzed: ā u su svasāraḥ kārave śṛṇota yayau vaḥ dūrāt anasā rathena
translated: O ye sisters, listen to the call of the bird. He has come to you from afar with his chariot and his wagon.

original: ni ṣū namadhvam bhavatā supārā adhoakṣāḥ sindhavaḥ srotyābhiḥ //
analyzed: ni su namadhvam bhavata su pārāḥ adhoakṣāḥ sindhavaḥ srotyābhiḥ
translated: Bend down, be easy to cross, O rivers, with your streams flowing downwards.

original: ā te kāro śṛṇavāmā vacāṃsi yayātha dūrād anasā rathena /
analyzed: ā te kāro śṛṇavāmā vacāṃsi yayātha dūrāt anasā rathena
translated: We will listen to your words, O Karṇa, when you have come from afar with your chariot and wagon.

original: ni te naṃsai pīpyāneva yoṣā maryāyeva kanyā śaśvacai te //
analyzed: ni te naṃsai pīpyānā iva yoṣā maryāyā iva kanyā śaśvacai te
translated: Let your mind be inclined towards us, like a woman towards her husband, like a maiden towards her lover.

original: yad aṅga tvā bharatāḥ saṃtareyur gavyan grāma iṣita indrajūtaḥ /
analyzed: yat aṅga tvā bharatāḥ saṃtareyuḥ gavyan grāmaḥ iṣitaḥ indra jūtaḥ
translated: If the Bharatas were to cross you, O Gavyūti, sent forth, urged on by Indra, like a village seeking cattle,

original: arṣād aha prasavaḥ sargatakta ā vo vṛṇe sumatiṃ yajñiyānām //🔽atāriṣur bharatā gavyavaḥ sam abhakta vipraḥ sumatiṃ nadīnām /
analyzed: arṣāt aha prasavaḥ sarga taktaḥ ā vaḥ vṛṇe sumatim yajñiyānām  atāriṣuḥ bharatāḥ gavyavaḥ sam abhakta vipraḥ sumatim nadīnām
translated: Turn away from the impulse of the creator, I choose the favor of you who are to be worshipped.🔽The Bharatas have crossed the Gavyūti, the sage has united with the favor of the rivers.

original: pra pinvadhvam iṣayantīḥ surādhā ā vakṣaṇāḥ pṛṇadhvaṃ yāta śībham //
analyzed: pra pinvadhvam iṣayantīḥ su rādhāḥ ā vakṣaṇāḥ pṛṇadhvam yāta śībham
translated: Make the streams flow, rich in food and gifts, fill the hollows, come quickly.

original: ud va ūrmiḥ śamyā hantv āpo yoktrāṇi muñcata /
analyzed: ud vaḥ ūrmiḥ śamyāḥ hantu āpaḥ yoktrāṇi muñcata
translated: Let the wave be lifted by the yoke, let the waters release the yoking thongs.

original: māduṣkṛtau vyenasāghnyau śūnam āratām //
analyzed: mā a duṣkṛtau vyenasā aghnyau śūnam āratām
translated: Let the two unoffending ones not be killed by the bird.

original: indraḥ pūrbhid ātirad dāsam arkair vidadvasur dayamāno vi śatrūn /
analyzed: indraḥ pūrbhid ātirat dāsam arkaiḥ vidadvasuḥ dayamānaḥ vi śatrūn
translated: Indra, the breaker of forts, has surpassed the Dāsa with his songs, the giver of wealth, destroying the enemies,

original: brahmajūtas tanvā vāvṛdhāno bhūridātra āpṛṇad rodasī ubhe //
analyzed: brahma jūtaḥ tanvā vāvṛdhānaḥ bhūri dātraḥ āpṛṇat rodasī ubhe
translated: Urged on by prayer, grown in his body, the bountiful one has filled both heaven and earth.

original: makhasya te taviṣasya pra jūtim iyarmi vācam amṛtāya bhūṣan /
analyzed: makhasya te taviṣasya pra jūtim iyarmi vācam amṛtāya bhūṣan
translated: I send forth the impulse of your mighty sacrifice, adorning speech for the immortal one.

original: indra kṣitīnām asi mānuṣīṇāṃ viśāṃ daivīnām uta pūrvayāvā //
analyzed: indra kṣitīnām asi mānuṣīṇām viśām daivīnām uta pūrva yāvā
translated: O Indra, thou art the lord of the people of men, and of the tribes of the gods, and of the ancient ones.

original: indro vṛtram avṛṇoc chardhanītiḥ pra māyinām aminād varpaṇītiḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtram avṛṇot śardha nītiḥ pra māyinām amināt varpaṇītiḥ
translated: Indra, with conquering might, hath compassed Vritra round: with overpowering might he hath destroyed the enchanters.

original: ahan vyaṃsam uśadhag vaneṣv āvir dhenā akṛṇod rāmyāṇām //
analyzed: ahan vyaṃsam uśadhak vaneṣu āvis dhenāḥ akṛṇot rāmyāṇām
translated: He hath slain Vyansa, the greedy one, in the woods: he hath made the light of the Ramyas manifest.

original: indraḥ svarṣā janayann ahāni jigāyośigbhiḥ pṛtanā abhiṣṭiḥ /
analyzed: indraḥ svarṣāḥ janayan ahāni jigāya uśigbhiḥ pṛtanāḥ abhiṣṭiḥ
translated: Indra, the self-dependent One, producing the days, hath conquered in the battles with the Oshigian ones, the protector.

original: prārocayan manave ketum ahnām avindaj jyotir bṛhate raṇāya //
analyzed: prārocayat manave ketum ahnām avindat jyotiḥ bṛhate raṇāya
translated: Making the light of the days manifest to Manu, he hath found the light for the great contest.

original: indras tujo barhaṇā ā viveśa nṛvad dadhāno naryā purūṇi /
analyzed: indraḥ tujaḥ barhaṇāḥ ā viveśa nṛvat dadhānaḥ naryā purūṇi
translated: Indra hath entered into the mighty strength, bearing as a man many manly deeds.

original: acetayad dhiya imā jaritre premaṃ varṇam atirac chukram āsām //
analyzed: acetayat dhiyaḥ imāḥ jaritre pra imam varṇam atirat śukram āsām
translated: He hath caused these thoughts to think for the worshipper: he hath made this bright colour of these (cows) to shine forth.

original: maho mahāni panayanty asyendrasya karma sukṛtā purūṇi /
analyzed: mahaḥ mahāni panayanti asya indrasya karma su kṛtā purūṇi
translated: The great ones celebrate his great deeds, Indra's many well-performed works.

original: vṛjanena vṛjinān sam pipeṣa māyābhir dasyūṃr abhibhūtyojāḥ //
analyzed: vṛjanena vṛjinān sam pipeṣa māyābhiḥ dasyūṃr abhibhūti ojāḥ
translated: With the flood he hath crushed the wicked with the flood, the Dasyus with his overpowering powers.

original: yudhendro mahnā varivaś cakāra devebhyaḥ satpatiś carṣaṇiprāḥ /
analyzed: yudhā indraḥ mahnā varivaḥ cakāra devebhyaḥ satpatiḥ carṣaṇi prāḥ
translated: In the battle Indra, the lord of the brave, the ruler of men, hath made room with his might for the gods.

original: vivasvataḥ sadane asya tāni viprā ukthebhiḥ kavayo gṛṇanti //
analyzed: vivasvataḥ sadane asya tāni viprāḥ ukthebhiḥ kavayaḥ gṛṇanti
translated: The sages, the poets, in his abode, in the seat of Vivasvan, celebrate those (deeds) with hymns.

original: satrāsāhaṃ vareṇyaṃ sahodāṃ sasavāṃsaṃ svar apaś ca devīḥ /🔽sasāna yaḥ pṛthivīṃ dyām utemām indram madanty anu dhīraṇāsaḥ //
analyzed: satrāsāham vareṇyam sahaḥ dām sasavāṃsam svar apaḥ ca devīḥ  sasāna yaḥ pṛthivīm dyām uta imām indram madanti anu dhīraṇāsaḥ
translated: The conquering, the most excellent, the mighty, the companion of the strong, and the divine waters,🔽He who has conquered this earth and this sky, the people rejoice in Indra, the bountiful one.

original: sasānātyāṃ uta sūryaṃ sasānendraḥ sasāna purubhojasaṃ gām /
analyzed: sasāna atyām uta sūryam sasāna indraḥ sasāna purubhojasam gām
translated: He conquered the farthest, he conquered the sun, Indra conquered the cow who nourishes many.

original: hiraṇyayam uta bhogaṃ sasāna hatvī dasyūn prāryaṃ varṇam āvat //
analyzed: hiraṇyayam uta bhogam sasāna hatvī dasyūn pra āryam varṇam āvat
translated: He conquered the golden treasure, the destroyer of the Dasyus, he brought back the noble race.

original: indra oṣadhīr asanod ahāni vanaspatīṃr asanod antarikṣam /
analyzed: indraḥ oṣadhīḥ asanot ahāni vanaspatīṃr asanot antarikṣam
translated: Indra conquered the plants, the days, he conquered the trees, he conquered the atmosphere.

original: bibheda valaṃ nunude vivāco 'thābhavad damitābhikratūnām //
