analyzed: bibheda valam nunude vivācaḥ thā abhavat damitā abhikratūnām
translated: He cleft the rock, he drove away the slanderers, then he became the controller of the unruly.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We invoke the bountiful Indra, the best of men in this contest for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The mighty one who listens for help in battles, the conqueror of foes, the winner of riches.

original: tiṣṭhā harī ratha ā yujyamānā yāhi vāyur na niyuto no accha /
analyzed: tiṣṭha harī rathe ā yujyamānā yāhi vāyuḥ na niyutaḥ naḥ accha
translated: Stand, O tawny horses, yoked to the chariot, come, O wind, with your teams, to us.

original: pibāsy andho abhisṛṣṭo asme indra svāhā rarimā te madāya //
analyzed: pibāsi andhaḥ abhisṛṣṭaḥ asme indra svāhā rarimā te madāya
translated: Drink the offered drink with us, O Indra, we offer you the oblation for your joy.

original: upājirā puruhūtāya saptī harī rathasya dhūrṣv ā yunajmi /
analyzed: upa ajirā puruhūtāya saptī harī rathasya dhūrṣu ā yunajmi
translated: I yoke to the pole of the chariot the two swift horses for the much-invoked one, who is near.

original: dravad yathā sambhṛtaṃ viśvataś cid upemaṃ yajñam ā vahāta indram //
analyzed: dravat yathā sambhṛtam viśvatas cit upa imam yajñam ā vahātaḥ indram
translated: As the flowing (Soma) is collected from all sides, bring hither Indra to this sacrifice.

original: upo nayasva vṛṣaṇā tapuṣpotem ava tvaṃ vṛṣabha svadhāvaḥ /
analyzed: upa u nayasva vṛṣaṇā tapuṣpā uta īm ava tvam vṛṣabha svadhāvas
translated: Lead hither the two strong ones, the glowing ones; do thou, O strong self-existent one, lead them.

original: grasetām aśvā vi muceha śoṇā divedive sadṛśīr addhi dhānāḥ //
analyzed: grasetām aśvā vi muca iha śoṇā dive dive sadṛśīḥ addhi dhānāḥ
translated: Let the two horses swallow (the Soma), and be released here, the two red ones. Eat the barley every day, as much as you like.

original: brahmaṇā te brahmayujā yunajmi harī sakhāyā sadhamāda āśū /
analyzed: brahmaṇā te brahma yujā yunajmi harī sakhāyā sadhamāde āśū
translated: With holy power I yoke thy two bay steeds yoked with holy power, swift friends who rejoice together.

original: sthiraṃ rathaṃ sukham indrādhitiṣṭhan prajānan vidvāṃ upa yāhi somam //
analyzed: sthiram ratham sukham indra adhitiṣṭhan prajānan vidvān upa yāhi somam
translated: Riding in thy firm and easy chariot, O Indra, knowing, wise, come to the Soma.

original: mā te harī vṛṣaṇā vītapṛṣṭhā ni rīraman yajamānāso anye /🔽atyāyāhi śaśvato vayaṃ te 'raṃ sutebhiḥ kṛṇavāma somaiḥ //
analyzed: mā te harī vṛṣaṇā vīta pṛṣṭhā ni rīraman yajamānāsaḥ anye  ati āyāhi śaśvataḥ vayam te raṃ sutebhiḥ kṛṇavāma somaiḥ
translated: Let not thy two strong, broad-backed bay horses be delayed, O thou who hast to be worshipped by others.🔽Come hither to us, O thou who art ever present. With our pressed (Soma) we will make thee glad.

original: tavāyaṃ somas tvam ehy arvāṅ chaśvattamaṃ sumanā asya pāhi /
analyzed: tava ayam somaḥ tvam ehi arvāṅ chaśvattamam sumanāḥ asya pāhi
translated: This Soma is thine; come hither on thy bay steeds. Drink of this (Soma) with a cheerful heart.

original: asmin yajñe barhiṣy ā niṣadyā dadhiṣvemaṃ jaṭhara indum indra //
analyzed: asmin yajñe barhiṣi ā niṣadya ā dadhiṣva imam jaṭhare indum indra
translated: Sitting on the strewn sacrificial grass at this sacrifice, enjoy this drop in thy belly, O Indra.

original: stīrṇaṃ te barhiḥ suta indra somaḥ kṛtā dhānā attave te haribhyām /
analyzed: stīrṇam te barhiḥ sutaḥ indra somaḥ kṛtāḥ dhānāḥ attave te haribhyām
translated: The sacrificial grass is strewn for thee, O Indra; the Soma is pressed. The roasted grains are prepared for thee, O thou of bay steeds.

original: tadokase puruśākāya vṛṣṇe marutvate tubhyaṃ rātā havīṃṣi //
analyzed: tad okase puru śākāya vṛṣṇe marutvate tubhyam rātā havīṃṣi
translated: For that abode of thine, O thou of much strength, O mighty one, accompanied by the Maruts, they have offered the oblations to thee.

original: imaṃ naraḥ parvatās tubhyam āpaḥ sam indra gobhir madhumantam akran /
analyzed: imam naraḥ parvatāḥ tubhyam āpaḥ sam indra gobhiḥ madhumantam akran
translated: Men, mountains, and waters have made this Indra rich in milk and honey for thee.

original: tasyāgatyā sumanā ṛṣva pāhi prajānan vidvān pathyā anu svāḥ //
analyzed: tasya āgatya sumanāḥ ṛṣva pāhi prajānan vidvān pathyāḥ anu svāḥ
translated: Come to it, O lofty one, drink it with a good mind, knowing it, O wise one, along the paths that are thine own.

original: yāṃ ābhajo maruta indra some ye tvām avardhann abhavan gaṇas te /🔽tebhir etaṃ sajoṣā vāvaśāno 'gneḥ piba jihvayā somam indra //
analyzed: yām ābhajaḥ marutaḥ indra some ye tvām avardhan abhavan gaṇaḥ te  tebhiḥ etam sajoṣāḥ vāvaśānaḥ gneḥ piba jihvayā somam indra
translated: The portion which the Maruts and Soma have assigned to thee, O Indra, those who have increased thee have become thy troop.🔽With them, O thou who art of one accord, being eager, drink this (Soma) of Agni, O Indra, with thy tongue.

original: indra piba svadhayā cit sutasyāgner vā pāhi jihvayā yajatra /
analyzed: indra piba svadhayā cit sutasya agneḥ vā pāhi jihvayā yajatra
translated: O Indra, drink even of the offered Soma, or guard it, O thou who art to be worshipped, with Agni's tongue.

original: adhvaryor vā prayataṃ śakra hastād dhotur vā yajñaṃ haviṣo juṣasva //
analyzed: adhvaryoḥ vā prayatam śakra hastāt hotuḥ vā yajñam haviṣaḥ juṣasva
translated: Or accept, O Sakra, the sacrifice offered by the Adhvaryu's hands, or the Hotri's, and the oblation.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We will invoke the bountiful Indra, best of heroes in this contest for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The terrible one who listens for help in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, who wins treasures.

original: imām ū ṣu prabhṛtiṃ sātaye dhāḥ śaśvacchaśvad ūtibhir yādamānaḥ /
analyzed: imām u su prabhṛtim sātaye dhāḥ śaśvat śaśvat ūtibhiḥ yādamānaḥ
translated: Do thou, O Indra, grant this first gift for our gain, ever increasing with thy aids.

original: sutesute vāvṛdhe vardhanebhir yaḥ karmabhir mahadbhiḥ suśruto bhūt //
analyzed: sute sute vāvṛdhe vardhanebhiḥ yaḥ karmabhiḥ mahadbhiḥ su śrutaḥ bhūt
translated: He who has become famous by his great deeds, has grown in every pressing, in the strengthenings.

original: indrāya somāḥ pradivo vidānā ṛbhur yebhir vṛṣaparvā vihāyāḥ /
analyzed: indrāya somāḥ pradivaḥ vidānāḥ ṛbhuḥ yebhiḥ vṛṣa parvā vihāyāḥ
translated: The Soma juices, Indra, which have been pressed for thee, O thou of mighty powers, by the R̥ibhus,

original: prayamyamānān prati ṣū gṛbhāyendra piba vṛṣadhūtasya vṛṣṇaḥ //🔽pibā vardhasva tava ghā sutāsa indra somāsaḥ prathamā uteme /
analyzed: prayamyamānān prati su gṛbhāya indra piba vṛṣa dhūtasya vṛṣṇaḥ  pibā vardhasva tava gha sutāsaḥ indra somāsaḥ prathamāḥ uta ime
translated: When they are being purified, receive them quickly. Drink, Indra, of the strong, the vigorous juice.🔽Drink, wax in strength. Thine are these juices, O Indra, these first Soma juices of this day.

original: yathāpibaḥ pūrvyāṃ indra somāṃ evā pāhi panyo adyā navīyān //
analyzed: yathā apibaḥ pūrvyān indra somān evā pāhi panyaḥ adyā navīyān
translated: As thou hast drunk the ancient Soma juices, O Indra, so drink thou this new one, O bounteous God.

original: mahāṃ amatro vṛjane virapśy ugraṃ śavaḥ patyate dhṛṣṇv ojaḥ /
analyzed: mahān amatraḥ vṛjane virapśī ugram śavaḥ patyate dhṛṣṇu ojaḥ
translated: The mighty vessel hath been cleansed for the feast. The strong and fierce strength of the bold one is let loose.

original: nāha vivyāca pṛthivī canainaṃ yat somāso haryaśvam amandan //
analyzed: na aha vivyāca pṛthivī cana enam yat somāsaḥ haryaśvam amandan
translated: The earth itself hath not contained his greatness, when the Soma juices have delighted Haryaśva.

original: mahāṃ ugro vāvṛdhe vīryāya samācakre vṛṣabhaḥ kāvyena /
analyzed: mahān ugraḥ vāvṛdhe vīryāya samācakre vṛṣabhaḥ kāvyena
translated: The mighty one hath grown for hero strength. The Bull hath been anointed with the hymn.

original: indro bhago vājadā asya gāvaḥ pra jāyante dakṣiṇā asya pūrvīḥ //
analyzed: indraḥ bhagaḥ vāja dāḥ asya gāvaḥ pra jāyante dakṣiṇāḥ asya pūrvīḥ
translated: Indra is rich in kine that give the prize of strength. Many are the gifts that he hath gained before.

original: pra yat sindhavaḥ prasavaṃ yathāyann āpaḥ samudraṃ rathyeva jagmuḥ /
analyzed: pra yat sindhavaḥ prasavam yathā āyan āpaḥ samudram rathyā iva jagmuḥ
translated: When the streams flow to their appointed meeting, the waters go to the sea as on a car.

original: ataś cid indraḥ sadaso varīyān yad īṃ somaḥ pṛṇati dugdho aṃśuḥ //
analyzed: atas cit indraḥ sadasaḥ varīyān yat īm somaḥ pṛṇati dugdhaḥ aṃśuḥ
translated: From thence, from out the seat, Indra is wider still, when the milked Soma is filled in the fleece.

original: samudreṇa sindhavo yādamānā indrāya somaṃ suṣutam bharantaḥ /
analyzed: samudreṇa sindhavaḥ yādamānāḥ indrāya somam suṣutam bharantaḥ
translated: The streams, striving to reach the sea, bearing to Indra the well-pressed Soma,

original: aṃśuṃ duhanti hastino bharitrair madhvaḥ punanti dhārayā pavitraiḥ //
analyzed: aṃśum duhanti hastinaḥ bharitraiḥ madhvaḥ punanti dhārayā pavitraiḥ
translated: The milkmen milk the stalk with their hands, they purify the sweet drink with the stream and the purifying strain.

original: hradā iva kukṣayaḥ somadhānāḥ sam ī vivyāca savanā purūṇi /
analyzed: hradāḥ iva kukṣayaḥ soma dhānāḥ sam ī vivyāca savanā purūṇi
translated: Like lakes are the Soma-filled bellies, he has opened out many libations.

original: annā yad indraḥ prathamā vy āśa vṛtraṃ jaghanvāṃ avṛṇīta somam //
analyzed: annā yat indraḥ prathamā vi āśa vṛtram jaghanvān avṛṇīta somam
translated: When Indra first divided the food, he chose Soma to slay Vritra.

original: ā tū bhara mākir etat pari ṣṭhād vidmā hi tvā vasupatiṃ vasūnām /
analyzed: ā tū bhara mākir etat pari sthāt vidma hi tvā vasu patim vasūnām
translated: Bring it hither, let it not pass away from us, for we know thee as the lord of treasures of wealth.

original: indra yat te māhinaṃ datram asty asmabhyaṃ tad dharyaśva pra yandhi //
analyzed: indra yat te māhinam datram asti asmabhyam tat haryaśva pra yandhi
translated: O Indra, O thou of bay steeds, bestow on us that which is thy most mighty gift.

original: asme pra yandhi maghavann ṛjīṣinn indra rāyo viśvavārasya bhūreḥ /
analyzed: asme pra yandhi maghavan ṛjīṣin indra rāyaḥ viśva vārasya bhūreḥ
translated: Bestow it on us, O bountiful, impetuous Indra, on us the ample wealth of riches, O lord of the bay steeds.

original: asme śataṃ śarado jīvase dhā asme vīrāñ chaśvata indra śiprin //🔽śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: asme śatam śaradaḥ jīvase dhāḥ asme vīrām śaśvataḥ indra śiprin  śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: Grant us a hundred years of life, O Indra, O thou of fair cheeks, grant us heroes for ever.🔽We will invoke the bountiful Indra, the best of men in this contest for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The mighty one who listens to us for help in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, who wins treasures.

original: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca /
analyzed: vārtrahatyāya śavase pṛtanāṣāhyāya ca
translated: For the slaying of Vritra, for strength, and for conquering in battles,

original: indra tvā vartayāmasi //
analyzed: indra tvā vartayāmasi
translated: O Indra, we direct thee.

original: arvācīnaṃ su te mana uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato /
analyzed: arvācīnam su te manaḥ uta cakṣuḥ śatakrato
translated: Thy mind and eye, O thou of a hundred powers, we direct hitherward,

original: indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ //
analyzed: indra kṛṇvantu vāghataḥ
translated: O Indra, let the priests make (thee) strong.

original: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhir gīrbhir īmahe /
analyzed: nāmāni te śatakrato viśvābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ īmahe
translated: We invoke thee, O Shatakratu, by all our songs,

original: indrābhimātiṣāhye //
analyzed: indra abhimātiṣāhye
translated: O Indra, for overcoming our enemies.

original: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi /🔽indrasya carṣaṇīdhṛtaḥ //
analyzed: puruṣṭutasya dhāmabhiḥ śatena mahayāmasi  indrasya carṣaṇī dhṛtaḥ
translated: With the powers of the much-praised one we honour🔽Indra, the upholder of the people.

original: indraṃ vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtam upa bruve /
analyzed: indram vṛtrāya hantave puruhūtam upa bruve
translated: I address Indra, invoked by many, to slay Vrtra,

original: bhareṣu vājasātaye //
analyzed: bhareṣu vājasātaye
translated: In battles, to win strength.

original: vājeṣu sāsahir bhava tvām īmahe śatakrato /
analyzed: vājeṣu sāsahiḥ bhava tvām īmahe śatakrato
translated: Be victorious in battles, O Shatakratu, we invoke thee,

original: indra vṛtrāya hantave //
analyzed: indra vṛtrāya hantave
translated: O Indra, to slay Vrtra.

original: dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravassu ca /
analyzed: dyumneṣu pṛtanājye pṛtsutūrṣu śravassu ca
translated: In glories, in battles, in contests, and in fame,

original: indra sākṣvābhimātiṣu //
analyzed: indra sākṣva abhimātiṣu
translated: O Indra, be victorious in battles.

original: śuṣmintamaṃ na ūtaye dyumninam pāhi jāgṛvim /
analyzed: śuṣmintamam naḥ ūtaye dyumninam pāhi jāgṛvim
translated: Most powerful, O helper, protect the glorious one who is watchful,

original: indra somaṃ śatakrato //
analyzed: indra somam śatakrato
translated: O Indra, the Soma, O Shatakratu.

original: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu /
analyzed: indriyāṇi śatakrato yā te janeṣu pañcasu
translated: The powers which thou hast in the five peoples, O Shatakratu,

original: indra tāni ta ā vṛṇe //
analyzed: indra tāni te ā vṛṇe
translated: Those, O Indra, I choose for myself.

original: agann indra śravo bṛhad dyumnaṃ dadhiṣva duṣṭaram /
analyzed: agan indra śravaḥ bṛhat dyumnam dadhiṣva duṣṭaram
translated: O Indra, thou hast gone to great glory; win thou the terrible fame,

original: ut te śuṣmaṃ tirāmasi //🔽arvāvato na ā gahy atho śakra parāvataḥ /
analyzed: ud te śuṣmam tirāmasi  arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi atha u śakra parāvataḥ
translated: We exalt thy strength.🔽Come to us from the near, O Shakra, and from afar,

original: u loko yas te adriva indreha tata ā gahi //
analyzed: u lokaḥ yaḥ te adrivas indra iha tatas ā gahi
translated: From the world which is thine, O wielder of the thunderbolt, come hither, O Indra.

original: abhi taṣṭeva dīdhayā manīṣām atyo na vājī sudhuro jihānaḥ /
analyzed: abhi taṣṭā iva dīdhayāḥ manīṣām atyaḥ na vājī su dhuraḥ jihānaḥ
translated: Like a smith with his bellows, with his thought, my thought, like a strong horse with good reins, striving,

original: abhi priyāṇi marmṛśat parāṇi kavīṃr icchāmi saṃdṛśe sumedhāḥ //🔽inota pṛccha janimā kavīnām manodhṛtaḥ sukṛtas takṣata dyām /
analyzed: abhi priyāṇi marmṛśat parāṇi kavīṃr icchāmi saṃdṛśe sumedhāḥ  inā uta pṛccha janimā kavīnām manodhṛtaḥ su kṛtaḥ takṣata dyām
translated: I have touched the most excellent things that are dear. I desire the wise ones, to see the wise ones.🔽Go and ask about the birth of the wise ones. Mind-held, well-made, they fashioned the sky.

original: imā u te praṇyo vardhamānā manovātā adha nu dharmaṇi gman //
analyzed: imāḥ u te praṇyaḥ vardhamānāḥ manaḥ vātāḥ adha nu dharmaṇi gman
translated: These thy reins, growing, the wind of the mind, have now reached the altar.

original: ni ṣīm id atra guhyā dadhānā uta kṣatrāya rodasī sam añjan /
analyzed: ni sīm id atra guhyā dadhānāḥ uta kṣatrāya rodasī sam añjan
translated: Here, indeed, they, placing secrets, and anointing the two world-halves together for the lordship,

original: sam mātrābhir mamire yemur urvī antar mahī samṛte dhāyase dhuḥ //
analyzed: sam mātrābhiḥ mamire yemuḥ urvī antar mahī samṛte dhāyase dhuḥ
translated: Have measured with the measures. They have set the great one in the middle for support.

original: ātiṣṭhantam pari viśve abhūṣañ chriyo vasānaś carati svarociḥ /
analyzed: ātiṣṭhantam pari viśve abhūṣam chriyaḥ vasānaḥ carati sva rociḥ
translated: All have attended him who hath taken his seat. He moves in his own light, clothed in glory.

original: mahat tad vṛṣṇo asurasya nāmā viśvarūpo amṛtāni tasthau //
analyzed: mahat tat vṛṣṇaḥ asurasya nāma ā viśva rūpaḥ amṛtāni tasthau
translated: That is the great name of the strong Asura. He hath stood in the immortal ones in all forms.

original: asūta pūrvo vṛṣabho jyāyān imā asya śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīḥ /
analyzed: asūta pūrvaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ jyāyān imāḥ asya śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīḥ
translated: The earlier, stronger bull hath brought forth. These are his many ancient powers.

original: divo napātā vidathasya dhībhiḥ kṣatraṃ rājānā pradivo dadhāthe //
analyzed: divaḥ napātā vidathasya dhībhiḥ kṣatram rājānā pradivaḥ dadhāthe
translated: O ye two sons of Dyaus, by the thoughts of the sacrifice, ye two kings, have established lordship.

original: trīṇi rājānā vidathe purūṇi pari viśvāni bhūṣathaḥ sadāṃsi /
analyzed: trīṇi rājānā vidathe purūṇi pari viśvāni bhūṣathaḥ sadāṃsi
translated: O ye two kings, in the sacrifice, ye two, with many, have adorned all the eternal abodes.

original: apaśyam atra manasā jaganvān vrate gandharvāṃ api vāyukeśān //
analyzed: apaśyam atra manasā jaganvān vrate gandharvān api vāyu keśān
translated: Here, as I looked on with my mind, I saw the Gandharvas, whose hair was wind, in the observance of a vow.

original: tad in nv asya vṛṣabhasya dhenor ā nāmabhir mamire sakmyaṃ goḥ /🔽anyadanyad asuryaṃ vasānā ni māyino mamire rūpam asmin //
analyzed: tat id nu asya vṛṣabhasya dhenoḥ ā nāmabhiḥ mamire sakmyam goḥ  anyat anyat asuryam vasānāḥ ni māyinaḥ mamire rūpam asmin
translated: This is the name of his bull, of his cow, by which they have won the power of the cow.🔽The magicians, clothed in one form after another, have fashioned this form in him.

original: tad in nv asya savitur nakir me hiraṇyayīm amatiṃ yām aśiśret /
analyzed: tat id nu asya savituḥ nakir me hiraṇyayīm amatim yām aśiśret
translated: No one, indeed, can surpass the golden thought which Savitar has conceived.

original: ā suṣṭutī rodasī viśvaminve apīva yoṣā janimāni vavre //
analyzed: ā suṣṭutī rodasī viśvaminve api iva yoṣā janimāni vavre
translated: The two all-impelling world-halves have been well praised. The woman, as it were, has chosen the generations.

original: yuvam pratnasya sādhatho maho yad daivī svastiḥ pari ṇaḥ syātam /
analyzed: yuvam pratnasya sādhathaḥ mahaḥ yat daivī svastiḥ pari naḥ syātam
translated: You two accomplish the great work of the ancient one. May the divine welfare be around us.

original: gopājihvasya tasthuṣo virūpā viśve paśyanti māyinaḥ kṛtāni //
analyzed: gopā jihvasya tasthuṣaḥ virūpāḥ viśve paśyanti māyinaḥ kṛtāni
translated: All the magicians behold the manifold deeds of the one who stands with a tongue like a cow-pen.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We will invoke the bountiful Indra, the best of men in this contest for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The terrible one who listens for help in battles, who slays Vr̥itras, who wins treasures.

original: indram matir hṛda ā vacyamānācchā patiṃ stomataṣṭā jigāti /
analyzed: indram matiḥ hṛdaḥ ā vacyamānā acchā patim stoma taṣṭā jigāti
translated: The thought, issuing from the heart, goes forth to Indra, the lord, fashioned by the hymn.

original: yā jāgṛvir vidathe śasyamānendra yat te jāyate viddhi tasya //
analyzed: yā jāgṛviḥ vidathe śasyamānā indra yat te jāyate viddhi tasya
translated: O Indra, know that which is born of thee, when the watchful one is extolled in the assembly.

original: divaś cid ā pūrvyā jāyamānā vi jāgṛvir vidathe śasyamānā /
analyzed: divaḥ cit ā pūrvyā jāyamānā vi jāgṛviḥ vidathe śasyamānā
translated: Even from the sky, from the ancient one, being born, awake, being praised in the assembly,

original: bhadrā vastrāṇy arjunā vasānā seyam asme sanajā pitryā dhīḥ //
analyzed: bhadrā vastrāṇi arjunā vasānā sā iyam asme sana jā pitryā dhīḥ
translated: Wearing beautiful garments, the tawny one, this is the ancestral thought born among us.

original: yamā cid atra yamasūr asūta jihvāyā agram patad ā hy asthāt /
analyzed: yamā cit atra yama sūḥ asūta jihvāyāḥ agram patat ā hi asthāt
translated: Even Yama, the lord of death, gave birth to this, the tip of the tongue fell down, and it remained here.

original: vapūṃṣi jātā mithunā sacete tamohanā tapuṣo budhna etā //
analyzed: vapūṃṣi jātā mithunā sacete tamaḥ hanā tapuṣaḥ budhne etā
translated: The forms of the born twins dwell together, covering darkness, these are the depths of heat.

original: nakir eṣāṃ ninditā martyeṣu ye asmākam pitaro goṣu yodhāḥ /
analyzed: nakir eṣām ninditā martyeṣu ye asmākam pitaraḥ goṣu yodhāḥ
translated: None of these are blamed among mortals, those who are our fathers, fighting for cattle.

original: indra eṣāṃ dṛṃhitā māhināvān ud gotrāṇi sasṛje daṃsanāvān //
analyzed: indraḥ eṣām dṛṃhitā māhināvān ud gotrāṇi sasṛje daṃsanāvān
translated: Indra is their supporter, possessing great power, he has created the clans, possessing great splendor.

original: sakhā ha yatra sakhibhir navagvair abhijñv ā satvabhir gā anugman /
analyzed: sakhā ha yatra sakhibhiḥ navagvaiḥ abhijñu ā satvabhiḥ gāḥ anugman
translated: When the friend, with the friends, the Navagvas, the famous ones, the strong ones, was following the cows,

original: satyaṃ tad indro daśabhir daśagvaiḥ sūryaṃ viveda tamasi kṣiyantam //🔽indro madhu sambhṛtam usriyāyām padvad viveda śaphavan name goḥ /
analyzed: satyam tat indraḥ daśabhiḥ daśagvaiḥ sūryam viveda tamasi kṣiyantam  indraḥ madhu sambhṛtam usriyāyām padvat viveda śaphavat name goḥ
translated: That is true, Indra, with the Dasagvas, he discovered the sun, lying in the darkness.🔽Indra discovered the honey collected in the cow, with the feet, like the hoof of the cow.

original: guhā hitaṃ guhyaṃ gūḷham apsu haste dadhe dakṣiṇe dakṣiṇāvān //
analyzed: guhā hitam guhyam gūḍham apsu haste dadhe dakṣiṇe dakṣiṇāvān
translated: He placed in his right hand, the one who possesses the right, the hidden, the secret, the concealed in the waters.

original: jyotir vṛṇīta tamaso vijānann āre syāma duritād abhīke /
analyzed: jyotiḥ vṛṇīta tamasaḥ vijānan āre syāma duritāt abhīke
translated: Choose the light, knowing from the darkness, may we be far from evil, from near.

original: imā giraḥ somapāḥ somavṛddha juṣasvendra purutamasya kāroḥ //
analyzed: imāḥ giraḥ soma pāḥ soma vṛddha juṣasva indra purutamasya kāroḥ
translated: O Indra, who drink Soma and are strengthened by Soma, accept these songs, O Indra, of the most bountiful singer.

original: jyotir yajñāya rodasī anu ṣyād āre syāma duritasya bhūreḥ /
analyzed: jyotiḥ yajñāya rodasī anu syāt āre syāma duritasya bhūreḥ
translated: Let the light of the sacrifice be spread out over the two world-halves. May we be far from the great misfortune.

original: bhūri cid dhi tujato martyasya supārāso vasavo barhaṇāvat //
analyzed: bhūri cit hi tujataḥ martyasya su pārāsaḥ vasavaḥ barhaṇāvat
translated: For the mortal who strives, the Vasus, who are good to cross over, are indeed very powerful, O you who have great praise.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We invoke the bountiful Indra, the best of men, in this contest for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The mighty one who listens, to help in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, who wins treasures.

original: indra tvā vṛṣabhaṃ vayaṃ sute some havāmahe /
analyzed: indra tvā vṛṣabham vayam sute some havāmahe
translated: O Indra, we call you, the bull, to the pressed Soma, in this invocation.

original: sa pāhi madhvo andhasaḥ //
analyzed: sa pāhi madhvaḥ andhasaḥ
translated: Protect us, O lord of the brave, of the sweet juice of the Soma.

original: indra kratuvidaṃ sutaṃ somaṃ harya puruṣṭuta /
analyzed: indra kratu vidam sutam somam harya puruṣṭuta
translated: O Indra, the wise one, the pressed Soma, the Soma which is offered to you, O you who are praised by many,

original: pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim //
analyzed: pibā vṛṣasva tātṛpim
translated: Drink it, O bull, be satisfied with the satisfying one.

original: indra pra ṇo dhitāvānaṃ yajñaṃ viśvebhir devebhiḥ /
analyzed: indra pra naḥ dhitāvānam yajñam viśvebhiḥ devebhiḥ
translated: O Indra, lead our well-ordered sacrifice, together with all the gods,

original: tira stavāna viśpate //
analyzed: tira stavāna viśpate
translated: To the praise, O lord of the people.

original: indra somāḥ sutā ime tava pra yanti satpate /🔽kṣayaṃ candrāsa indavaḥ //
analyzed: indra somāḥ sutāḥ ime tava pra yanti satpate  kṣayam candrāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: O Indra, these pressed Somas, O lord of the good, go forth to you.🔽The moon-like Soma drops go to your abode.

original: dadhiṣvā jaṭhare sutaṃ somam indra vareṇyam /
analyzed: dadhiṣva ā jaṭhare sutam somam indra vareṇyam
translated: O Indra, enjoy the pressed Soma, the excellent Soma, in your belly.

original: tava dyukṣāsa indavaḥ //
analyzed: tava dyu kṣāsaḥ indavaḥ
translated: Your intoxicating Soma drops are in the sky.

original: girvaṇaḥ pāhi naḥ sutam madhor dhārābhir ajyase /
analyzed: girvaṇaḥ pāhi naḥ sutam madhoḥ dhārābhiḥ ajyase
translated: O lover of praise, protect our Soma juice, you are anointed with streams of sweetness.

original: indra tvādātam id yaśaḥ //
analyzed: indra tvādātam id yaśaḥ
translated: O Indra, you alone are to be praised.

original: abhi dyumnāni vanina indraṃ sacante akṣitā /
analyzed: abhi dyumnāni vaninaḥ indram sacante akṣitā
translated: The inexhaustible riches follow Indra, the trees.

original: pītvī somasya vāvṛdhe //
analyzed: pītvī somasya vāvṛdhe
translated: Having drunk the Soma, he has grown.

original: arvāvato na ā gahi parāvataś ca vṛtrahan /
analyzed: arvāvataḥ naḥ ā gahi parāvataḥ ca vṛtrahan
translated: Come to us from the far side and the near side, O Vrtra-killer.

original: imā juṣasva no giraḥ //
analyzed: imāḥ juṣasva naḥ giraḥ
translated: Accept these songs of ours.

original: yad antarā parāvatam arvāvataṃ ca hūyase /
analyzed: yat antarā parāvatam arvāvatam ca hūyase
translated: If you are invoked from the far side and the near side,

original: indreha tata ā gahi //🔽ā tū na indra madryag ghuvānaḥ somapītaye /
analyzed: indra iha tatas ā gahi  ā tū naḥ indra madryak huvānaḥ soma pītaye
translated: come from there, O Indra.🔽Come to us, O Indra, as one to be praised, O mighty one, to drink the Soma.

original: haribhyāṃ yāhy adrivaḥ //
analyzed: haribhyām yāhi adrivas
translated: Come on your two bay horses, O wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: satto hotā na ṛtviyas tistire barhir ānuṣak /
analyzed: sattaḥ hotā naḥ ṛtviyaḥ tistire barhiḥ ānuṣak
translated: The true priest, the regular priest, has spread out the grass in order.

original: ayujran prātar adrayaḥ //
analyzed: ayujran prātar adrayaḥ
translated: The pressing stones have been set in motion in the morning.

original: imā brahma brahmavāhaḥ kriyanta ā barhiḥ sīda /
analyzed: imā brahma brahma vāhaḥ kriyante ā barhiḥ sīda
translated: These prayers, O Brahman, are being made for you, O bearer of prayers, sit on the grass.

original: vīhi śūra puroḷāśam //
analyzed: vīhi śūra puroḷāśam
translated: Come, O hero, to the sacrificial cake.

original: rārandhi savaneṣu ṇa eṣu stomeṣu vṛtrahan /
analyzed: rārandhi savaneṣu naḥ eṣu stomeṣu vṛtrahan
translated: Be pleased with us at the libations, at these hymns, O Vrtra-killer.

original: uktheṣv indra girvaṇaḥ //
analyzed: uktheṣu indra girvaṇaḥ
translated: In the praises, O Indra, O lover of praise.

original: matayaḥ somapām uruṃ rihanti śavasas patim /
analyzed: matayaḥ soma pām urum rihanti śavasaḥ patim
translated: The thoughts of the Soma-drinker kiss the wide lord of power,

original: indraṃ vatsaṃ na mātaraḥ //🔽sa mandasvā hy andhaso rādhase tanvā mahe /
analyzed: indram vatsam na mātaraḥ  sa mandasva hi andhasaḥ rādhase tanvā mahe
translated: Indra, like mothers their calf.🔽Rejoice in the juice for the sake of the gift, with your own body for the great.

original: na stotāraṃ nide karaḥ //
analyzed: na stotāram nide karaḥ
translated: Do not harm the praiser.

original: vayam indra tvāyavo haviṣmanto jarāmahe /
analyzed: vayam indra tvāyavaḥ haviṣmantaḥ jarāmahe
translated: We, O Indra, are your servants, bringing offerings, we rejoice.

original: uta tvam asmayur vaso //
analyzed: uta tvam asmayuḥ vaso
translated: And you, O Vasu, are ours.

original: māre asmad vi mumuco haripriyārvāṅ yāhi /
analyzed: mā āre asmat vi mumucaḥ hari priya arvāṅ yāhi
translated: Deliver us from tribulation, O you who are dear to the tawny ones, come hither.

original: indra svadhāvo matsveha //
analyzed: indra svadhāvas matsva iha
translated: O Indra, self-moving one, rejoice here.

original: arvāñcaṃ tvā sukhe rathe vahatām indra keśinā /
analyzed: arvāñcam tvā sukhe rathe vahatām indra keśinā
translated: Let your bay steeds bring you hither on a pleasant chariot, O Indra, with the reins.

original: ghṛtasnū barhir āsade //
analyzed: ghṛtasnū barhiḥ āsade
translated: To the seat of the grass anointed with ghee.

original: upa naḥ sutam ā gahi somam indra gavāśiram /
analyzed: upa naḥ sutam ā gahi somam indra gavāśiram
translated: Come to our pressed Soma, O Indra, mixed with milk,

original: haribhyāṃ yas te asmayuḥ //
analyzed: haribhyām yaḥ te asmayuḥ
translated: Which is yours, O you who are dear to the tawny ones.

original: tam indra madam ā gahi barhiṣṭhāṃ grāvabhiḥ sutam /
analyzed: tam indra madam ā gahi grāvabhiḥ sutam
translated: O Indra, come to that rapture, best pressed with the pressing-stones,

original: kuvin nv asya tṛpṇavaḥ //
analyzed: kuvid nu asya tṛpṇavaḥ
translated: Will you not be satisfied with it?

original: indram itthā giro mamācchāgur iṣitā itaḥ /
analyzed: indram itthā giraḥ mama acchā aguḥ iṣitāḥ itas
translated: My songs have hastened hither to Indra in this way, urged on.

original: āvṛte somapītaye //
analyzed: āvṛte soma pītaye
translated: To be covered for the drinking of Soma.

original: indraṃ somasya pītaye stomair iha havāmahe /
analyzed: indram somasya pītaye stomaiḥ iha havāmahe
translated: We invoke Indra here with praises for the drinking of Soma.

original: ukthebhiḥ kuvid āgamat //
analyzed: ukthebhiḥ kuvid āgamat
translated: Will he come by the hymns?

original: indra somāḥ sutā ime tān dadhiṣva śatakrato /🔽jaṭhare vājinīvaso //
analyzed: indra somāḥ sutāḥ ime tān dadhiṣva śatakrato  jaṭhare vājinīvaso
translated: O Indra, these pressed Somas are yours, O you of a hundred powers.🔽Accept them in your belly, O you who are rich in treasures.

original: vidmā hi tvā dhanañjayaṃ vājeṣu dadhṛṣaṃ kave /
analyzed: vidma hi tvā dhanañjayam vājeṣu dadhṛṣam kave
translated: We know you as the conqueror of wealth, daring in battles, O wise one.

original: adhā te sumnam īmahe //
analyzed: adhā te sumnam īmahe
translated: Now we seek your favor.

original: imam indra gavāśiraṃ yavāśiraṃ ca naḥ piba /
analyzed: imam indra gavāśiram yava āśiram ca naḥ piba
translated: Drink this, O Indra, mixed with milk and barley,

original: āgatyā vṛṣabhiḥ sutam //
analyzed: āgatyā vṛṣabhiḥ sutam
translated: Come, O bull, to the pressed (Soma).

original: tubhyed indra sva okye somaṃ codāmi pītaye /
analyzed: tubhya id indra sve okye somam codāmi pītaye
translated: For thee, O Indra, in thine own abode, I urge the Soma to be drunk,

original: eṣa rārantu te hṛdi //
analyzed: eṣa rārantu te hṛdi
translated: May this delight thy heart.

original: tvāṃ sutasya pītaye pratnam indra havāmahe /
analyzed: tvām sutasya pītaye pratnam indra havāmahe
translated: We invoke thee, O ancient Indra, to drink the Soma,

original: kuśikāso avasyavaḥ //🔽ā yāhy arvāṅ upa vandhureṣṭhās taved anu pradivaḥ somapeyam /
analyzed: kuśikāsaḥ avasyavaḥ  ā yāhi arvāṅ upa vandhureṣṭhāḥ tava id anu pradivaḥ soma peyam
translated: The Kuśikas with their prayers.🔽Come hither on thy car-seat, following the light of the sky, to drink the Soma.

original: priyā sakhāyā vi mucopa barhis tvām ime havyavāho havante //
analyzed: priyā sakhāyā vi muca upa barhiḥ tvām ime havyavāhaḥ havante
translated: Untie the bonds of friendship, and sit on the sacred grass. These bearers of oblations invoke thee.

original: ā yāhi pūrvīr ati carṣaṇīr āṃ arya āśiṣa upa no haribhyām /
analyzed: ā yāhi pūrvīḥ ati carṣaṇīḥ aryaḥ āśiṣaḥ upa naḥ haribhyām
translated: Come hither over many people, O worthy one, with thy two bay steeds, to the blessings we desire.

original: imā hi tvā mataya stomataṣṭā indra havante sakhyaṃ juṣāṇāḥ //
analyzed: imāḥ hi tvā matayaḥ stoma taṣṭāḥ indra havante sakhyam juṣāṇāḥ
translated: For these thoughts, these hymns, O Indra, longing for friendship, invoke thee.

original: ā no yajñaṃ namovṛdhaṃ sajoṣā indra deva haribhir yāhi tūyam /
analyzed: ā naḥ yajñam namaḥ vṛdham sajoṣāḥ indra deva haribhiḥ yāhi tūyam
translated: Come quickly, O God Indra, with thy two bay steeds, to our sacrifice, which increases honour,

original: ahaṃ hi tvā matibhir johavīmi ghṛtaprayāḥ sadhamāde madhūnām //
analyzed: aham hi tvā matibhiḥ johavīmi ghṛta prayāḥ sadhamāde madhūnām
translated: For I invoke thee with my thoughts, with offerings of ghee, at the banquet of the sweet juices.

original: ā ca tvām etā vṛṣaṇā vahāto harī sakhāyā sudhurā svaṅgā /
analyzed: ā ca tvām etā vṛṣaṇā vahātaḥ harī sakhāyā su dhurā su aṅgā
translated: And these two strong ones, thy two bay steeds, thy two well-yoked friends, carry thee hither.

original: dhānāvad indraḥ savanaṃ juṣāṇaḥ sakhā sakhyuḥ śṛṇavad vandanāni //
analyzed: dhānāvat indraḥ savanam juṣāṇaḥ sakhā sakhyuḥ śṛṇavat vandanāni
translated: Indra, the possessor of riches, delighting in the libation, the friend, hears the praises of his friend.

original: kuvin mā gopāṃ karase janasya kuvid rājānam maghavann ṛjīṣin /
analyzed: kuvid mā gopām karase janasya kuvid rājānam maghavan ṛjīṣin
translated: O bountiful one, who art thou to the people? Who art thou to the king, O mighty one?

original: kuvin ma ṛṣim papivāṃsaṃ sutasya kuvin me vasvo amṛtasya śikṣāḥ //
analyzed: kuvid me ṛṣim papivāṃsam sutasya kuvid me vasvaḥ amṛtasya śikṣāḥ
translated: Have you not made me a R̥ishi, who hath drunk of the juice? Have you not taught me the way to immortality and wealth?

original: ā tvā bṛhanto harayo yujānā arvāg indra sadhamādo vahantu /
analyzed: ā tvā bṛhantaḥ harayaḥ yujānāḥ arvāk indra sadhamādaḥ vahantu
translated: Let thy great Bay Steeds harnessed bring thee hither, O Indra, to the banquet, to our dwelling,

original: pra ye dvitā diva ṛñjanty ātāḥ susammṛṣṭāso vṛṣabhasya mūrāḥ //
analyzed: pra ye dvitā divaḥ ṛñjanti ātāḥ su sammṛṣṭāsaḥ vṛṣabhasya mūrāḥ
translated: Who, twice a day, delighting, come to the heaven, well-combed, the vigorous one's attendants.

original: indra piba vṛṣadhūtasya vṛṣṇa ā yaṃ te śyena uśate jabhāra /
analyzed: indra piba vṛṣa dhūtasya vṛṣṇaḥ ā yam te śyenaḥ uśate jabhāra
translated: Drink, Indra, of the juice that hath been pressed for thee, O mighty One, which the falcon brought thee for thy joy.

original: yasya made cyāvayasi pra kṛṣṭīr yasya made apa gotrā vavartha //
analyzed: yasya made cyāvayasi pra kṛṣṭīḥ yasya made apa gotrā vavartha
translated: In whose wild transport thou movest the people, in whose wild transport thou hast won the cattle.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We will invoke auspicious Maghavan Indra, best of heroes, in this fight for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //🔽ayaṃ te astu haryataḥ soma ā haribhiḥ sutaḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām  ayam te astu haryataḥ somaḥ ā haribhiḥ sutaḥ
translated: The terrible One who listens to our call in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, who wins treasures.🔽Let this be thine, O joyous One, O Indra, Soma pressed by the brown men for thy rapture.

original: juṣāṇa indra haribhir na ā gahy ā tiṣṭha haritaṃ ratham //
analyzed: juṣāṇaḥ indra haribhiḥ naḥ ā gahi ā tiṣṭha haritam ratham
translated: Accept it, O thou who lovest the Bay Steeds, come hither with thy Bays, and mount thy chariot.

original: haryann uṣasam arcayaḥ sūryaṃ haryann arocayaḥ /
analyzed: haryan uṣasam arcayaḥ sūryam haryan arocayaḥ
translated: Thou, rejoicing, hast glorified the Morning, thou, rejoicing, hast irradiated Sûrya.

original: vidvāṃś cikitvān haryaśva vardhasa indra viśvā abhi śriyaḥ //
analyzed: vidvān cikitvān haryaśva vardhase indra viśvāḥ abhi śriyaḥ
translated: Thou, O thou whose steeds are brown, who knowest and understandest, hast increased all glories, O Indra.

original: dyām indro haridhāyasam pṛthivīṃ harivarpasam /
analyzed: dyām indraḥ hari dhāyasam pṛthivīm hari varpasam
translated: Indra, the supporter of heaven, the golden-hued, and earth, the golden-backed,

original: adhārayad dharitor bhūri bhojanaṃ yayor antar hariś carat //
analyzed: adhārayat haritoḥ bhūri bhojanam yayoḥ antar hariḥ carat
translated: Supports the abundant food of the two golden ones, within whom the golden one moves.

original: jajñāno harito vṛṣā viśvam ā bhāti rocanam /🔽haryaśvo haritaṃ dhatta āyudham ā vajram bāhvor harim //🔽indro haryantam arjunaṃ vajraṃ śukrair abhīvṛtam /
analyzed: jajñānaḥ haritaḥ vṛṣā viśvam ā bhāti rocanam  hari aśvaḥ haritam dhatte āyudham ā vajram bāhvoḥ harim  indraḥ haryantam arjunam vajram śukraiḥ abhīvṛtam
translated: The golden-hued bull, as soon as born, shines over all the shining light.🔽The one with golden horses holds the golden weapon and the golden thunderbolt in his arms.🔽Indra, with the bright ones, uncovered the golden-hued, the dark-hued thunderbolt.

original: apāvṛṇod dharibhir adribhiḥ sutam ud gā haribhir ājata //
analyzed: apāvṛṇot haribhiḥ adribhiḥ sutam ud gāḥ haribhiḥ ājata
translated: He opened the golden-hued, the pressed (Soma) with the golden-hued stones. He rose with the golden-hued (horses).

original: ā mandrair indra haribhir yāhi mayūraromabhiḥ /
analyzed: ā mandraiḥ indra haribhiḥ yāhi mayūra romabhiḥ
translated: Come, O Indra, with the cheerful golden-hued (horses), with the peacock-maned (horses).

original: mā tvā ke cin ni yaman viṃ na pāśino 'ti dhanveva tāṃ ihi //
analyzed: mā tvā ke cit ni yaman vim na pāśinaḥ ti dhanvā iva tām ihi
translated: Let none hold thee back, as with a noose, go beyond (them) as over a desert.

original: vṛtrakhādo valaṃrujaḥ purāṃ darmo apām ajaḥ /
analyzed: vṛtra khādaḥ valaṃrujaḥ purām darmaḥ apām ajaḥ
translated: The eater of Vritra, the shaker of the firm forts, the goat of the waters,

original: sthātā rathasya haryor abhisvara indro dṛḷhā cid ārujaḥ //🔽gambhīrāṃ udadhīṃr iva kratum puṣyasi gā iva /
analyzed: sthātā rathasya haryoḥ abhisvaraḥ indraḥ dṛḷhā cit ārujaḥ  gambhīrān udadhīṃr iva kratum puṣyasi gāḥ iva
translated: The rider of the chariot, the rider of the two golden (horses), Indra, even the firm (forts) he overthrows.🔽As one who increases strength, as one who increases thought, as one who increases the deep oceans, as one who increases the cows,

original: pra sugopā yavasaṃ dhenavo yathā hradaṃ kulyā ivāśata //
analyzed: pra su gopāḥ yavasam dhenavaḥ yathā hradam kulyāḥ iva āśata
translated: As the cows to the fodder, as the channels to the lake, so (he comes) to the well-guarded (Soma).

original: ā nas tujaṃ rayim bharāṃśaṃ na pratijānate /
analyzed: ā naḥ tujam rayim bhara aṃśam na pratijānate
translated: Bring us the wealth which is to be chosen, which is to be desired,

original: vṛkṣam pakvam phalam aṅkīva dhūnuhīndra sampāraṇaṃ vasu //
analyzed: vṛkṣam pakvam phalam aṅkī iva dhūnuhi indra sampāraṇam vasu
translated: Shake the ripe fruit from the tree, O Indra, as from a branch, and give us wealth in abundance.

original: svayur indra svarāḷ asi smaddiṣṭiḥ svayaśastaraḥ /
analyzed: svayuḥ indra svarāj asi smaddiṣṭiḥ sva yaśastaraḥ
translated: Thou art the self-ruler, O Indra, the self-directed, the most famous of the self-renowned.

original: sa vāvṛdhāna ojasā puruṣṭuta bhavā naḥ suśravastamaḥ //
analyzed: sa vāvṛdhānaḥ ojasā puruṣṭuta bhava naḥ su śravastamaḥ
translated: So, O much-praised one, wax mighty in thy strength, and be to us most renowned for glory.

original: yudhmasya te vṛṣabhasya svarāja ugrasya yūna sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ /
analyzed: yudhmasya te vṛṣabhasya svarājaḥ ugrasya yūna sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ
translated: Of thee the warrior, the bull, the self-ruling, the fierce, the young, the strong, the active,

original: ajūryato vajriṇo vīryāṇīndra śrutasya mahato mahāni //
analyzed: a jūryataḥ vajriṇaḥ vīryāṇi indra śrutasya mahataḥ mahāni
translated: The undecaying, O Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the great, the mighty deeds.

original: mahāṃ asi mahiṣa vṛṣṇyebhir dhanaspṛd ugra sahamāno anyān /
analyzed: mahān asi mahiṣa vṛṣṇyebhiḥ dhana spṛt ugra sahamānaḥ anyān
translated: Thou art great, O bull, with thy manly powers, O thou who winnest wealth, O fierce one, overcoming others.

original: eko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā sa yodhayā ca kṣayayā ca janān //
analyzed: ekaḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā sa yodhayā ca kṣayayā ca janān
translated: Thou art the sole king of the whole world, thou who with battle and with peace rulest the people.

original: pra mātrābhī ririce rocamānaḥ pra devebhir viśvato apratītaḥ /
analyzed: pra mātrābhiḥ ririce rocamānaḥ pra devebhiḥ viśvatas apratītaḥ
translated: He hath surpassed his mother by his greatness, he who shineth forth, he who is irresistible by all the gods on every side.

original: pra majmanā diva indraḥ pṛthivyāḥ proror maho antarikṣād ṛjīṣī //
analyzed: pra majmanā divaḥ indraḥ pṛthivyāḥ pra uroḥ mahaḥ antarikṣāt ṛjīṣī
translated: Indra by his greatness on earth and in heaven, by his greatness in the wide air, the strong one.

original: uruṃ gabhīraṃ januṣābhy ugraṃ viśvavyacasam avatam matīnām /
analyzed: urum gabhīram januṣā abhi ugram viśva vyacasam avatam matīnām
translated: Wide, deep, by nature exceeding mighty, all-containing, the supporter of thoughts.

original: indraṃ somāsaḥ pradivi sutāsaḥ samudraṃ na sravata ā viśanti //
analyzed: indram somāsaḥ pradivi sutāsaḥ samudram na sravataḥ ā viśanti
translated: The pressed Soma juices, O Indra, in the firmament, like streams to the ocean, enter thee.

original: yaṃ somam indra pṛthivīdyāvā garbhaṃ na mātā bibhṛtas tvāyā /
analyzed: yam somam indra pṛthivī dyāvā garbham na mātā bibhṛtaḥ tvāyā
translated: O Indra, the Soma which the two worlds, like a mother her child, have borne as their embryo,

original: taṃ te hinvanti tam u te mṛjanty adhvaryavo vṛṣabha pātavā u //
analyzed: tam te hinvanti tam u te mṛjanti adhvaryavaḥ vṛṣabha pātavai u
translated: That they urge on for thee, that they purify for thee, O bull, the Adhvaryus, for thy drinking.

original: marutvāṃ indra vṛṣabho raṇāya pibā somam anuṣvadham madāya /
analyzed: indra vṛṣabhaḥ raṇāya piba somam anuṣvadham madāya
translated: O Indra, accompanied by the Maruts, be a bull for the battle; drink the Soma according to the rite for the sake of intoxication.

original: ā siñcasva jaṭhare madhva ūrmiṃ tvaṃ rājāsi pradivaḥ sutānām //
analyzed: ā siñcasva jaṭhare madhvaḥ ūrmim tvam rājā asi pradivaḥ sutānām
translated: Pour into thy belly the wave of sweet drink; thou art the king of the gifts of the pressed (Soma).

original: sajoṣā indra sagaṇo marudbhiḥ somam piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān /
analyzed: sajoṣāḥ indra sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ somam piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān
translated: O Indra, of one mind with the Maruts, of one company, drink the Soma, O hero, O wise one, the Vrtra-slayer.

original: jahi śatrūṃr apa mṛdho nudasvāthābhayaṃ kṛṇuhi viśvato naḥ //
analyzed: jahi śatrūṃr apa mṛdhaḥ nudasva atha abhayam kṛṇuhi viśvatas naḥ
translated: Slay the enemies, drive away the haters, and make us everywhere free from fear.

original: uta ṛtubhir ṛtupāḥ pāhi somam indra devebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sutaṃ naḥ /
analyzed: uta ṛtubhiḥ ṛtu pāḥ pāhi somam indra devebhiḥ sakhibhiḥ sutam naḥ
translated: And, O thou who presidest over the seasons, protect the Soma, O Indra, with the gods, with our friends, the pressed (Soma).

original: yāṃ ābhajo maruto ye tvānv ahan vṛtram adadhus tubhyam ojaḥ //
analyzed: yām ābhajaḥ marutaḥ ye tvā anu ahan vṛtram adadhuḥ tubhyam ojaḥ
translated: The portion which thou hast received, O Maruts, who have helped thee, who have slain Vrtra, have bestowed strength on thee.

original: ye tvāhihatye maghavann avardhan ye śāmbare harivo ye gaviṣṭau /
analyzed: ye tvā ahi hatye maghavan avardhan ye śāmbare harivas ye gaviṣṭau
translated: Those who have magnified thee, O bountiful one, in the slaying of Ahi, in the Sambara, in the contest for the cow,

original: ye tvā nūnam anumadanti viprāḥ pibendra somaṃ sagaṇo marudbhiḥ //
analyzed: ye tvā nūnam anumadanti viprāḥ piba indra somam sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ
translated: Those who now rejoice in thee, O sage, drink the Soma, O Indra, together with the Maruts.

original: marutvantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ vāvṛdhānam akavāriṃ divyaṃ śāsam indram /
analyzed: marutvantam vṛṣabham vāvṛdhānam a kavārim divyam śāsam indram
translated: The Marut-attended bull, the grown, the irresistible, the heavenly king, the chastiser,

original: viśvāsāham avase nūtanāyograṃ sahodām iha taṃ huvema //
analyzed: viśvāsāham avase nūtanāya ugram sahaḥ dām iha tam huvema
translated: I call him, the new and mighty one, to our aid, who is to be trusted, who gives abundant strength.

original: sadyo ha jāto vṛṣabhaḥ kanīnaḥ prabhartum āvad andhasaḥ sutasya /
analyzed: sadyas ha jātaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ kanīnaḥ prabhartum āvat andhasaḥ sutasya
translated: As soon as he was born, the young bull, the infant, was able to bear the Soma juice.

original: sādhoḥ piba pratikāmaṃ yathā te rasāśiraḥ prathamaṃ somyasya //
analyzed: sādhoḥ piba pratikāmam yathā te rasāśiraḥ prathamam somyasya
translated: Drink as thou wilt of the pure, O thou whose head is anointed with Soma juice, of the first-pressed.

original: yaj jāyathās tad ahar asya kāme 'ṃśoḥ pīyūṣam apibo giriṣṭhām /
analyzed: yat jāyathāḥ tat ahar asya kāme ṃśoḥ pīyūṣam apibaḥ giriṣṭhām
translated: On the day of his birth, he drank the milk of the Amsu, the heavenly food, from the mountain.

original: taṃ te mātā pari yoṣā janitrī mahaḥ pitur dama āsiñcad agre //
analyzed: tam te mātā pari yoṣā janitrī mahaḥ pituḥ dame āsiñcat agre
translated: His mother, the young woman, the progenitor, poured it into the great lap of the father.

original: upasthāya mātaram annam aiṭṭa tigmam apaśyad abhi somam ūdhaḥ /
analyzed: upasthāya mātaram annam tigmam apaśyat abhi somam ūdhaḥ
translated: Having approached his mother, he ate food, and saw the sharp udder of the Soma.

original: prayāvayann acarad gṛtso anyān mahāni cakre purudhapratīkaḥ //
analyzed: prayāvayan acarat gṛtsaḥ anyān mahāni cakre purudha pratīkaḥ
translated: Driving away the others, the strong one moved about, making great deeds, of many forms.

original: ugras turāṣāḷ abhibhūtyojā yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ cakra eṣaḥ /🔽tvaṣṭāram indro januṣābhibhūyāmuṣyā somam apibac camūṣu //
analyzed: ugraḥ turāṣāh abhibhūti ojāḥ yathāvaśam tanvam cakre eṣaḥ  tvaṣṭāram indraḥ januṣā abhibhūya amuṣya ā somam apibat camūṣu
translated: The strong one, with mighty power, has made his body as he desired.🔽Indra, having surpassed Tvashtar in birth, drank the Soma in the bowls, in the house of the Amsu.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We will invoke the bountiful Indra, the best of men in this contest for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The strong one, who listens, to help us in battles, who slays the Vr̥itras, who wins treasures.

original: śaṃsā mahām indraṃ yasmin viśvā ā kṛṣṭayaḥ somapāḥ kāmam avyan /
analyzed: śaṃsa mahām indram yasmin viśvāḥ ā kṛṣṭayaḥ soma pāḥ kāmam avyan
translated: Praise Indra, the great one, in whom all the Soma-drinking clans have placed their desire.

original: yaṃ sukratuṃ dhiṣaṇe vibhvataṣṭaṃ ghanaṃ vṛtrāṇāṃ janayanta devāḥ //
analyzed: yam sukratum dhiṣaṇe vibhva taṣṭam ghanam vṛtrāṇām janayanta devāḥ
translated: The one of good thoughts, fashioned by the two mighty ones, the gods have generated the breaker of strongholds.

original: yaṃ nu nakiḥ pṛtanāsu svarājaṃ dvitā tarati nṛtamaṃ hariṣṭhām /
analyzed: yam nu nakir pṛtanāsu sva rājam dvitā tarati nṛtamam hariṣṭhām
translated: The one who is never overcome in battles, the best of men, the most beautiful, the one who is twice as strong.

original: inatamaḥ satvabhir yo ha śūṣaiḥ pṛthujrayā aminād āyur dasyoḥ //
analyzed: inatamaḥ satvabhiḥ yaḥ ha śūṣaiḥ pṛthujrayā amināt āyuḥ dasyoḥ
translated: The one who with his strength and his vigor has shortened the life of the Dasyu with wide-ranging arrows.

original: sahāvā pṛtsu taraṇir nārvā vyānaśī rodasī mehanāvān /
analyzed: sahāvā pṛtsu taraṇiḥ na arvā vyānaśī rodasī mehanāvān
translated: The ally in battles, the swift one, the one who has measured out the two worlds, the one who has spread out the sky and earth.

original: bhago na kāre havyo matīnām piteva cāruḥ suhavo vayodhāḥ //
analyzed: bhagaḥ na kāre havyaḥ matīnām pitā iva cāruḥ su havaḥ vayodhāḥ
translated: The one who is to be invoked like Bhaga, to be offered to like Agni, the one who is dear like a father, the one who is easily invoked, the one who gives life.

original: dhartā divo rajasas pṛṣṭa ūrdhvo ratho na vāyur vasubhir niyutvān /
analyzed: dhartā divaḥ rajasaḥ pṛṣṭaḥ ūrdhvaḥ rathaḥ na vāyuḥ vasubhiḥ niyutvān
translated: The one who holds up the sky and the atmosphere, the one who is high, the one who is like a chariot, the one who is like the wind, the one who is accompanied by the Vasus.

original: kṣapāṃ vastā janitā sūryasya vibhaktā bhāgaṃ dhiṣaṇeva vājam //
analyzed: kṣapām vastā janitā sūryasya vibhaktā bhāgam dhiṣaṇā iva vājam
translated: The one who has made the night and the day, the one who has generated the sun, the one who has divided the portions like a mother gives strength.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We invoke the bountiful Indra, the best of men, in this contest, in the winning of booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The one who listens, the fierce one, for help in battles, the one who slays the Vr̥itras, the one who is victorious in winning wealth.

original: indraḥ svāhā pibatu yasya soma āgatyā tumro vṛṣabho marutvān /
analyzed: indraḥ svāhā pibatu yasya somaḥ āgatyā tumraḥ vṛṣabhaḥ marutvān
translated: May Indra, to whom the Soma belongs, the ruddy bull accompanied by the Maruts, drink the offering.

original: oruvyacāḥ pṛṇatām ebhir annair āsya havis tanvaḥ kāmam ṛdhyāḥ //
analyzed: ā uru vyacāḥ pṛṇatām ebhiḥ annaiḥ ā asya haviḥ tanvaḥ kāmam ṛdhyāḥ
translated: May the sky and earth be filled with these foods; may thy mouth and body prosper as they desire.

original: ā te saparyū javase yunajmi yayor anu pradivaḥ śruṣṭim āvaḥ /
analyzed: ā te saparyū javase yunajmi yayoḥ anu pradivaḥ śruṣṭim āvaḥ
translated: I yoke for thee thy two swift steeds, O Indra, by which thou goest to the hearing of the prayer.

original: iha tvā dheyur harayaḥ suśipra pibā tv asya suṣutasya cāroḥ //
analyzed: iha tvā dheyuḥ harayaḥ su śipra pibā tu asya suṣutasya cāroḥ
translated: Here let the tawny ones bring thee, O thou of beautiful brows; drink of this well-pressed juice.

original: gobhir mimikṣuṃ dadhire supāram indraṃ jyaiṣṭhyāya dhāyase gṛṇānāḥ /
analyzed: gobhiḥ mimikṣum dadhire su pāram indram jyaiṣṭhyāya dhāyase gṛṇānāḥ
translated: They have made Indra, the good deliverer, to be mixed with milk, singing for the nourishment of preeminence.

original: mandānaḥ somam papivāṃ ṛjīṣin sam asmabhyam purudhā gā iṣaṇya //
analyzed: mandānaḥ somam papivān ṛjīṣin sam asmabhyam purudhā gāḥ iṣaṇya
translated: Rejoicing, O impetuous one, having drunk the Soma, send to us in many ways the cattle.

original: imaṃ kāmam mandayā gobhir aśvaiś candravatā rādhasā paprathaś ca /🔽svaryavo matibhis tubhyaṃ viprā indrāya vāhaḥ kuśikāso akran //
analyzed: imam kāmam mandayā gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ candravatā rādhasā paprathaḥ ca  svaryavaḥ matibhiḥ tubhyam viprāḥ indrāya vāhaḥ kuśikāsaḥ akran
translated: Fulfil this desire of mine with cattle and horses, and with wealth that is bright as the moon.🔽The singers, with their thoughts, have brought a gift to Indra, the prosperous, the one who delights in the heavenly.

original: śunaṃ huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamaṃ vājasātau /
analyzed: śunam huvema maghavānam indram asmin bhare nṛtamam vājasātau
translated: We will invoke the bountiful Indra, the best of men in this contest for booty.

original: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantaṃ vṛtrāṇi saṃjitaṃ dhanānām //
analyzed: śṛṇvantam ugram ūtaye samatsu ghnantam vṛtrāṇi saṃjitam dhanānām
translated: The strong one, who listens, for help in the battles, the slayer of foes, the conqueror of riches.

original: carṣaṇīdhṛtam maghavānam ukthyam indraṃ giro bṛhatīr abhy anūṣata /
analyzed: carṣaṇī dhṛtam maghavānam ukthyam indram giraḥ bṛhatīḥ abhī anūṣata
translated: The great hymns have sung forth to Indra, the lord of men, the bountiful one worthy of praise.

original: vāvṛdhānam puruhūtaṃ suvṛktibhir amartyaṃ jaramāṇaṃ divedive //
analyzed: vāvṛdhānam puruhūtam suvṛktibhiḥ amartyam jaramāṇam dive dive
translated: Who waxes great, much-invoked, with our hymns of praise, immortal, ever young from day to day.

original: śatakratum arṇavaṃ śākinaṃ naraṃ giro ma indram upa yanti viśvataḥ /
analyzed: śatakratum arṇavam śākinam naram giraḥ me indram upa yanti viśvatas
translated: Indra, the hundred-powered, the ocean, the hero, the strong, my songs come from all sides to him.

original: vājasanim pūrbhidaṃ tūrṇim apturaṃ dhāmasācam abhiṣācaṃ svarvidam //
analyzed: vāja sanim pūḥ bhidam tūrṇim ap turam dhāmasācam abhiṣācam svar vidam
translated: The winner of spoil, the breaker of forts, the swift, the far-reaching, the possessor of wealth, the overcomer, the finder of light.

original: ākare vasor jaritā panasyate 'nehasa stubha indro duvasyati /
analyzed: ākare vasoḥ jaritā panasyate na ihasaḥ stubhaḥ indraḥ duvasyati
translated: In the abode of treasure the singer is honoured; Indra, the unwearied, the praised, is to be served.

original: vivasvataḥ sadana ā hi pipriye satrāsāham abhimātihanaṃ stuhi //🔽nṛṇām u tvā nṛtamaṃ gīrbhir ukthair abhi pra vīram arcatā sabādhaḥ /
analyzed: vivasvataḥ sadane ā hi pipriye satrāsāham abhimāti hanam stuhi  nṛṇām u tvā nṛtamam gīrbhiḥ ukthaiḥ abhi pra vīram arcata sabādhaḥ
translated: For I delight in the seat of Vivasvan, praise him, the irresistible, the slayer of foes.🔽Thee, best of men, with songs and hymns I glorify, as a guest, O hero, with all my people.

original: saṃ sahase purumāyo jihīte namo asya pradiva eka īśe //
analyzed: sam sahase puru māyaḥ jihīte namaḥ asya pradivaḥ ekaḥ īśe
translated: He stretches out to meet thy conquering might, O thou of many wiles; alone he rules over his gift.

original: pūrvīr asya niṣṣidho martyeṣu purū vasūni pṛthivī bibharti /🔽indrāya dyāva oṣadhīr utāpo rayiṃ rakṣanti jīrayo vanāni //
analyzed: pūrvīḥ asya niṣṣidhaḥ martyeṣu purū vasūni pṛthivī bibharti  indrāya dyāvaḥ oṣadhīḥ uta apaḥ rayim rakṣanti jīrayaḥ vanāni
translated: Many are his barriers among mankind; the earth bears many treasures for him.🔽For Indra the heavens, the plants, and the waters guard wealth; the woods, the young plants, guard wealth.

original: tubhyam brahmāṇi gira indra tubhyaṃ satrā dadhire harivo juṣasva /
analyzed: tubhyam brahmāṇi giraḥ indra tubhyam satrā dadhire harivas juṣasva
translated: To thee, O Indra, the prayers and the songs, the Brahmans have ever appointed, O thou of tawny steeds; accept them.

original: bodhy āpir avaso nūtanasya sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyo vayo dhāḥ //
analyzed: bodhi āpiḥ avasaḥ nūtanasya sakhe vaso jaritṛbhyaḥ vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Be thou awake, O friend, to the new and recent favour; bestow life upon the singers, O good one.

original: indra marutva iha pāhi somaṃ yathā śāryāte apibaḥ sutasya /
analyzed: indra marutvas iha pāhi somam yathā śāryāte apibaḥ sutasya
translated: Indra, with the Maruts, here drink the Soma as thou didst the juice of the pressed (Soma) with the Saryyas.

original: tava praṇītī tava śūra śarmann ā vivāsanti kavayaḥ suyajñāḥ //
analyzed: tava praṇītī tava śūra śarman ā vivāsanti kavayaḥ su yajñāḥ
translated: Through thy favour, O hero, the wise, the well-sacrificing ones, come to the light.

original: sa vāvaśāna iha pāhi somam marudbhir indra sakhibhiḥ sutaṃ naḥ /
analyzed: sa vāvaśānaḥ iha pāhi somam marudbhiḥ indra sakhibhiḥ sutam naḥ
translated: Do thou, being pleased here, O Indra, drink the Soma with the Maruts, with thy friends, with us,

original: jātaṃ yat tvā pari devā abhūṣan mahe bharāya puruhūta viśve //
analyzed: jātam yat tvā pari devāḥ abhūṣan mahe bharāya puruhūta viśve
translated: Since all the gods have made thee, O much-invoked one, for the great burden (of the sacrifice), as soon as thou wast born.

original: aptūrye maruta āpir eṣo 'mandann indram anu dātivārāḥ /
analyzed: aptūrye marutaḥ āpiḥ eṣaḥ mandan indram anu dāti vārāḥ
translated: The Maruts, the swift ones, the impetuous ones, have gladdened Indra, the protector from injury.

original: tebhiḥ sākam pibatu vṛtrakhādaḥ sutaṃ somaṃ dāśuṣaḥ sve sadhasthe //
analyzed: tebhiḥ sākam pibatu vṛtra khādaḥ sutam somam dāśuṣaḥ sve sadhasthe
translated: With them may he who slays Vrtra drink the pressed Soma of the worshipper in his own abode.

original: idaṃ hy anv ojasā sutaṃ rādhānām pate /
analyzed: idam hi anu ojasā sutam rādhānām pate
translated: For this (Soma) hath been pressed with strength, O lord of bounty.

original: pibā tv asya girvaṇaḥ //
analyzed: pibā tu asya girvaṇaḥ
translated: Drink thou of it, O thou who lovest the song.

original: yas te anu svadhām asat sute ni yaccha tanvam /
analyzed: yaḥ te anu svadhām asat sute ni yaccha tanvam
translated: He who shall follow thy will in the pressed (Soma), direct thou his body.

original: sa tvā mamattu somyam //🔽pra te aśnotu kukṣyoḥ prendra brahmaṇā śiraḥ /
analyzed: sa tvā mamattu somyam  pra te aśnotu kukṣyoḥ pra indra brahmaṇā śiraḥ
translated: May he delight in thy most gladdening (Soma).🔽Let thy belly be filled, O Indra, let thy head be filled with prayer,

original: pra bāhū śūra rādhase //
analyzed: pra bāhū śūra rādhase
translated: O hero, let thy arms be filled for bounty.

original: dhānāvantaṃ karambhiṇam apūpavantam ukthinam /🔽indra prātar juṣasva naḥ //
analyzed: dhānāvantam karambhiṇam apūpavantam ukthinam  indra prātar juṣasva naḥ
translated: Rich in curds, in clotted curds, in cakes, in hymns,🔽O Indra, be pleased with us in the morning.

original: puroḷāśam pacatyaṃ juṣasvendrā gurasva ca /
analyzed: puroḷāśam pacatyam juṣasva indra ā gurasva ca
translated: Be pleased with the cake that is being baked, O Indra, and be satisfied.

original: tubhyaṃ havyāni sisrate //
analyzed: tubhyam havyāni sisrate
translated: To thee are offered up the sacrificial gifts.

original: puroḷāśaṃ ca no ghaso joṣayāse giraś ca naḥ /
analyzed: puroḷāśam ca naḥ ghasaḥ joṣayāse giraḥ ca naḥ
translated: Accept our cake and our food, and our songs,

original: vadhūyur iva yoṣaṇām //🔽puroḷāśaṃ sanaśruta prātaḥsāve juṣasva naḥ /
analyzed: vadhūyuḥ iva yoṣaṇām  puroḷāśam sana śruta prātaḥsāve juṣasva naḥ
translated: As a bridegroom receives a young woman.🔽O Indra, of good hearing, be pleased with our cake at the morning pressing,

original: indra kratur hi te bṛhan //🔽mādhyandinasya savanasya dhānāḥ puroḷāśam indra kṛṣveha cārum /
analyzed: indra kratuḥ hi te bṛhan  mādhyandinasya savanasya dhānāḥ puroḷāśam indra kṛṣva iha cārum
translated: For thy power is great.🔽At the midday pressing, O Indra, enjoy here the grains and the beautiful cake,

original: pra yat stotā jaritā tūrṇyartho vṛṣāyamāṇa upa gīrbhir īṭṭe //
analyzed: pra yat stotā jaritā tūrṇi arthaḥ vṛṣāyamāṇaḥ upa gīrbhiḥ īṭṭe
translated: When the praising singer, swift in purpose, like a bull, is urged on with songs.

original: tṛtīye dhānāḥ savane puruṣṭuta puroḷāśam āhutam māmahasva naḥ /
analyzed: tṛtīye dhānāḥ savane puruṣṭuta puroḷāśam āhutam māmahasva naḥ
translated: At the third pressing, O much-praised one, enjoy the cake offered with grains.

original: ṛbhumantaṃ vājavantaṃ tvā kave prayasvanta upa śikṣema dhītibhiḥ //
analyzed: ṛbhumantam vājavantam tvā kave prayasvantaḥ upa śikṣema dhītibhiḥ
translated: O wise one, with the Rbhus and the Vājas, we will approach you with our thoughts.

original: pūṣaṇvate te cakṛmā karambhaṃ harivate haryaśvāya dhānāḥ /
analyzed: pūṣaṇvate te cakṛma karambham harivate haryaśvāya dhānāḥ
translated: We have made a mess for you, for Pūṣan, for the one with tawny horses, grains for the one with tawny horses.

original: apūpam addhi sagaṇo marudbhiḥ somam piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān //
analyzed: apūpam addhi sa gaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ somam piba vṛtrahā śūra vidvān
translated: Eat the cake, together with the Maruts, drink the Soma, O Vṛtra-killer, O wise one.

original: prati dhānā bharata tūyam asmai puroḷāśaṃ vīratamāya nṛṇām /
analyzed: prati dhānāḥ bharata tūyam asmai puroḷāśam vīratamāya nṛṇām
translated: Bring the grains to him, the cake to the most manly of men.

original: divedive sadṛśīr indra tubhyaṃ vardhantu tvā somapeyāya dhṛṣṇo //
analyzed: dive dive sadṛśīḥ indra tubhyam vardhantu tvā soma peyāya dhṛṣṇo
translated: Day by day, O Indra, may the equal ones increase for you, to make you drink Soma, O bold one.

original: indrāparvatā bṛhatā rathena vāmīr iṣa ā vahataṃ suvīrāḥ /
analyzed: indrāparvatā bṛhatā rathena vāmīḥ iṣaḥ ā vahatam su vīrāḥ
translated: Indra and Parvata, with your great chariot, bring hitherward, with heroes, strengthening food.

original: vītaṃ havyāny adhvareṣu devā vardhethāṃ gīrbhir iḷayā madantā //
analyzed: vītam havyāni adhvareṣu devā vardhethām gīrbhiḥ iḷayā madantā
translated: Accept the offered gifts at our sacrifices, O Gods, increase by our songs, rejoicing in them.

original: tiṣṭhā su kam maghavan mā parā gāḥ somasya nu tvā suṣutasya yakṣi /
analyzed: tiṣṭhā su kam maghavan mā parā gāḥ somasya nu tvā suṣutasya yakṣi
translated: Stay, O bountiful one, go not away: I will serve thee with the well-pressed Soma juice.

original: pitur na putraḥ sicam ā rabhe ta indra svādiṣṭhayā girā śacīvaḥ //🔽śaṃsāvādhvaryo prati me gṛṇīhīndrāya vāhaḥ kṛṇavāva juṣṭam /
analyzed: pituḥ na putraḥ sicam ā rabhe te indra svādiṣṭhayā girā śacīvas  śaṃsāva adhvaryo prati me gṛṇīhi indrāya vāhaḥ kṛṇavāva juṣṭam
translated: I take hold of thy robe, as a son of his father, O Indra, with the sweetest song, O mighty one.🔽Praise, O Adhvaryu, and respond to me: let us make offering acceptable to Indra.

original: edam barhir yajamānasya sīdāthā ca bhūd uktham indrāya śastam //
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ yajamānasya sīda athā ca bhūt uktham indrāya śastam
translated: Sit on this grass, O Sacrificer, and let the hymn be made ready for Indra.

original: jāyed astam maghavan sed u yonis tad it tvā yuktā harayo vahantu /
analyzed: jāyā id astam maghavan sā id u yoniḥ tat id tvā yuktāḥ harayaḥ vahantu
translated: Let it be a place of birth, O bountiful one, and a place of rest: let thy well-yoked bays carry thee hither.

original: yadā kadā ca sunavāma somam agniṣ ṭvā dūto dhanvāty accha //
analyzed: yadā kadā ca sunavāma somam agniḥ tvā dūtaḥ dhanvāti accha
translated: Whenever we press the Soma, let Agni, thy messenger, come to thee from the distance.

original: parā yāhi maghavann ā ca yāhīndra bhrātar ubhayatrā te artham /
analyzed: parā yāhi maghavan ā ca yāhi indra bhrātar ubhayatrā te artham
translated: Go away, O bountiful one, and come hither: O Indra, O brother, thy business is on both sides.

original: yatrā rathasya bṛhato nidhānaṃ vimocanaṃ vājino rāsabhasya //
analyzed: yatrā rathasya bṛhataḥ nidhānam vimocanam vājinaḥ rāsabhasya
translated: Where is the resting-place of the great chariot, the unyoking of the strong ass and horse.

original: apāḥ somam astam indra pra yāhi kalyāṇīr jāyā suraṇaṃ gṛhe te /
analyzed: apāḥ somam astam indra pra yāhi kalyāṇīḥ jāyā suraṇam gṛhe te
translated: Drink the Soma, O Indra, and come hither: thy wife is fair, thy joy is in the house.

original: yatrā rathasya bṛhato nidhānaṃ vimocanaṃ vājino dakṣiṇāvat //
analyzed: yatrā rathasya bṛhataḥ nidhānam vimocanam vājinaḥ dakṣiṇāvat
translated: Where is the resting-place of the great chariot, the release of the horse, with the Dakshina.

original: ime bhojā aṅgiraso virūpā divas putrāso asurasya vīrāḥ /
analyzed: ime bhojāḥ aṅgirasaḥ virūpāḥ divaḥ putrāsaḥ asurasya vīrāḥ
translated: These Bhoja Angirasas, of various forms, the sons of heaven, the heroes of the Asura,

original: viśvāmitrāya dadato maghāni sahasrasāve pra tiranta āyuḥ //
analyzed: viśvāmitrāya dadataḥ maghāni sahasrasāve pra tirante āyuḥ
translated: Giving to Vishvamitra his boons, they prolong his life, he who wins a thousand.

original: rūpaṃrūpam maghavā bobhavīti māyāḥ kṛṇvānas tanvam pari svām /
analyzed: rūpam rūpam maghavā bobhavīti māyāḥ kṛṇvānaḥ tanvam pari svām
translated: Maghavan shines forth in every form, creating illusions, surrounding his own body,

original: trir yad divaḥ pari muhūrtam āgāt svair mantrair anṛtupā ṛtāvā //
analyzed: tris yat divaḥ pari muhūrtam āgāt svaiḥ mantraiḥ anṛtu pāḥ ṛtāvā
translated: When he comes thrice in a moment round the heaven, he who knows the seasons, with his own hymns.

original: mahāṃ ṛṣir devajā devajūto 'stabhnāt sindhum arṇavaṃ nṛcakṣāḥ /
analyzed: mahān ṛṣiḥ deva jāḥ deva jūtaḥ stabhnāt sindhum arṇavam nṛ cakṣāḥ
translated: The great Rishi, born of the gods, inspired by the gods, who looks on men, has established the ocean and the flood.

original: viśvāmitro yad avahat sudāsam apriyāyata kuśikebhir indraḥ //
analyzed: viśvāmitraḥ yat avahat sudāsam apriyāyata kuśikebhiḥ indraḥ
translated: When Vishvamitra brought Sudasa to the Apsarases, Indra was angry with the Kushikas.

original: haṃsā iva kṛṇutha ślokam adribhir madanto gīrbhir adhvare sute sacā /
analyzed: haṃsāḥ iva kṛṇutha ślokam adribhiḥ madantaḥ gīrbhiḥ adhvare sute sacā
translated: Like swans ye make a song with the stones, rejoicing with the songs at the sacrifice, together with the pressed (Soma).

original: devebhir viprā ṛṣayo nṛcakṣaso vi pibadhvaṃ kuśikāḥ somyam madhu //
analyzed: devebhiḥ viprāḥ ṛṣayaḥ nṛ cakṣasaḥ vi pibadhvam kuśikāḥ somyam madhu
translated: With the gods, O sages, the Rishis, who look on men, do ye drink the sweet Soma, O Kushikas.

original: upa preta kuśikāś cetayadhvam aśvaṃ rāye pra muñcatā sudāsaḥ /
analyzed: upa preta kuśikāḥ cetayadhvam aśvam rāye pra muñcata sudāsaḥ
translated: Go forward, O Kushikas, bethink you; let Sudasa set the horse free for wealth.

original: rājā vṛtraṃ jaṅghanat prāg apāg udag athā yajāte vara ā pṛthivyāḥ //
analyzed: rājā vṛtram jaṅghanat prāk apāk udak athā yajāte vare ā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The king has slain Vritra, east, west, north, and now has sacrificed on the best of the earth.

original: ya ime rodasī ubhe aham indram atuṣṭavam /🔽viśvāmitrasya rakṣati brahmedam bhārataṃ janam //
analyzed: yaḥ ime rodasī ubhe aham indram atuṣṭavam  viśvāmitrasya rakṣati brahma idam bhāratam janam
translated: I have praised Indra, who is the protector of both these worlds,🔽This Brahman of Vishvamitra protects this Bharata people.

original: viśvāmitrā arāsata brahmendrāya vajriṇe /
analyzed: viśvāmitrāḥ arāsata brahma indrāya vajriṇe
translated: The Vishvamitras have offered this Brahman to Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: karad in naḥ surādhasaḥ //
analyzed: karat id naḥ su rādhasaḥ
translated: May he make us possessors of good gifts.

original: kiṃ te kṛṇvanti kīkaṭeṣu gāvo nāśiraṃ duhre na tapanti gharmam /🔽ā no bhara pramagandasya vedo naicāśākham maghavan randhayā naḥ //
analyzed: kim te kṛṇvanti kīkaṭeṣu gāvaḥ na āśiram duhre na tapanti gharmam  ā naḥ bhara pramagandasya vedaḥ naicāśākham maghavan randhaya naḥ
translated: What do they do with the cows in the villages? They do not milk the barren cow, nor do they heat the cauldron.🔽Bring us the treasure of Pramaganda, O Maghavan, and open for us the low-hanging (treasure).

original: sasarparīr amatim bādhamānā bṛhan mimāya jamadagnidattā /
analyzed: sasarparīḥ amatim bādhamānā bṛhat mimāya jamadagni dattā
translated: The great (treasure), given by Jamadagni, has spread out, overcoming the niggardliness (of the miser).

original: ā sūryasya duhitā tatāna śravo deveṣv amṛtam ajuryam //
analyzed: ā sūryasya duhitā tatāna śravaḥ deveṣu amṛtam ajuryam
translated: The daughter of the sun has stretched out fame among the gods, the immortal, undecaying (treasure).

original: sasarparīr abharat tūyam ebhyo 'dhi śravaḥ pāñcajanyāsu kṛṣṭiṣu /
analyzed: sasarparīḥ abharat tūyam ebhyaḥ dhi śravaḥ pāñcajanyāsu kṛṣṭiṣu
translated: The (treasure) has quickly brought to these (men) fame among the five peoples of the cultivated lands.

original: sā pakṣyā navyam āyur dadhānā yām me palastijamadagnayo daduḥ //
analyzed: sā pakṣyā navyam āyuḥ dadhānā yām me palasti jamadagnayaḥ daduḥ
translated: (May it bring) the bird (the eagle) the new life which the sons of Jamadagni, the sons of Pulasti, have given to me.

original: sthirau gāvau bhavatāṃ vīḷur akṣo meṣā vi varhi mā yugaṃ vi śāri /
analyzed: sthirau gāvau bhavatām vīḍuḥ akṣaḥ mā iṣā vi varhi mā yugam vi śāri
translated: Be firm, O cows, be firm, O axle, be firm, O sheep, let not the yoke be loosened.

original: indraḥ pātalye dadatāṃ śarītor ariṣṭaneme abhi naḥ sacasva //
analyzed: indraḥ pātalye dadatām śarītoḥ ariṣṭa neme abhi naḥ sacasva
translated: O Indra, be the protector of the giver of the gift, be with us for the journey without mishap.

original: balaṃ dhehi tanūṣu no balam indrānaḷutsu naḥ /
analyzed: balam dhehi tanūṣu naḥ balam indra anaḷutsu naḥ
translated: Bestow strength upon our bodies, strength, O Indra, upon our horses.

original: balaṃ tokāya tanayāya jīvase tvaṃ hi baladā asi //
analyzed: balam tokāya tanayāya jīvase tvam hi bala dāḥ asi
translated: Bestow strength upon our sons and grandsons for life, for thou art the giver of strength.

original: abhi vyayasva khadirasya sāram ojo dhehi spandane śiṃśapāyām /
analyzed: abhi vyayasva khadirasya sāram ojaḥ dhehi spandane śiṃśapāyām
translated: Pass through the heartwood of the Khadira, bestow strength in the trembling of the Shimshapa.

original: akṣa vīḷo vīḷita vīḷayasva mā yāmād asmād ava jīhipo naḥ //
analyzed: akṣa vīḷo vīḍita vīḍayasva mā yāmāt asmāt ava jīhipaḥ naḥ
translated: O axle, creak, creak, creak, do not break from this yoke of ours.

original: ayam asmān vanaspatir mā ca hā mā ca rīriṣat /
analyzed: ayam asmān vanaspatiḥ mā ca hāḥ mā ca rīriṣat
translated: Let this lord of the forest neither harm us nor injure us.

original: svasty ā gṛhebhya āvasā ā vimocanāt //
analyzed: svasti ā gṛhebhyaḥ āvasā ā vimocanāt
translated: May he be for our welfare in our houses, in our dwelling, in our release.

original: indrotibhir bahulābhir no adya yācchreṣṭhābhir maghavañ chūra jinva /
analyzed: indra ūtibhiḥ bahulābhiḥ naḥ adya yācchreṣṭhābhiḥ maghavan śūra jinva
translated: With many abundant powers, O Indra, come to us today, O bountiful one, O hero, invigorate us.

original: yo no dveṣṭy adharaḥ sas padīṣṭa yam u dviṣmas tam u prāṇo jahātu //
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ dveṣṭi adharaḥ sas padīṣṭa yam u dviṣmaḥ tam u prāṇaḥ jahātu
translated: Let him who hates us be below, let him whom we hate be deprived of breath.

original: paraśuṃ cid vi tapati śimbalaṃ cid vi vṛścati /
analyzed: paraśum cit vi tapati śimbalam cit vi vṛścati
translated: He splits even the axe, he breaks even the wedge.

original: ukhā cid indra yeṣantī prayastā phenam asyati //🔽na sāyakasya cikite janāso lodhaṃ nayanti paśu manyamānāḥ /
analyzed: ukhā cit indra yeṣantī prayastā phenam asyati  na sāyakasya cikite janāsaḥ lodham nayanti paśu manyamānāḥ
translated: Even the cauldron, O Indra, when heated, throws out foam.🔽The people do not heed the arrow. They lead away the ass, thinking it a beast.

original: nāvājinaṃ vājinā hāsayanti na gardabham puro aśvān nayanti //
analyzed: na a vājinam vājinā hāsayanti na gardabham puras aśvāt nayanti
translated: They do not lead the swift one to the race, they lead the asses in front of the horses.

original: ima indra bharatasya putrā apapitvaṃ cikitur na prapitvam /
analyzed: ime indra bharatasya putrāḥ apapitvam cikituḥ na prapitvam
translated: These sons of Bharata, O Indra, have not sought thy favour as their father did.

original: hinvanty aśvam araṇaṃ na nityaṃ jyāvājam pari ṇayanty ājau //
analyzed: hinvanti aśvam araṇam na nityam jyā vājam pari nayanti ājau
translated: They urge the horse to the battle as to the water, they lead him to the fight, the strong, the ever-victorious.

original: imam mahe vidathyāya śūṣaṃ śaśvat kṛtva īḍyāya pra jabhruḥ /
analyzed: imam mahe vidathyāya śūṣam śaśvat kṛtvas īḍyāya pra jabhruḥ
translated: To this great hero, worthy of the assembly, they have ever sent forth this praiseworthy strength.

original: śṛṇotu no damyebhir anīkaiḥ śṛṇotv agnir divyair ajasraḥ //
analyzed: śṛṇotu naḥ damyebhiḥ anīkaiḥ śṛṇotu agniḥ divyaiḥ ajasraḥ
translated: May he hear us with his armies of the Dasyus, may Agni hear us with his armies of the gods, the everlasting one.

original: mahi mahe dive arcā pṛthivyai kāmo ma icchañ carati prajānan /
analyzed: mahi mahe dive arcā pṛthivyai kāmaḥ me iccham carati prajānan
translated: To the great heaven and earth I offer praise. My desire, knowing, moves, seeking to obtain.

original: yayor ha stome vidatheṣu devāḥ saparyavo mādayante sacāyoḥ //
analyzed: yayoḥ ha stome vidatheṣu devāḥ saparyavaḥ mādayante sacā ayoḥ
translated: In whose praise the gods in the assemblies rejoice, in the praise of the two who are to be served together.

original: yuvor ṛtaṃ rodasī satyam astu mahe ṣu ṇaḥ suvitāya pra bhūtam /
analyzed: yuvoḥ ṛtam rodasī satyam astu mahe su naḥ suvitāya pra bhūtam
translated: Let your truth and your law, O heaven and earth, be great for our prosperity.

original: idaṃ dive namo agne pṛthivyai saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam //
analyzed: idam dive namaḥ agne pṛthivyai saparyāmi prayasā yāmi ratnam
translated: To heaven and to earth, O Agni, I offer this worship. With prayer I go to obtain the treasure.

original: uto hi vām pūrvyā āvividra ṛtāvarī rodasī satyavācaḥ /
analyzed: uta u hi vām pūrvyāḥ āvividre ṛtāvarī rodasī satyavācaḥ
translated: For you, O ancient ones, the true, the righteous, the two worlds, have been opened by the truthful.

original: naraś cid vāṃ samithe śūrasātau vavandire pṛthivi vevidānāḥ //
analyzed: naraḥ cit vām samithe śūrasātau vavandire pṛthivi vevidānāḥ
translated: Even the men, seeking, have bowed to you in the assembly, O earth, in the contest for the hero's prize.

original: ko addhā veda ka iha pra vocad devāṃ acchā pathyā kā sam eti /
analyzed: kaḥ addhā veda kaḥ iha pra vocat devān acchā pathyā kā sam eti
translated: Who indeed knows, who here can tell, the gods who come to the sacrifice, who go to the meeting?

original: dadṛśra eṣām avamā sadāṃsi pareṣu yā guhyeṣu vrateṣu //🔽kavir nṛcakṣā abhi ṣīm acaṣṭa ṛtasya yonā vighṛte madantī /
analyzed: dadṛśre eṣām avamā sadāṃsi pareṣu yā guhyeṣu vrateṣu  kaviḥ nṛ cakṣāḥ abhi sīm acaṣṭa ṛtasya yonā vighṛte madantī
translated: They saw their lowest-lying places, those which are among the others, in their secret rites.🔽The wise one, looking on men, has beheld these two, rejoicing in the womb of truth, in the churn.

original: nānā cakrāte sadanaṃ yathā veḥ samānena kratunā saṃvidāne //
analyzed: nānā cakrāte sadanam yathā veḥ samānena kratunā saṃvidāne
translated: They have made a seat unlike a bird's, with a common purpose, agreeing in a single plan.

original: samānyā viyute dūreante dhruve pade tasthatur jāgarūke /
analyzed: samānyā viyute dūreante dhruve pade tasthatuḥ jāgarūke
translated: In a common place, far apart, they stand, firm, watchful.

original: uta svasārā yuvatī bhavantī ād u bruvāte mithunāni nāma //
analyzed: uta svasārā yuvatī bhavantī āt u bruvāte mithunāni nāma
translated: And they, the sisters, become young maidens, and then they call each other by their names.

original: viśved ete janimā saṃ vivikto maho devān bibhratī na vyathete /
analyzed: viśvā id ete janimā sam viviktaḥ mahaḥ devān bibhratī na vyathete
translated: All these are born, well-separated, bearing the great gods, and are not shaken.

original: ejad dhruvam patyate viśvam ekaṃ carat patatri viṣuṇaṃ vi jātam //
analyzed: ejat dhruvam patyate viśvam ekam carat patatri viṣuṇam vi jātam
translated: The moving one moves over the firm, the one, the moving bird spreads out the born.

original: sanā purāṇam adhy emy ārān mahaḥ pitur janitur jāmi tan naḥ /
analyzed: sanā purāṇam adhi emi ārāt mahaḥ pituḥ janituḥ jāmi tat naḥ
translated: I go to that ancient, ancient, firm, near kinsman of the great father, the progenitor.

original: devāso yatra panitāra evair urau pathi vyute tasthur antaḥ //
analyzed: devāsaḥ yatra panitāraḥ evaiḥ urau pathi vyute tasthuḥ antar
translated: Where the gods, the dispensers, stand in the wide, open, well-made path.

original: imaṃ stomaṃ rodasī pra bravīmy ṛdūdarāḥ śṛṇavann agnijihvāḥ /
analyzed: imam stomam rodasī pra bravīmi ṛdūdarāḥ śṛṇavan agni jihvāḥ
translated: This hymn I utter to the two world-halves: may the two, with kindly hearts, hear Agni's tongue.

original: mitraḥ samrājo varuṇo yuvāna ādityāsaḥ kavayaḥ paprathānāḥ //
analyzed: mitraḥ samrājaḥ varuṇaḥ yuvānaḥ ādityāsaḥ kavayaḥ paprathānāḥ
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, the young, the great Ādityas, the wise, the far-spread,🔽hear this hymn.

original: hiraṇyapāṇiḥ savitā sujihvas trir ā divo vidathe patyamānaḥ /🔽deveṣu ca savitaḥ ślokam aśrer ād asmabhyam ā suva sarvatātim //
analyzed: hiraṇya pāṇiḥ savitā su jihvaḥ tris ā divaḥ vidathe patyamānaḥ  deveṣu ca savitar ślokam aśreḥ āt asmabhyam ā suva sarvatātim
translated: Savitar, with golden hands, with fair tongue, thrice in the day, ruling in the assembly,🔽And, Savitar, in the company of the Gods, hath raised his voice. Do thou grant us all prosperity.

original: sukṛt supāṇiḥ svavāṃ ṛtāvā devas tvaṣṭāvase tāni no dhāt /
analyzed: su kṛt su pāṇiḥ svavān ṛtāvā devaḥ tvaṣṭā avase tāni naḥ dhāt
translated: The God Tvashtar, the well-handed, the good worker, the good-speeched, may he grant us those things.
