original: pūṣaṇvanta ṛbhavo mādayadhvam ūrdhvagrāvāṇo adhvaram ataṣṭa //
analyzed: pūṣaṇvantaḥ ṛbhavaḥ mādayadhvam ūrdhva grāvāṇaḥ adhvaram ataṣṭa
translated: Ye R̥ibhus, rejoice with Pûshan. Ye have made the sacrifice with the stone uplifted.

original: vidyudrathā maruta ṛṣṭimanto divo maryā ṛtajātā ayāsaḥ /
analyzed: vidyut rathāḥ marutaḥ ṛṣṭimantaḥ divaḥ maryāḥ ṛta jātāḥ ayāsaḥ
translated: Ye Maruts, born of holy law, of rapid course, with lightning for your cars, with swords, the boundary of heaven,

original: sarasvatī śṛṇavan yajñiyāso dhātā rayiṃ sahavīraṃ turāsaḥ //
analyzed: sarasvatī śṛṇavan yajñiyāsaḥ dhāta rayim saha vīram turāsaḥ
translated: Sarasvatî, and the Yajñiyas, and the swift Dhatar have granted wealth with heroes.

original: viṣṇuṃ stomāsaḥ purudasmam arkā bhagasyeva kāriṇo yāmani gman /
analyzed: viṣṇum stomāsaḥ puru dasmam arkāḥ bhagasya iva kāriṇaḥ yāmani gman
translated: The hymns of praise, the ancient, have extolled Vishnu, the bountiful, as singers reach the goal of Bhaga.

original: urukramaḥ kakuho yasya pūrvīr na mardhanti yuvatayo janitrīḥ //🔽indro viśvair vīryaiḥ patyamāna ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā /
analyzed: uru kramaḥ kakuhaḥ yasya pūrvīḥ na mardhanti yuvatayaḥ janitrīḥ  indraḥ viśvaiḥ vīryaiḥ patyamānaḥ ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā
translated: The many young maidens, his mothers, do not hinder the far-striding, the lofty one.🔽Indra, with all his powers, ruling, hath filled the two world-halves with his greatness.

original: purandaro vṛtrahā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇaḥ saṃgṛbhyā na ā bharā bhūri paśvaḥ //
analyzed: purandaraḥ vṛtra hā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇaḥ saṃgṛbhyā naḥ ā bhara bhūri paśvaḥ
translated: The breaker of forts, the Vr̥itra-slayer, the bold and mighty one, having grasped, bring thou to us much cattle.

original: nāsatyā me pitarā bandhupṛcchā sajātyam aśvinoś cāru nāma /
analyzed: nāsatyā me pitarā bandhu pṛcchā sajātyam aśvinoḥ cāru nāma
translated: The two Nâsatyas are my parents, to be asked about kindred. The Aṣvins' is a lovely name.

original: yuvaṃ hi stho rayidau no rayīṇāṃ dātraṃ rakṣethe akavair adabdhā //
analyzed: yuvam hi sthaḥ rayi dau naḥ rayīṇām dātram rakṣethe akavaiḥ adabdhā
translated: For ye two are the givers of our wealth, the guardians of our riches, ye guileless ones.

original: mahat tad vaḥ kavayaś cāru nāma yad dha devā bhavatha viśva indre /
analyzed: mahat tat vaḥ kavayaḥ cāru nāma yat ha devāḥ bhavatha viśve indre
translated: That is your great and lovely name, O ye wise ones, when ye all become gods in Indra.

original: sakha ṛbhubhiḥ puruhūta priyebhir imāṃ dhiyaṃ sātaye takṣatā naḥ //
analyzed: sakhaḥ ṛbhubhiḥ puruhūta priyebhiḥ imām dhiyam sātaye takṣata naḥ
translated: O much-invoked one, with the Rbhus who are dear to thee, fashion this thought for our gain.

original: aryamā ṇo aditir yajñiyāso 'dabdhāni varuṇasya vratāni /
analyzed: aryamā naḥ aditiḥ yajñiyāsaḥ dabdhāni varuṇasya vratāni
translated: Aryaman, Aditi, worthy of sacrifice, the inviolate ordinances of Varuna,

original: yuyota no anapatyāni gantoḥ prajāvān naḥ paśumāṃ astu gātuḥ //
analyzed: yuyota naḥ anapatyāni gantoḥ prajāvān naḥ paśumān astu gātuḥ
translated: Keep us from childlessness, O ye twain, and let our way be rich in children and in cattle.

original: devānāṃ dūtaḥ purudha prasūto 'nāgān no vocatu sarvatātā /
analyzed: devānām dūtaḥ purudha prasūtaḥ nāgān naḥ vocatu sarvatātā
translated: The messenger of the gods, much impelled, speak to us who have not come to all the quarters.

original: śṛṇotu naḥ pṛthivī dyaur utāpaḥ sūryo nakṣatrair urv antarikṣam //
analyzed: śṛṇotu naḥ pṛthivī dyauḥ uta āpaḥ sūryaḥ nakṣatraiḥ uru antarikṣam
translated: May the earth, the sky, the waters, the sun, the stars, and the wide air listen to us.

original: śṛṇvantu no vṛṣaṇaḥ parvatāso dhruvakṣemāsa iḷayā madantaḥ /
analyzed: śṛṇvantu naḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ parvatāsaḥ dhruva kṣemāsaḥ iḷayā madantaḥ
translated: May the mighty mountains, whose abode is firm, rejoicing in their strength, listen to us.

original: ādityair no aditiḥ śṛṇotu yacchantu no marutaḥ śarma bhadram //
analyzed: ādityaiḥ naḥ aditiḥ śṛṇotu yacchantu naḥ marutaḥ śarma bhadram
translated: May Aditi listen to us with the Adityas; may the Maruts grant us auspicious protection.

original: sadā sugaḥ pitumāṃ astu panthā madhvā devā oṣadhīḥ sam pipṛkta /
analyzed: sadā su gaḥ pitumān astu panthāḥ madhvā devāḥ oṣadhīḥ sam pipṛkta
translated: May the path to our father be ever easy; may the gods mix the plants with sweetness.

original: bhago me agne sakhye na mṛdhyā ud rāyo aśyāṃ sadanam purukṣoḥ //
analyzed: bhagaḥ me agne sakhye na mṛdhyāḥ ud rāyaḥ aśyām sadanam purukṣoḥ
translated: May Bhaga, O Agni, in friendship not slight me; may I attain the abode of the mighty one.

original: svadasva havyā sam iṣo didīhy asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi /
analyzed: svadasva havyā sam iṣaḥ didīhi asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi
translated: Delight in our offerings, shine forth with food, measure out glories for us here.

original: viśvāṃ agne pṛtsu tāñ jeṣi śatrūn ahā viśvā sumanā dīdihī naḥ //
analyzed: viśvām agne pṛtsu tām jeṣi śatrūn ahā viśvā sumanāḥ dīdihi naḥ
translated: In all battles, O Agni, thou shalt conquer these foes: be gracious to us in all things, shine.

original: uṣasaḥ pūrvā adha yad vyūṣur mahad vi jajñe akṣaram pade goḥ /
analyzed: uṣasaḥ pūrvāḥ adha yat vyūṣuḥ mahat vi jajñe akṣaram pade goḥ
translated: When the first dawns have departed, a great imperishable thing is born in the place of the cow.

original: vratā devānām upa nu prabhūṣan mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: vratā devānām upa nu prabhūṣan mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: The laws of the gods are increased in the presence of the great one godhead of the Asuras.

original: mo ṣū ṇo atra juhuranta devā mā pūrve agne pitaraḥ padajñāḥ /
analyzed: mā u su naḥ atra juhuranta devāḥ mā pūrve agne pitaraḥ pada jñāḥ
translated: Do the gods here offer to us, O Agni, do the ancient fathers who know the place.

original: purāṇyoḥ sadmanoḥ ketur antar mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: purāṇyoḥ sadmanoḥ ketuḥ antar mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: The sign of the two ancient abodes, the great one godhead of the Asuras.

original: vi me purutrā patayanti kāmāḥ śamy acchā dīdye pūrvyāṇi /
analyzed: vi me purutrā patayanti kāmāḥ śamī acchā dīdye pūrvyāṇi
translated: My desires fly in many directions, I shine with the ancient ones, I am appeased.

original: samiddhe agnāv ṛtam id vadema mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: samiddhe agnau ṛtam id vadema mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: Let us speak the truth in the well-kindled fire, the great one godhead of the Asuras.

original: samāno rājā vibhṛtaḥ purutrā śaye śayāsu prayuto vanānu /
analyzed: samānaḥ rājā vibhṛtaḥ purutrā śaye śayāsu prayutaḥ vanā anu
translated: The common king is distributed in many places, lying in the beds, yoked to the woods.

original: anyā vatsam bharati kṣeti mātā mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: anyā vatsam bharati kṣeti mātā mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: Another bears the calf, the mother rests, the great one godhead of the Asuras.

original: ākṣit pūrvāsv aparā anūrut sadyo jātāsu taruṇīṣv antaḥ /
analyzed: ākṣit pūrvāsu aparāḥ anūrudh sadyas jātāsu taruṇīṣu antar
translated: The former have not seen, the latter have not run, in the very young, the young, in the middle.

original: antarvatīḥ suvate apravītā mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: antarvatīḥ suvate a pravītāḥ mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: The fruitful one brings forth the unborn, the great one is the gods' sole lordship of the Asuras.

original: śayuḥ parastād adha nu dvimātābandhanaś carati vatsa ekaḥ /
analyzed: śayuḥ parastāt adha nu dvi mātā bandhanaḥ carati vatsaḥ ekaḥ
translated: The ewe is beyond, and now the two-mothered bond moves as the sole calf.

original: mitrasya tā varuṇasya vratāni mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: mitrasya tā varuṇasya vratāni mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: Those are the laws of Mitra and Varuna, the great one is the gods' sole lordship of the Asuras.

original: dvimātā hotā vidatheṣu samrāḷ anv agraṃ carati kṣeti budhnaḥ /
analyzed: dvi mātā hotā vidatheṣu samrāj anu agram carati kṣeti budhnaḥ
translated: The two-mothered Hotar is the sovereign in the sacrifices, he moves in front and rests in the foundation.

original: pra raṇyāni raṇyavāco bharante mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: pra raṇyāni raṇya vācaḥ bharante mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: The lovely ones bring lovely words, the great one is the gods' sole lordship of the Asuras.

original: śūrasyeva yudhyato antamasya pratīcīnaṃ dadṛśe viśvam āyat /
analyzed: śūrasya iva yudhyataḥ antamasya pratīcīnam dadṛśe viśvam āyat
translated: The end of the fighting hero is seen to be far away, all is extended.

original: antar matiś carati niṣṣidhaṃ gor mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: antar matiḥ carati niṣṣidham goḥ mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: The thought moves within the cow's enclosure, the great one is the gods' sole lordship of the Asuras.

original: ni veveti palito dūta āsv antar mahāṃś carati rocanena /
analyzed: ni veveti palitaḥ dūtaḥ āsu antar mahān carati rocanena
translated: The grey-haired messenger moves among the houses, the great one moves within with radiance.

original: vapūṃṣi bibhrad abhi no vi caṣṭe mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: vapūṃṣi bibhrat abhi naḥ vi caṣṭe mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: Bearing forms, he looks upon us, the great one is the gods' sole lordship of the Asuras.

original: viṣṇur gopāḥ paramam pāti pāthaḥ priyā dhāmāny amṛtā dadhānaḥ /
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ gopāḥ paramam pāti pāthaḥ priyā dhāmāni amṛtā dadhānaḥ
translated: Vishnu, the guardian, guards the highest path, holding the dear abodes, the immortal ones.

original: agniṣ ṭā viśvā bhuvanāni veda mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: agniḥ tā viśvā bhuvanāni veda mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: Agni knows all the worlds, the great one is the gods' sole lordship of the Asuras.

original: nānā cakrāte yamyā vapūṃṣi tayor anyad rocate kṛṣṇam anyat /
analyzed: nānā cakrāte yamyā vapūṃṣi tayoḥ anyat rocate kṛṣṇam anyat
translated: They have created various forms for the twins, one of them shines black, the other shines red.

original: śyāvī ca yad aruṣī ca svasārau mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: śyāvī ca yat aruṣī ca svasārau mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: And when the dark one and the red one are sisters, the great divinity of the gods is one and the same.

original: mātā ca yatra duhitā ca dhenū sabardughe dhāpayete samīcī /
analyzed: mātā ca yatra duhitā ca dhenū sabardughe dhāpayete samīcī
translated: Where the mother and the daughter, the two cows, are milked together, both yielding much milk,

original: ṛtasya te sadasīḷe antar mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: ṛtasya te sadasi īḍe antar mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: I enter the two seats of truth, the great divinity of the gods is one and the same.

original: anyasyā vatsaṃ rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā ni dadhe dhenur ūdhaḥ /
analyzed: anyasyāḥ vatsam rihatī mimāya kayā bhuvā ni dadhe dhenuḥ ūdhaḥ
translated: Licking the calf of one, thinking of the other, the cow has placed her udder on what ground?

original: ṛtasya sā payasāpinvateḷā mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: ṛtasya sā payasā apinvata iḷā mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: She swells with the milk of truth, the great divinity of the gods is one and the same.

original: padyā vaste pururūpā vapūṃṣy ūrdhvā tasthau tryaviṃ rerihāṇā /
analyzed: padyā vaste puru rūpā vapūṃṣi ūrdhvā tasthau tryavim rerihāṇā
translated: She wears the two feet, having many forms, standing erect, licking the three-footed one.

original: ṛtasya sadma vi carāmi vidvān mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: ṛtasya sadma vi carāmi vidvān mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: I go through the abode of truth, knowing, the great divinity of the gods is one and the same.

original: pade iva nihite dasme antas tayor anyad guhyam āvir anyat /
analyzed: pade iva nihite dasme antar tayoḥ anyat guhyam āvis anyat
translated: As if placed on two firm feet, between them, one is hidden, the other is manifest.

original: sadhrīcīnā pathyā sā viṣūcī mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: sadhrīcīnā pathyā sā viṣūcī mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: The straight path is in the same place, the crooked path is in the same place, the great divinity of the gods is one and the same.

original: ā dhenavo dhunayantām aśiśvīḥ sabardughāḥ śaśayā apradugdhāḥ /
analyzed: ā dhenavaḥ dhunayantām aśiśvīḥ sabardughāḥ śaśayāḥ a pradugdhāḥ
translated: Let the cows low, the young ones, the slow ones, the ones with calves, the ones yielding much milk, the ones not yet milked.

original: navyānavyā yuvatayo bhavantīr mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: navyā anavyāḥ yuvatayaḥ bhavantīḥ mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: The new and the old, the young and the old, the maidens, are the one great divine nature of the Asuras.

original: yad anyāsu vṛṣabho roravīti so anyasmin yūthe ni dadhāti retaḥ /
analyzed: yat anyāsu vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti saḥ anyasmin yūthe ni dadhāti retaḥ
translated: When the bull roars in other cows, he places his seed in another herd.

original: sa hi kṣapāvān sa bhagaḥ sa rājā mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: sa hi kṣapāvān sa bhagaḥ sa rājā mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: He is the one who protects the night, he is Bhaga, he is the king, the one great divine nature of the Asuras.

original: vīrasya nu svaśvyaṃ janāsaḥ pra nu vocāma vidur asya devāḥ /
analyzed: vīrasya nu su aśvyam janāsaḥ pra nu vocāma viduḥ asya devāḥ
translated: We will proclaim the swiftness of the horse of the hero to the people. The gods know this.

original: ṣoḷhā yuktāḥ pañcapañcā vahanti mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: ṣoḍhā yuktāḥ pañca pañcā vahanti mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: Sixteen are yoked, five by five, they carry. The one great divine nature of the Asuras.

original: devas tvaṣṭā savitā viśvarūpaḥ pupoṣa prajāḥ purudhā jajāna /
analyzed: devaḥ tvaṣṭā savitā viśva rūpaḥ pupoṣa prajāḥ purudhā jajāna
translated: The god Tvastr, Savitar, of all forms, nourished the creatures, he begot them in many ways.

original: imā ca viśvā bhuvanāny asya mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: imā ca viśvā bhuvanāni asya mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: And these all worlds are his. The one great divine nature of the Asuras.

original: mahī sam airac camvā samīcī ubhe te asya vasunā nyṛṣṭe /
analyzed: mahī sam airat camvā samīcī ubhe te asya vasunā nyṛṣṭe
translated: The great one has come together with the two bowls, both of them are filled with his wealth.

original: śṛṇve vīro vindamāno vasūni mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: śṛṇve vīraḥ vindamānaḥ vasūni mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: The hero is heard, obtaining treasures. The one great divine nature of the Asuras.

original: imāṃ ca naḥ pṛthivīṃ viśvadhāyā upa kṣeti hitamitro na rājā /
analyzed: imām ca naḥ pṛthivīm viśva dhāyai upa kṣeti hita mitraḥ na rājā
translated: And this earth, which supports all, he dwells upon, like a king with friendly allies.

original: puraḥsadaḥ śarmasado na vīrā mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: puraḥsadaḥ śarma sadaḥ na vīrāḥ mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: The one who sits in the fort, who sits in the shelter, like heroes. The one great divine nature of the Asuras.

original: niṣṣidhvarīs ta oṣadhīr utāpo rayiṃ ta indra pṛthivī bibharti /
analyzed: niṣṣidhvarīḥ te oṣadhīḥ uta apaḥ rayim te indra pṛthivī bibharti
translated: The plants and waters are thy warders, O Indra, and the earth supports thy wealth.

original: sakhāyas te vāmabhājaḥ syāma mahad devānām asuratvam ekam //
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ te vāma bhājaḥ syāma mahat devānām asura tvam ekam
translated: May we be thy friends who share thy gifts. Great is the one lordship of the gods, the Asuras.

original: na tā minanti māyino na dhīrā vratā devānām prathamā dhruvāṇi /
analyzed: na tā minanti māyinaḥ na dhīrāḥ vratā devānām prathamā dhruvāṇi
translated: Not the enchanters nor the wise ones diminish the ancient firm ordinances of the gods.

original: na rodasī adruhā vedyābhir na parvatā niname tasthivāṃsaḥ //
analyzed: na rodasī adruhā vedyābhiḥ na parvatāḥ niname tasthivāṃsaḥ
translated: Not the mountains, with their altars, nor the two worlds, with their deceits, can bend them, though they stand firm.

original: ṣaḍ bhārāṃ eko acaran bibharty ṛtaṃ varṣiṣṭham upa gāva āguḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṭ bhārān ekaḥ a caran bibharti ṛtam varṣiṣṭham upa gāvaḥ āguḥ
translated: One hath gone forth bearing six burdens. The cow hath come to the highest truth.

original: tisro mahīr uparās tasthur atyā guhā dve nihite darśy ekā //🔽tripājasyo vṛṣabho viśvarūpa uta tryudhā purudha prajāvān /
analyzed: tisraḥ mahīḥ uparāḥ tasthuḥ atyāḥ guhā dve nihite darśi ekā  tri pājasyaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ viśva rūpaḥ uta tri udhā purudha prajāvān
translated: Three great ones have stood in the highest place. Two are hidden in the cave, one is seen.🔽The bull of three supports, of all forms, and also of three kinds, is the lord of many offspring.

original: tryanīkaḥ patyate māhināvān sa retodhā vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnām //🔽abhīka āsām padavīr abodhy ādityānām ahve cāru nāma /
analyzed: tri anīkaḥ patyate māhināvān sa retaḥ dhāḥ vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnām  abhīke āsām padavīḥ abodhi ādityānām ahve cāru nāma
translated: The three-peaked one, possessing might, is the begetter of seed of all that are eternal.🔽He hath awakened to the paths of these (cows). I call by their fair names the Âdityas.

original: āpaś cid asmā aramanta devīḥ pṛthag vrajantīḥ pari ṣīm avṛñjan //
analyzed: āpaḥ cit asmai aramanta devīḥ pṛthak vrajantīḥ pari sīm avṛñjan
translated: Even the divine waters have delighted in him. They have chosen him, as they go their several ways.

original: trī ṣadhasthā sindhavas triḥ kavīnām uta trimātā vidatheṣu samrāṭ /
analyzed: trī sadhasthā sindhavaḥ tris kavīnām uta tri mātā vidatheṣu samrāj
translated: The rivers are in three places, the sages in three, and in three places the lord of the sacrifice.

original: ṛtāvarīr yoṣaṇās tisro apyās trir ā divo vidathe patyamānāḥ //🔽trir ā divaḥ savitar vāryāṇi divediva ā suva trir no ahnaḥ /🔽tridhātu rāya ā suvā vasūni bhaga trātar dhiṣaṇe sātaye dhāḥ //🔽trir ā divaḥ savitā soṣavīti rājānā mitrāvaruṇā supāṇī /🔽āpaś cid asya rodasī cid urvī ratnam bhikṣanta savituḥ savāya //🔽trir uttamā dūṇaśā rocanāni trayo rājanty asurasya vīrāḥ /
analyzed: ṛtāvarīḥ yoṣaṇāḥ tisraḥ apyāḥ tris ā divaḥ vidathe patyamānāḥ  tris ā divaḥ savitar vāryāṇi dive dive ā suva tris naḥ ahnaḥ  tri dhātu rāyaḥ ā suva ā vasūni bhaga trātar dhiṣaṇe sātaye dhāḥ  tris ā divaḥ savitā soṣavīti rājānā mitrāvaruṇā su pāṇī  āpaḥ cit asya rodasī cit urvī ratnam bhikṣanta savituḥ savāya  tris uttamā dūṇaśā rocanāni trayaḥ rājanti asurasya vīrāḥ

original: yā jāmayo vṛṣṇa icchanti śaktiṃ namasyantīr jānate garbham asmin /
analyzed: yāḥ jāmayaḥ vṛṣṇe icchanti śaktim namasyantīḥ jānate garbham asmin
translated: The sisters who desire the power of the Vṛṣṇi, who, worshipping, know the embryo in him,

original: acchā putraṃ dhenavo vāvaśānā mahaś caranti bibhrataṃ vapūṃṣi //🔽acchā vivakmi rodasī sumeke grāvṇo yujāno adhvare manīṣā /
analyzed: acchā putram dhenavaḥ vāvaśānāḥ mahaḥ caranti bibhratam vapūṃṣi  acchā vivakmi rodasī sumeke grāvṇaḥ yujānaḥ adhvare manīṣā
translated: The milch-cows lowing to their calves approach him, bearing their forms, the great one.🔽I look upon the well-formed heaven and earth, yoking the pressing-stones in the sacrifice with thought.

original: imā u te manave bhūrivārā ūrdhvā bhavanti darśatā yajatrāḥ //
analyzed: imāḥ u te manave bhūri vārāḥ ūrdhvāḥ bhavanti darśatāḥ yajatrāḥ
translated: These, most bountiful to men, thy holy rites, O thou who art seen, stand erect.

original: yā te jihvā madhumatī sumedhā agne deveṣūcyata urūcī /
analyzed: yā te jihvā madhumatī sumedhāḥ agne deveṣu ucyate urūcī
translated: Thy tongue, O Agni, which is sweet with honey, well-disposed, far-reaching, is called among the gods.

original: tayeha viśvāṃ avase yajatrān ā sādaya pāyayā cā madhūni //
analyzed: tayā iha viśvān avase yajatrān ā sādaya pāyaya cā madhūni
translated: With that, O holy one, seat here all the people for help, and make them drink the sweet juices.

original: yā te agne parvatasyeva dhārāsaścantī pīpayad deva citrā /
analyzed: yā te agne parvatasya iva dhārāḥ aścantī pīpayat deva citrā
translated: Thy flame, O Agni, which is like a mountain's peak, which, O god, is full of sweetness, and wonderful,

original: tām asmabhyam pramatiṃ jātavedo vaso rāsva sumatiṃ viśvajanyām //
analyzed: tām asmabhyam pramatim jātavedaḥ vaso rāsva sumatim viśvajanyām
translated: That favour, O all-knowing one, O Jātavedas, bestow on us, and thy good will which all men share.

original: dhenuḥ pratnasya kāmyaṃ duhānāntaḥ putraś carati dakṣiṇāyāḥ /
analyzed: dhenuḥ pratnasya kāmyam duhānā antar putraḥ carati dakṣiṇāyāḥ
translated: The milch-cow, pouring out the desire of the ancient one, moves within the daughter of the south.

original: ā dyotaniṃ vahati śubhrayāmoṣasa stomo aśvināv ajīgaḥ //
analyzed: ā dyotanim vahati śubhra yāmā uṣasaḥ stomaḥ aśvinau ajīgaḥ
translated: The bright one bears him to the light-bestowing one. I have obtained the praise, O Aśvins.

original: suyug vahanti prati vām ṛtenordhvā bhavanti pitareva medhāḥ /
analyzed: su yuj vahanti prati vām ṛtena ūrdhvāḥ bhavanti pitarā iva medhāḥ
translated: Well-yoked, they carry you by your own law. They stand erect, like the thought of the father.

original: jarethām asmad vi paṇer manīṣāṃ yuvor avaś cakṛmā yātam arvāk //
analyzed: jarethām asmat vi paṇeḥ manīṣām yuvoḥ avaḥ cakṛma yātam arvāk
translated: Destroy for us the thought of the foe: we have done your bidding: come hitherward.

original: suyugbhir aśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathena dasrāv imaṃ śṛṇutaṃ ślokam adreḥ /🔽kim aṅga vām praty avartiṃ gamiṣṭhāhur viprāso aśvinā purājāḥ //
analyzed: su yugbhiḥ aśvaiḥ suvṛtā rathena dasrau imam śṛṇutam ślokam adreḥ  kim aṅga vām prati avartim gamiṣṭhā āhuḥ viprāsaḥ aśvinā purājāḥ
translated: With well-yoked horses, with your well-built chariot, O ye Wonder-Workers, hear this song of the mountain.🔽Why, O ye Aṣvins, do the sages say that ye are most ready to come to their distress?

original: ā manyethām ā gataṃ kac cid evair viśve janāso aśvinā havante /
analyzed: ā manyethām ā gatam kad cit evaiḥ viśve janāsaḥ aśvinā havante
translated: I think ye will come: all men invoke you, O ye Aṣvins, even with the swift.

original: imā hi vāṃ goṛjīkā madhūni pra mitrāso na dadur usro agre //
analyzed: imā hi vām goṛjīkāḥ madhūni pra mitrāsaḥ na daduḥ usraḥ agre
translated: For these are your gifts of kine and meath: the friends have not given them to you as a present.

original: tiraḥ purū cid aśvinā rajāṃsy āṅgūṣo vām maghavānā janeṣu /
analyzed: tiras purū cit aśvinā rajāṃsi āṅgūṣaḥ vām maghavānā janeṣu
translated: O ye Aṣvins, through many a region, through the people, the bountiful one hath sent forth his praises to you.

original: eha yātam pathibhir devayānair dasrāv ime vāṃ nidhayo madhūnām //
analyzed: ā iha yātam pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ dasrau ime vām nidhayaḥ madhūnām
translated: Come hither on the paths which Gods have travelled: these are your meath-stores, O ye Wonder-Workers.

original: purāṇam okaḥ sakhyaṃ śivaṃ vāṃ yuvor narā draviṇaṃ jahnāvyām /
analyzed: purāṇam okaḥ sakhyam śivam vām yuvoḥ narā draviṇam jahnāvyām
translated: Your ancient home, your friendship, is propitious: ye Heroes have your treasure in the Jahnu.

original: punaḥ kṛṇvānāḥ sakhyā śivāni madhvā madema saha nū samānāḥ //
analyzed: punar kṛṇvānāḥ sakhyā śivāni madhvā madema saha nu samānāḥ
translated: Making anew your propitious friendships, let us rejoice in meath together, as of old.

original: aśvinā vāyunā yuvaṃ sudakṣā niyudbhiṣ ca sajoṣasā yuvānā /
analyzed: aśvinā vāyunā yuvam su dakṣā niyudbhiḥ ca sajoṣasā yuvānā
translated: O ye Aṣvins, with Vâyu, with Sudakshas, with the Nivid, with the young, accordant,

original: nāsatyā tiroahnyaṃ juṣāṇā somam pibatam asridhā sudānū //
analyzed: nāsatyā tiroahnyam juṣāṇā somam pibatam asridhā sudānū
translated: O Nâsatyas, rejoicing in the Soma, drink ye the meath-mixture, O ye Bounteous Ones.

original: aśvinā pari vām iṣaḥ purūcīr īyur gīrbhir yatamānā amṛdhrāḥ /
analyzed: aśvinā pari vām iṣaḥ purūcīḥ īyuḥ gīrbhiḥ yatamānāḥ amṛdhrāḥ
translated: O Asvins, many abundant viands have come to you, striving with songs, not failing.

original: ratho ha vām ṛtajā adrijūtaḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī yāti sadyaḥ //
analyzed: rathaḥ ha vām ṛta jāḥ adri jūtaḥ pari dyāvāpṛthivī yāti sadyas
translated: Your chariot, born of truth, urged on by the mountain, goes around heaven and earth in a moment.

original: aśvinā madhuṣuttamo yuvākuḥ somas tam pātam ā gataṃ duroṇe /
analyzed: aśvinā madhuṣuttamaḥ yuvākuḥ somaḥ tam pātam ā gatam duroṇe
translated: O Asvins, the most delightful Soma has been pressed for you. Drink it. Come to the house.

original: ratho ha vām bhūri varpaḥ karikrat sutāvato niṣkṛtam āgamiṣṭhaḥ //🔽mitro janān yātayati bruvāṇo mitro dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyām /
analyzed: rathaḥ ha vām bhūri varpaḥ karikrat sutāvataḥ niṣkṛtam āgamiṣṭhaḥ  mitraḥ janān yātayati bruvāṇaḥ mitraḥ dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyām
translated: Your chariot, of abundant form, moving swiftly, has come to the one who has pressed (the Soma) to repay (your favor).🔽Mitra, speaking, guides the people. Mitra supports the earth and the sky.

original: mitraḥ kṛṣṭīr animiṣābhi caṣṭe mitrāya havyaṃ ghṛtavaj juhota //
analyzed: mitraḥ kṛṣṭīḥ animiṣa abhi caṣṭe mitrāya havyam ghṛtavat juhota
translated: Mitra watches over the people with unblinking eyes. Offer oblations mixed with ghee to Mitra.

original: pra sa mitra marto astu prayasvān yas ta āditya śikṣati vratena /
analyzed: pra sa mitra martaḥ astu prayasvān yaḥ te āditya śikṣati vratena
translated: May that mortal be prosperous, O Mitra, who, O Āditya, follows your rule.

original: na hanyate na jīyate tvoto nainam aṃho aśnoty antito na dūrāt //
analyzed: na hanyate na jīyate tvotaḥ na enam aṃhaḥ aśnoti antitas na dūrāt
translated: He is not killed, he is not defeated, he who is protected by you. Evil does not touch him from near or far.

original: anamīvāsa iḷayā madanto mitajñavo varimann ā pṛthivyāḥ /
analyzed: anamīvāsaḥ iḷayā madantaḥ mitajñavaḥ variman ā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Free from disease, rejoicing in strength, knowing the measure, on the wide earth,

original: ādityasya vratam upakṣiyanto vayam mitrasya sumatau syāma //
analyzed: ādityasya vratam upakṣiyantaḥ vayam mitrasya sumatau syāma
translated: approaching the rule of the Āditya, may we be in the good grace of Mitra.

original: ayam mitro namasyaḥ suśevo rājā sukṣatro ajaniṣṭa vedhāḥ /
analyzed: ayam mitraḥ namasyaḥ su śevaḥ rājā su kṣatraḥ ajaniṣṭa vedhāḥ
translated: This Mitra, to be revered, very gracious, the king of good rule, the creator, is born.

original: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma //
analyzed: tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma
translated: May we be in the favour and good will of him, the adorable one, at his glad carouse.

original: mahāṃ ādityo namasopasadyo yātayajjano gṛṇate suśevaḥ /
analyzed: mahān ādityaḥ namasā upasadyaḥ yātayat janaḥ gṛṇate su śevaḥ
translated: The great Āditya, to be approached with homage, the people who offer sacrifices, is gracious to the singer.

original: tasmā etat panyatamāya juṣṭam agnau mitrāya havir ā juhota //
analyzed: tasmai etat panyatamāya juṣṭam agnau mitrāya haviḥ ā juhota
translated: To him, the most excellent, the most beloved, offer in the fire this oblation to Mitra.

original: mitrasya carṣaṇīdhṛto 'vo devasya sānasi /
analyzed: mitrasya carṣaṇī dhṛtaḥ vaḥ devasya sānasi
translated: Of Mitra, the supporter of men, the god, the bountiful,

original: dyumnaṃ citraśravastamam //
analyzed: dyumnam citraśravastamam
translated: The glory most renowned in variegated splendour.

original: abhi yo mahinā divam mitro babhūva saprathāḥ /
analyzed: abhi yaḥ mahinā divam mitraḥ babhūva saprathāḥ
translated: He who by his greatness became Mitra in heaven, the all-pervading,

original: abhi śravobhiḥ pṛthivīm //
analyzed: abhi śravobhiḥ pṛthivīm
translated: By his fame on earth.

original: mitrāya pañca yemire janā abhiṣṭiśavase /
analyzed: mitrāya pañca yemire janāḥ abhiṣṭi śavase
translated: Five peoples have submitted to Mitra for his overlordship,

original: sa devān viśvān bibharti //
analyzed: sa devān viśvān bibharti
translated: He supports all the gods.

original: mitro deveṣv āyuṣu janāya vṛktabarhiṣe /
analyzed: mitraḥ deveṣu āyuṣu janāya vṛkta barhiṣe
translated: Mitra to the gods, to the people who have strewn the sacred grass,

original: iṣa iṣṭavratā akaḥ //
analyzed: iṣaḥ iṣṭa vratāḥ akaḥ
translated: Has made food for him who has fulfilled his vows.

original: iheha vo manasā bandhutā nara uśijo jagmur abhi tāni vedasā /
analyzed: iha iha vaḥ manasā bandhu tā naraḥ uśijaḥ jagmuḥ abhi tāni vedasā
translated: Here, O men, with your mind, have the eager ones gone to the kinship, to those (sacrifices) with wealth,

original: yābhir māyābhiḥ pratijūtivarpasaḥ saudhanvanā yajñiyam bhāgam ānaśa //
analyzed: yābhiḥ māyābhiḥ pratijūti varpasaḥ saudhanvanāḥ yajñiyam bhāgam ānaśa
translated: By which (sacrifices) the sons of Sudhanvan, changing their appearance by their powers, have obtained their share in the sacrifice.

original: yābhiḥ śacībhiś camasāṃ apiṃśata yayā dhiyā gām ariṇīta carmaṇaḥ /
analyzed: yābhiḥ śacībhiḥ camasān apiṃśata yayā dhiyā gām ariṇīta carmaṇaḥ
translated: By which powers they filled the goblet, by which wisdom they brought the cow out of the skin,

original: yena harī manasā niratakṣata tena devatvam ṛbhavaḥ sam ānaśa //
analyzed: yena harī manasā niratakṣata tena deva tvam ṛbhavaḥ sam ānaśa
translated: By which mind ye fashioned the two bay horses, by that, O Ṛbhus, ye attained godhead.

original: indrasya sakhyam ṛbhavaḥ sam ānaśur manor napāto apaso dadhanvire /
analyzed: indrasya sakhyam ṛbhavaḥ sam ānaśuḥ manoḥ napātaḥ apasaḥ dadhanvire
translated: The Ṛbhus attained the friendship of Indra, the grandsons of Manu spread out the implements.

original: saudhanvanāso amṛtatvam erire viṣṭvī śamībhiḥ sukṛtaḥ sukṛtyayā //
analyzed: saudhanvanāsaḥ amṛta tvam erire viṣṭvī śamībhiḥ su kṛtaḥ su kṛtyayā
translated: The sons of Sudhanvan attained immortality, the well-made ones with their own good deeds.

original: indreṇa yātha sarathaṃ sute sacāṃ atho vaśānām bhavathā saha śriyā /
analyzed: indreṇa yātha sa ratham sute sacā am atha u vaśānām bhavathā saha śriyā
translated: With Indra you go together in the chariot to the pressed (Soma), then be with the cows and with glory.

original: na vaḥ pratimai sukṛtāni vāghataḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo vīryāṇi ca //
analyzed: na vaḥ pratimai su kṛtāni vāghataḥ saudhanvanāḥ ṛbhavaḥ vīryāṇi ca
translated: The performer of good deeds does not rival your good deeds, O sons of Sudhanvan, and your heroic deeds, O Ṛbhus.

original: indra ṛbhubhir vājavadbhiḥ samukṣitaṃ sutaṃ somam ā vṛṣasvā gabhastyoḥ /
analyzed: indra ṛbhubhiḥ vājavadbhiḥ samukṣitam sutam somam ā vṛṣasva gabhastyoḥ
translated: With Indra, the Ṛbhus, and the powerful ones, enjoy the pressed Soma that is offered in the arms.

original: dhiyeṣito maghavan dāśuṣo gṛhe saudhanvanebhiḥ saha matsvā nṛbhiḥ //
analyzed: dhiyā iṣitaḥ maghavan dāśuṣaḥ gṛhe saudhanvanebhiḥ saha matsva nṛbhiḥ
translated: Urged by the thoughts, O bountiful one, in the house of the worshipper, rejoice with the sons of Sudhanvan and with men.

original: indra ṛbhumān vājavān matsveha no 'smin savane śacyā puruṣṭuta /
analyzed: indra ṛbhumān vājavān matsva iha naḥ smin savane śacyā puruṣṭuta
translated: O Indra, accompanied by the Ṛbhus and the powerful ones, rejoice here, at this libation, with Śacī, O much-praised one.

original: imāni tubhyaṃ svasarāṇi yemire vratā devānām manuṣaś ca dharmabhiḥ //
analyzed: imāni tubhyam svasarāṇi yemire vratā devānām manuṣaḥ ca dharmabhiḥ
translated: These your own gatherings have waited for you, the vows of the gods and of men by the rules.

original: indra ṛbhubhir vājibhir vājayann iha stomaṃ jaritur upa yāhi yajñiyam /
analyzed: indra ṛbhubhiḥ vājibhiḥ vājayan iha stomam jarituḥ upa yāhi yajñiyam
translated: O Indra, accompanied by the Ṛbhus and the strong ones, urged on by the praise of the singer, come to the sacrificial offering.

original: śataṃ ketebhir iṣirebhir āyave sahasraṇītho adhvarasya homani //
analyzed: śatam ketebhiḥ iṣirebhiḥ āyave sahasraṇīthaḥ adhvarasya homani
translated: With a hundred swift-moving horses, with a thousand chariots, at the offering of the sacrifice.

original: uṣo vājena vājini pracetā stomaṃ juṣasva gṛṇato maghoni /🔽purāṇī devi yuvatiḥ purandhir anu vrataṃ carasi viśvavāre //
analyzed: uṣaḥ vājena vājini pracetāḥ stomam juṣasva gṛṇataḥ maghoni  purāṇī devi yuvatiḥ purandhiḥ anu vratam carasi viśva vāre
translated: O Uṣas, O powerful one, with your strength, O wise one, accept the praise of the singer, O wealthy one.🔽O ancient goddess, O young maiden, O rich one, you follow the vow, O you who have all things.

original: uṣo devy amartyā vi bhāhi candrarathā sūnṛtā īrayantī /
analyzed: uṣaḥ devī amartyā vi bhāhi candra rathā sūnṛtāḥ īrayantī
translated: O immortal goddess Uṣas, shine forth, O you whose chariot is the moon, sending forth pleasant things.

original: ā tvā vahantu suyamāso aśvā hiraṇyavarṇām pṛthupājaso ye //
analyzed: ā tvā vahantu su yamāsaḥ aśvāḥ hiraṇya varṇām pṛthu pājasaḥ ye
translated: Let your well-controlled horses, golden-colored, of wide splendor, carry you.

original: uṣaḥ pratīcī bhuvanāni viśvordhvā tiṣṭhasy amṛtasya ketuḥ /
analyzed: uṣaḥ pratīcī bhuvanāni viśvā ūrdhvā tiṣṭhasi amṛtasya ketuḥ
translated: O Uṣas, facing the worlds, you stand erect, the banner of the immortal.

original: samānam arthaṃ caraṇīyamānā cakram iva navyasy ā vavṛtsva //🔽ava syūmeva cinvatī maghony uṣā yāti svasarasya patnī /
analyzed: samānam artham caraṇīyamānā cakram iva navyasī ā vavṛtsva  ava syūma iva cinvatī maghonī uṣāḥ yāti svasarasya patnī
translated: Seeking the same goal, turn to us as if to a new wheel.🔽The generous one, like a weaver, arranging the threads, moves on, Uṣas, the wife of the lord of the house.

original: svar janantī subhagā sudaṃsā āntād divaḥ papratha ā pṛthivyāḥ //
analyzed: svar janantī subhagā su daṃsāḥ ā antāt divaḥ paprathe ā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Creating the light, fortunate, of good counsel, she extends from the end of the sky to the earth.

original: acchā vo devīm uṣasaṃ vibhātīm pra vo bharadhvaṃ namasā suvṛktim /
analyzed: acchā vaḥ devīm uṣasam vibhātīm pra vaḥ bharadhvam namasā suvṛktim
translated: Come to the radiant goddess Uṣas, the shining one. Offer her your homage with a good hymn.

original: ūrdhvam madhudhā divi pājo aśret pra rocanā ruruce raṇvasaṃdṛk //
analyzed: ūrdhvam madhu dhāḥ divi pājaḥ aśret pra rocanā ruruce raṇva saṃdṛś
translated: The light has risen in the sky, like honey, the beautiful-looking one shines forth, the radiant one.

original: ṛtāvarī divo arkair abodhy ā revatī rodasī citram asthāt /
analyzed: ṛtāvarī divaḥ arkaiḥ abodhi ā revatī rodasī citram asthāt
translated: The truthful one has awakened with the rays of heaven; the rich one has shone forth in wondrous manner over the two world-halves.

original: āyatīm agna uṣasaṃ vibhātīṃ vāmam eṣi draviṇam bhikṣamāṇaḥ //🔽ṛtasya budhna uṣasām iṣaṇyan vṛṣā mahī rodasī ā viveśa /
analyzed: āyatīm agne uṣasam vibhātīm vāmam eṣi draviṇam bhikṣamāṇaḥ  ṛtasya budhne uṣasām iṣaṇyan vṛṣā mahī rodasī ā viveśa
translated: Approaching, O Agni, the shining dawn, thou goest to beg the wealth which is good.🔽The strong one, hasting with the dawns to the foundation of holy order, hath entered the two great world-halves.

original: mahī mitrasya varuṇasya māyā candreva bhānuṃ vi dadhe purutrā //🔽imā u vām bhṛmayo manyamānā yuvāvate na tujyā abhūvan /
analyzed: mahī mitrasya varuṇasya māyā candrā iva bhānum vi dadhe purutrā  imāḥ u vām bhṛmayaḥ manyamānāḥ yuvāvate na tujyāḥ abhūvan
translated: The great magic power of Mitra and Varuna hath spread in many places the light like the moon.🔽These two of you, O Indra and Varuna, who are conceited with your might, have become unassailable to the young.

original: kva tyad indrāvaruṇā yaśo vāṃ yena smā sinam bharathaḥ sakhibhyaḥ //
analyzed: kva tyad indrāvaruṇāḥ yaśaḥ vām yena smā sinam bharathaḥ sakhibhyaḥ
translated: Where is that glory of yours, O Indra and Varuna, by which ye bestow favour on your friends?

original: ayam u vām purutamo rayīyañ chaśvattamam avase johavīti /
analyzed: ayam u vām purutamaḥ rayīyam śaśvattamam avase johavīti
translated: This one, the most abundant, the most constant, calls you for help.

original: sajoṣāv indrāvaruṇā marudbhir divā pṛthivyā śṛṇutaṃ havam me //
analyzed: sajoṣau indrāvaruṇāḥ marudbhiḥ divā pṛthivyā śṛṇutam havam me
translated: O Indra and Varuna, in accord with the Maruts, hear my call by day and night.

original: asme tad indrāvaruṇā vasu ṣyād asme rayir marutaḥ sarvavīraḥ /
analyzed: asme tat indrāvaruṇāḥ vasu syāt asme rayiḥ marutaḥ sarva vīraḥ
translated: May that wealth be ours, O Indra and Varuna, may wealth be ours, O Maruts, with all heroes.

original: asmān varūtrīḥ śaraṇair avantv asmān hotrā bhāratī dakṣiṇābhiḥ //
analyzed: asmān varūtrīḥ śaraṇaiḥ avantu asmān hotrā bhāratī dakṣiṇābhiḥ
translated: May the protectresses with their shelters favour us, may the Hotr Bharati with the sacrificial fees.

original: bṛhaspate juṣasva no havyāni viśvadevya /
analyzed: bṛhaspate juṣasva naḥ havyāni viśvadevya
translated: O Brihaspati, accept our offerings, O you of all the deities.

original: rāsva ratnāni dāśuṣe //
analyzed: rāsva ratnāni dāśuṣe
translated: Bestow treasures on the worshipper.

original: śucim arkair bṛhaspatim adhvareṣu namasyata /
analyzed: śucim arkaiḥ bṛhaspatim adhvareṣu namasyata
translated: Purify Brihaspati with the rays, worship him at the sacrifices.

original: anāmy oja ā cake //
analyzed: anāmi ojaḥ ā cake
translated: Do not bend your strength.

original: vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnāṃ viśvarūpam adābhyam /
analyzed: vṛṣabham carṣaṇīnām viśva rūpam adābhyam
translated: The bull of men, of all forms, unerring,

original: bṛhaspatiṃ vareṇyam //
analyzed: bṛhaspatim vareṇyam
translated: Brihaspati, the most excellent.

original: iyaṃ te pūṣann āghṛṇe suṣṭutir deva navyasī /
analyzed: iyam te pūṣan āghṛṇe suṣṭutiḥ deva navyasī
translated: This, O Pusan, O blameless one, is your new praise, O god,

original: asmābhis tubhyaṃ śasyate //
analyzed: asmābhiḥ tubhyam śasyate
translated: is extolled for you by us.

original: tāṃ juṣasva giram mama vājayantīm avā dhiyam /
analyzed: tām juṣasva giram mama vājayantīm avā dhiyam
translated: Accept this song of mine, which brings strength, and the thought,

original: vadhūyur iva yoṣaṇām //
analyzed: vadhūyuḥ iva yoṣaṇām
translated: like a young woman longing for a husband.

original: yo viśvābhi vipaśyati bhuvanā saṃ ca paśyati /
analyzed: yaḥ viśvā abhi vipaśyati bhuvanā sam ca paśyati
translated: He who looks on all existing things and sees them together,

original: sa naḥ pūṣāvitā bhuvat //
analyzed: sa naḥ pūṣā avitā bhuvat
translated: may that Pusan be our protector.

original: tat savitur vareṇyam bhargo devasya dhīmahi /
analyzed: tat savituḥ vareṇyam bhargaḥ devasya dhīmahi
translated: We meditate on the excellent glory of that Savitar, the god,

original: dhiyo yo naḥ pracodayāt //🔽devasya savitur vayaṃ vājayantaḥ purandhyā /
analyzed: dhiyaḥ yaḥ naḥ pracodayāt  devasya savituḥ vayam vājayantaḥ purandhyā
translated: who may impel our thoughts.🔽We, longing for strength, with devotion,

original: bhagasya rātim īmahe //🔽devaṃ naraḥ savitāraṃ viprā yajñaiḥ suvṛktibhiḥ /
analyzed: bhagasya rātim īmahe  devam naraḥ savitāram viprāḥ yajñaiḥ suvṛktibhiḥ
translated: to the gift of Bhaga, we pray.🔽The men, the seers, with sacrifices and good hymns,

original: namasyanti dhiyeṣitāḥ //
analyzed: namasyanti dhiyā iṣitāḥ
translated: worship the god Savitar, urged by thought.

original: somo jigāti gātuvid devānām eti niṣkṛtam /
analyzed: somaḥ jigāti gātu vid devānām eti niṣkṛtam
translated: Soma goes, finding the way, to the place of the gods,

original: ṛtasya yonim āsadam //
analyzed: ṛtasya yonim āsadam
translated: to the womb of truth.

original: somo asmabhyaṃ dvipade catuṣpade ca paśave /
analyzed: somaḥ asmabhyam dvipade catuṣpade ca paśave
translated: May Soma grant us food free from sickness, for the biped and quadruped,

original: anamīvā iṣas karat //
analyzed: anamīvāḥ iṣas karat
translated: for our cattle.

original: asmākam āyur vardhayann abhimātīḥ sahamānaḥ /
analyzed: asmākam āyuḥ vardhayan abhimātīḥ sahamānaḥ
translated: Increasing our life, overcoming our hostilities,

original: somaḥ sadhastham āsadat //🔽ā no mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtair gavyūtim ukṣatam /
analyzed: somaḥ sadhastham āsadat  ā naḥ mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtaiḥ gavyūtim ukṣatam
translated: Soma has sat down in his place.🔽O Mitra and Varuna, sprinkle the path with ghee,

original: madhvā rajāṃsi sukratū //
analyzed: madhvā rajāṃsi su kratū
translated: The regions with honey, O you of good rites.

original: uruśaṃsā namovṛdhā mahnā dakṣasya rājathaḥ /
analyzed: uru śaṃsā namaḥ vṛdhā mahnā dakṣasya rājathaḥ
translated: O you of wide fame, you who increase honour, you rule by the greatness of your power,

original: drāghiṣṭhābhiḥ śucivratā //🔽gṛṇānā jamadagninā yonāv ṛtasya sīdatam /
analyzed: drāghiṣṭhābhiḥ śuci vratā  gṛṇānā jamadagninā yonau ṛtasya sīdatam
translated: With the most far-reaching pure vows.🔽Praised by Jamadagni, sit in the womb of truth.

original: pātaṃ somam ṛtāvṛdhā //
analyzed: pātam somam ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: Drink the Soma, you who increase the truth.
